Name: Phillip's review
Review Content: Avani Hotel Namibia: Exceptionalphillipsenga3@gmail.comreview avani hotel in Namibia windhoek in 230 words Expressing their good services The Avani Hotel in Windhoek, Namibia is a fantastic destination for travelers seeking comfortable accommodations and exceptional service. From the moment guests arrive, they are greeted with warm hospitality and attention to detail that sets this hotel apart.The rooms at Avani Hotel are spacious and beautifully decorated with modern amenities to ensure a comfortable stay. The staff is always available to assist with any needs, and their professionalism and friendly demeanor make guests feel right at home.The hotel's dining options are also impressive, with a variety of cuisines to choose from, including local Namibian dishes that allow guests to experience the country's culinary culture. The breakfast buffet is particularly noteworthy, with a wide range of fresh fruits, bread, pastries, and hot dishes.For those looking to relax and unwind, the Avani Hotel has a beautiful pool area surrounded by lush greenery, as well as a spa and fitness center that are well-equipped and maintained. The hotel's location is also convenient for exploring the city, with many attractions and restaurants within walking distance.Overall, the Avani Hotel in Windhoek, Namibia is a top-notch destination for travelers looking for a comfortable, luxurious stay with exceptional service. The staff's attention to detail and commitment to providing excellent service make this hotel a standout choice for visitors to Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: March 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Well prepared meal and good service
Review Content: After our morning exercises, me and my wife decided to have breakfast at Avani Windhoek Hotel (Pantry). The service was topnotch and especially the food cooked by Chef Julia was well prepared and looked presentable. Well done Julia, we are looking forward to have many more meals at Avani Windhoek Hotel.RegardsSilas
Date: Date of stay: November 2021This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Lovely Namibia
Review Content: I stayed in this hotel many years ago, when it was called the Kalahari Sands Hotel, the building is the same but a very clean, modern, internal transformation has taken place. Big rooms with lovely comfy beds and refreshing bathrooms. Windhoek has changed dramatically, for the better, since my last visit in 2009. I still remembered the lovely food, wines, beers and friendly people. The hotel is a mixture of business and big tourist parties, who check in for the night and disappear next morning on their game drives. I only ate breakfast in The Pantry and it was very good, served by extremly friendly, happy staff who always looked after my every needs. My thanks go to Ruth and Jakobina, the housekeepers who kept my room spotless, Ananias my breakfast waiter, and Ronald the poolbar waiter who made a very good Dom Pedro. I watched the South African rugby first match with a fellow supporter and on my last night he wished me safe journey, he was the Sales and Marketing Manager, no air and graces, just a person doing a very good job leading his team. Once again thank you all for a lovely stay and will be seeing you soon.
Date: Date of stay: September 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Review Content: The service at Stratos was fantastic,I enjoyed it so much. Especially the lady with the blonde made us laugh so hard, I don’t remember the last time I’ve been out and all the problems of the world disappeared. We had the salmon and oxtail. It was so delicious. We will definitely come back to the rooftop. PS the hostess deserves a bonus!

Name: Was a great Experience
Review Content: I love staying at avani windhoek hotel. It is right in the city, everything is quick and accessible. Always receive a warm welcome front the front desk. A special thanks to Layla, Kavee and Manfred for making my stay wonderful. Impeccable hospitality!

Review Content: Had an amazing meal at stratos bar at avani hotel Windhoek. Justina made it so much more memorable with her positive energy and excellent service. Will definitely come back to this restaurant on my next visit. From mid blue😉

Review Content: The overall stay was excellent, there was just a slow service on the room service. Food was fantastic and well presented. Staff were very polite and generous and the place is safe and well secured. Located well in the city.

Review Content: Silvia what a waiter . Her service was superb.  She is professional , Kind and very caring , i would recommend my friend to be served by Silvia should the come to Pantry , it was delightful day for me at pantry thanks to silvia . If it were up to me i would vote her Employee of the Month and year .

Review Content: Shanice was very welcoming and such a great hostess. The view is out of this world, beautiful and breathtaking. I had a salmon fish and it was delicious. I really enjoyed the strictly soul they had Saturday,great music. All the waitors were nice. Keanu, Jerry, Sammy, Ray as well.

Review Content: I went to the rooftop bar with two friends of mine and we had a really good time. The view was amazing! We saw the sunset, what made the atmosphere awesome!! Our waiter was really nice, unfortunately I don't know how to write his name...maybe sheid :-)We had a great evening!

Name: Stratos bar
Review Content: We had great kapana yesterday. Great people especially Shahid and the hostess shanice. They were very welcoming. I felt at home. Nice cold Beers.  The refills kept coming. Can't wait to come back. Definitely coming back.
Date: Date of stay: June 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Komfortabel aber unpersönlich
Review Content: Das Hotel liegt mitten im Zentrum, alles ist zu Fuß zu erreichen, Sehenswürdigkeiten, Geschäfte, Restaurants. Dabei sollte man jedoch nicht vergessen, dass samstags ab ca. 14.00 Uhr in Windhoek alles geschlossen ist. Im Restaurant des Hotesls kostet das Abendessen (Büffet) den Festpreis von ca. € 19, sonntags ab ca. € 22. Ungewöhnlich ist, dass die Rezeption im 4. Stock eines Einkaufszentrums liegt und nicht von der Straße aus zu erreichen ist. Praktisch ist der kostenlose Parkplatz im angrenzenden Parkhaus, vom dem aus man direkt ins Hotel gelangt.Unser Zimmer (Nr. 1109) war sehr groß, sehr gut eingerichtet, schönes Bad, Safe, großer Schrank,,, alles vorhanden und sehr sauber.Der Pool auf der Dachterrasse ist absolut unattraktiv, zu klein, unansehnlich.Das Frühstück war wirklich ausgezeichnet, sehr reichhaltig und gut.Zu bemängeln haben wir die totale Anonymität des Hotels, das Personal an der Rezeption, in der Bar, im Restaurant ist unfreundlich, wenig hilfsbereit, sehr umständlich. Kein Lächeln, nicht einmal ein "hello" zur Begrüßung.
Date: Date of stay: September 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Une étape parfaite au départ ou à l’arrivée à Windhoek
Review Content: Nous avons séjourné 1 nuit à notre arrivée à Windhoek. Chambre parfaite, insonorisation, climatisation, 2 lits super confortables très appréciés après une nuit en vol depuis Paris et une journée de transfert depuis JNB. Le top fut le petit déjeuner buffet succulent le lendemain (inclus dans prix si vous passez par centrale de réservation -comme nous-, moins cher que le prix d’une guesthouse). Standard européen-américain mais ne cherchez pas le charme. Wifi payant assez bon débit mais pas cher. Par contre, un seul bémol la réception a très peu de carte d’accès aux chambres ! Un gardien nous a accompagné jusqu’à notre chambre et sommes restés sans carte. Suis descendu à la réception une heure plus tard et ai récupéré une carte. Nous avons pu sortir diner sans problème. Hôtel central, situé dans centre commercial, banque dans le hall, parking sous hôtel mais quartier visiblement « chaud » la nuit avec dames très peu vêtues derrière l’hôtel.
Date: Date of stay: July 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: In the centre of the capital
Review Content: Open windows to Africa. Good localisation. Good waiters. Good dining room and bar. Wonderful sunset. A little swimming pool on the roof.Some problems about Wi-Fi. Different cook every day.You must try this hotel. Is really good.
Date: Date of stay: August 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Attenzione al parcheggio!
Review Content: Sono il proprietario dell'auto cui e' stato rotto il vetro con furto e danno importante nel parcheggio custodito  lo scorso 07 dicembre. Dopo fitta corrispondenza con la Direzione e un nuovo soggiorno nell'albergo mi e' stato rifiutato un risarcimento anche minimo adducendo risibili argomenti. Prossimamente postero' le mie ragioni in Inglese perché tutti possano prudenzialmente evitare questo Hotel.
Date: Date of stay: June 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bem localizado
Review Content: Próximo a várias lojas, à igreja "cartão postal", e ao zoo park. Boa estrutura, dentro de um mini shopping, tem um casino dentro do hotel. Quarto amplo, bom banheiro, serviço normal, frio porém satisfatório, café da manha ótimo. Boa escolha em Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: March 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: 3 warm winter nights at the Kalahari Sands Hotel
Review Content: Spent 4 days and 3 nights at Kalahari Sands Hotel in the city of Namibia, Windhoek. The check in process was swift and easy.  The chambermaid took note of all my requests and made our stay  pleasant. The security man stationed at the lift would promptly usher the guests to the waiting elevators.
Date: Date of stay: July 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A double room in Namibia is a twin room- 2 single beds in UK !
Review Content: A VERY BAD EXPERIENCE AT KALAHARI SANDS HOTEL!!!I booked my hotel online at octopustravel.co.uk. A very good site to get good deals on good hotels. I left UK@8pm on a flight to Windhoek in Namibia. I did not have a direct flight so I had to change in J.B. I did not get to the hotel until 3 pm the next day after 15-17 hours journey. I was very very tired! I had a copy of my confirmation of my hotel room (a double room) and my ref no with me.I presented my copy to the receptionist of the hotel expecting to get my key and walk to my room (that was my desperate wish- I was falling asleep while talking). 2 hours later I was still at the reception explaining that I have booked a double room, expecting to get a double bed not a twin room with 2 single beds. When I booked online my room, I was given the option of; a twin room, meaning to me 2 single beds or a double room expecting a double bed. I have booked a double room so I can sleep next to my husband not miles away on a single bed!!!I had no choice other than to use my mob to call the travel agent in UK to explain my problem. A very nice lady from the Customer service in UK- octopus travel.co.uk , she was a really big help to me-  helping me to get my double bed I have booked online ( sorry I don’t know her name ,I would like to say a big thank you for her appreciated help ).  She also agreed with me that I have booked a double room and I believe like myself expecting me to get a double bed. I was called back in 20 min l and I was told that I should get a double room at no extra cost and that now there is a double bed available for me, originally told a standard double bed was not available for me. With the help of this wonderful lady ,  after nearly 3 hours wait I got a room with 2 double beds at no extra cost ( I only needed one bed). The hotel receptionist told me that if I want a double bed then I will need to pay extra about 50-60 EURO per night. Thanks to Customer service in UK I did not have to pay any extra money for my double bed I originally booked online.THE HOTEL !!!NOT A 5 * HOTEL! GOOD LOCATION ONLY CLOSE TO TOWN CENTRE AND SHOPPING BUT... A VERY BUSY PLACE ! ONE OTHER NIGHT I STAYED IN A 4 * HOTEL SAFARI COURT - BIGGER ROOMS - MUCH BETTER VALUE FOR MONEY AND BETTER VIEW!!! THE BAR OF THE KALAHARI SANDS HOTEL I personally BELIEVE IS WELL KNOWN BY PROSTITUTE!!! SO IF YOU ARE SITTING WITHOUT A MAN NEXT TOU YOU - OTHERS MAY BELIEVE - YOU ARE A PROSTITUTE!!! ... HAPPEND TO ME!!! - PLEASE BELIEVE ME   ...I DONT DRESS OR LOOK LIKE ONE OF THEM! I hope my experience will help others!
Date: Date of stay: September 2009This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: HOTEL CLASSIQUE INTERNATIONAL
Review Content: L’hôtel est situé en centre-ville et permet de visiter la rue principale avec ses boutiques artisanales.Les chambres sont spacieuses, elles restent internationales avec tout le confort que peut offrir ce type de chaîne.La qualité du service est celle des grandes chaines avec une indifférence totale du personnel.Au petit déjeuner, le personnel de service a été limite du point de vue serviabilité.Ne rien attendre de particulier avec ce type d’hôtel.Il donne un avant-goût du retour dans son pays d’origine.
Date: Date of stay: September 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel classique, moderne en plein centre ville
Review Content: Situé en plein centre vile, près d'un centre commercial et d'un marché artisanal, il est idéal pour une fin de séjour et terminer ses achats de souvenirs. La chambre est classique des grands hôtels, calme, agréable. Il y a 4 ascenseurs pour accéder aux chambres et pas de temps d'attente. la clim et le Wifi fonctionnent parfaitement. Nous n'y avons pris que le petit déjeuner de type international dans une vaste salle lumineuse avec de grandes baies vitrées d'où nous avons pu assister à un défilé de femmes militaires et policiers...
Date: Date of stay: June 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bien situé et moderne
Review Content: Hôtel de conception récente et très moderne, situé en plein centre ville à proximité à pied de tous les centres d'intérêts, 14 étages avec ascenseurs (très capricieux, on attend souvent assez longtemps pour en obtenir un malgré le fait qu'il y en a trois). La chambre (la notre au 10ème étage) est de très grande surface, très grand lit king size, literie récente, salle de bain avec douche à l'italienne et baignoire, produits d'accueil, nombre de serviettes à disposition, vue magnifique sur la ville, double rideau occultant efficace, TV écran plat de grande largeur, climatisation efficace, réfrigérateur, bouteilles d'eau fournis...vraiment une très belle surprise digne d'un 3 étoiles. Question accueil vraiment efficace et souriant de même qu'au restaurant. Concernant la restauration vraiment beaucoup de choix et le petit déjeuner, je n'ai jamais vu durant tout mon cicuit de 10 jours en Namibie un tel choix, c'est incroyable le nombre de mets proposé ici: en sucré, salé, chaud, froid, fruits frais, laitage, pains, viennoiseries, boissons de toutes sortes  je ne peux tout énumérer tant il y en a et pourtant j'ai, voyagé mais ici c'est exceptionnel!!!  Wifi enfin efficace partout dans l'hôtel, vous avez aussi un casino au sous sol et surtout un accès direct au mall commercial attenant. Le paradis hôtelier n'est plus très loin.
Date: Date of stay: November 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good location but the refurbishment is disruptive
Review Content: Great location in the centre of town. As it’s easy to drive in Windhoek we picked up our hire car at the airport and went for the free hotel car parking option. However, with all the refurbishment work to the hotel and the multi-storey car park, it was very difficult to find the access. We ended up having to park on the road, find our way in via the shopping centre to the first floor reception to then get car park directions to their fourth floor car park as there were no signs visible for either the hotel or its car park with all the scaffolding everywhere. My husband thought the hotel was closed and nearly went elsewhere as he was so fed up driving around in circles trying to find the entrance. It’s a very busy hotel and with not all their small lifts working, it took a long time to get between the room and restaurant etc. That said we had a very nice clean room on a high floor and once the whole hotel refurbishment has completed, I’d consider using again but not during the refurbishment.
Date: Date of stay: October 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Business hotel in the heart of Windhoek
Review Content: We arrived and found the hotel didn't have our reservation which was booked through Expedia.com.  We had also pre-paid the hotel as if we hadn't we would have stayed at another property. The hotel required proof we paid, proof of our booking, and took over 45 minutes to check us in.  In the meantime we went to the Sunday lunch buffet which was pricey but tasty with truly exceptional service. The room was fine, clean, modern.  Looked like it could have been in Minneapolis or Berlin.  The internet was fine.  The pool was cold.  There is no gym.The casino being on site creates a slightly seedy environment and the mall that the property is located in closes on Sunday at 1 pm. Downtown Windhoek is really nothing special so if I were to stay in Windhoek again I'd stay in the north east corner again which is a higher end neighborhood with more luxurious and quaint properties.The positive is that the property is super convenient for access to the airport.
Date: Date of stay: May 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: At the top of Avani Hotel, Windhoek, Namibia
Review Content: I stayed at The Avani Hotel, Windhoek, Namibia from 19 - 22 January, 2017, then the night of 24-25 January, 2017. I stayed initially in Room 1406, then the Suite, Room 1408 on the top floor in the 14th Floor just below the Roof top where there is the Conference Centre. Both rooms had a bird's eye view of Windhoek City Centre with the Hilton Hotel and the Namibian Supreme Court Buildings just across my room. The rooms were luxurious with all the essential amenities and extra.
Date: Date of stay: January 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Layover
Review Content: This was a layover between Walvis Bay to Oranjemund and my first time in Windhoek, which was great mostly due to walking into my hotel room and feeling at home. The room was very comfortable, clean. modern and showed off a view of the city. Room 1115It is about a 40 minute drive from the Windhoek Airport, situated in the City Centre, with direct access to shops within the mall. There is a roof top pool and wellness centre for the ladies (prices are above average with a large selection to choose from). There is a casino and bar lounges.Two negatives experienced were; the iron (which seemed like a toy iron) as it did not function like it is meant to and the check-in and check out process. Check in was busy with very little order between the reception staff which resulted in my colleague and I receiving incorrect room access cards, incorrect rooms were billed and hence this made check out confusing for the staff.Other than that great stay, I will be back.
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Mediocre stay with a few lowlights
Review Content: The hotel itself is situated in the city centre so is very convenient and surprisingly not noisy despite its location.  The rooms are spacious and comfortable[I was booked into a king size room]. Free unlimited wifi available. Breakfast is okay - selection of fruits, pastries and hot food.  The only option for dinner is a buffet - no a la carte menu available in restaurant - pretty bland dishes - unappetising roasts and overdone, oily veggies. The major lowlight was a security breach - when returning to my room after breakfast I discovered my bedroom door wide open clearly exposing my handbag and notebook which was on the bed.  As the housekeeping trolley was parked nearby I assumed that they had entered the room, discovered that I was not out and left without closing the door.  Hardly any response from management. I requested that my client book at another hotel this week because of these and many other issues.
Date: Date of stay: August 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bien pour une nuit
Review Content: Nuit passée dans dans cet hôtel en fin de circuit en Namibie. Architecture (tour) moderne de 16 étages, sans charme particulier.Situé dans l'artère principale de windhoek ( avenue de l'indépendance) .entrée par un centre commercial .A noter , un lounge climatisé accessible par le niveau bas , sans passer par la réception.Chambres très spacieuse, modernes , climatisées.très bonne literie.Très belle salle de bain, bien équipée.Hotel très calme.Intéressant par sa situation qui permet de visiter ou se déplacer à pieds facilement.A noter : petite piscine et petite terrasse sur le roof au 16 eme étage.très agréable en fin de journée pour se détendre un peu.Dîner et petit déjeuner sous forme de buffet : Divers , variés, rien à dire.En revanche , personnel assez souriant mais assez désorganisé, malheureusement :(3 appels à la réception pour obtenir des serviettes de piscine au bout de 45 minutes...Table réservée à 15 h a la réception pour le dîner à 20h mais ... Réservation oubliée entre la réception et l'accueil restaurant (mauvaise communication ?), D'où 15 min de bataille pour solutionner et trouver une table.....Wake-up confirmé pour le lendemain a 7h du matin pour départ...mais oublié aussi ..suis descendu à 7h30 pour râler à la réception et les informer d'une nouvelle faille!Avons eu , bien sur , des excuses mais cela faisait beaucoup.Cet hôtel reste un bon compromis malgré tout.Déception : Wifi payant....un peu déplacé pour ce genre de produit !
Date: Date of stay: February 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A good hotel to stay in passing through
Review Content: A clean and tidy hotel and was a good place to spend a night on our to and from our two week Namibian trip.  We're not really into Casinos in a big way so didn't spend any time in the Casino which looked somewhat dowdy.  The restaurant was good and served good food and as others have mentioned it's conveniently located in a shopping mall.  Not much ambience but given our amazing experiences in the rest of Namibia and Southern Africa we treated it as a stopover point and it is ideal for that purpose.
Date: Date of stay: June 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Maravilhoso
Review Content: Staff acolhedora e simpática, refeições excelentes e ótima localização. Recomendo a todos q desejam uma boa noite de sono e descanso. Este ano há pacotes especiais de fim de ano que valem a pena: almoço de natal especial com música ao vivo e festa de fim de ano no casino do hotel. É a segunda vez que volto ao Kalahari e mais uma vez, não me desapontou em nada.
Date: Date of stay: December 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Service not acceptable
Review Content: Stayed at Kalahari 3 nights in August.When I was booking the hotel I checked the reviews about it and some people complained about the service, usually I don't care about it but in this hotel is really a problem. Very very slow and disinterested, specially, desk staff. Breakfast is great, huge buffet with a good choice, but then again service is bad..it took minutes just to ask and get a cup of coffee.Location is great, very central and only few minutes walking from shoppingmalls and main attractions in WDH. Rooms are good as well and bathrooms big and modern( shower and bath separated).It could be an excellent hotel but even if you don't care about service you ll be disappointed about it.
Date: Date of stay: August 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not quite
Review Content: Check in was poor. Attendant was preoccupied and directed me to ninth floor. My room was on the 10th. Needed extra towels the following morning took almost thirty minutes for these to arrive. Almost missed my meeting. By then had called housekeeping four times. Apparently had to pay for wifi - go downstairs to business centre to get this. I should have been told as I checked in. Experience so poor decided not to even bother with breakfast following morning. Not to mention now running a little off pace due to towel wait. Am a frequent traveller to Windhoek. Previously stayed at the Hilton. Was sold the close to office bit for KS. Never again. Besides Hilton is like 100m down the road so no difference really.Back to the Hilton. For good.
Date: Date of stay: September 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nach Renovierung wieder empfehlenswert!
Review Content: Wir haben am Anfang und am Ende unserer Namibia-Rundreise im Kalahari Sands Hotel & Casino übernachtet und ich muss sagen, nach der aufwendigen Renovierung kann man das Hotel jetzt wieder weiterempfehlen.Das Hotel liegt super zentral in Windhoek direkt in der Innenstadt, verfügt über ein kostenfreies, bewachtes Parkhaus und ist mittlerweile sehr ansprechend eingerichtet und sehr sauber.Leider ist der Poolbereich noch nicht fertig renoviert und war daher nicht zu nutzen, aber wenn dieser Bereich genauso aufwendig renoviert wird, wie der Rest, lohnt sich die Wartezeit.Im Vergleich zu vor 5 Jahren, kann ich das Hotel jetzt jederzeit weiterempfehlen!Das reichhaltige Frühstücksbuffet überzeugt wie gehabt jeden.
Date: Date of stay: October 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Locatin
Review Content: The reviews show that the Kalahari Sands has changed since I was last there. It is located right downtown in Windhoek, since I was there on business I found the location to be great. It is a bit weird walking into the hotel because it is located in a shopping mall which is not what you normally expect. There is a casino in the hotel. I really liked the Kalahari Sands, I found the rooms to be very clean and the room service was great. The breakfast at the hotel's restaurant is really vast and was VERY good. Yes this hotel is a bit pricey, but everything in Namibia is a little more expensive than the rest of Africa. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling in and out of Windhoek.

Name: Comfortable
Review Content: This property has been totally refurbished recently including the small shopping complex attached to the hotel. It is located in the heart of the city with a bigger shopping centre in walking distance.The rooms are a good size with pleasant furnishings and a comfortable bed, chairs & a big TV. My room had nice views over the city. For rooms recently refurbished there are a couple of flaws in my opinion. There are no power points next to the bed for charging electronic devices (they have to be charged from the desk opposite), & all the lights have to be on or off. No way to just have one lamp on. And why is a thick duvet required in this climate?The bathroom has a seperate shower and bath.Breakfast was included in my room rate & there was a good selection of hot & cold dishes. The restaurant on the 15th with great views all around the city is worth checking out. There is a pool on 15th as well but it’s really only a small plunge pool & more a decorative feature.There is a room with a few slot machines which is the casino part of the hotel but it’s not very obvious.Staff are generally pleasant & helpful with a few exceptions.Nothing overly special or different but a comfortable 4 star hotel.
Date: Date of stay: April 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: StayCation at Avani
Review Content: Great hotel with very friendly staff and a very warm welcome from the gentleman that checked me in.Execellent food,the hostes at the Dunes Restaurant  for breakfast was very friendly and accommodating.I was in room 1001 and the room was very spacious and clean, and the view of the Windhoek mountains in the morning was breath taking so was the sunset.Amanda Beukes was very helpful and had an answer for all my questions.( Great Customer Service and attention to detial!!!!)I live in Windhoek, so i will definately visit again.
Date: Date of stay: February 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: My stay at Avani Namibia
Review Content: The hotel offers value for money services as well as peace and tranquility to the travelers. It is also suitably located in the heart of the city making it easier for one to walk around more flexibly.
Date: Date of stay: November 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Un bel hôtel équivalent 4 étoiles
Review Content: Un hôtel très bien situé prés de très belles boutiques à prix abordable pour rapporter des souvenir avant de repartir. L'hôtel est tout confort et cosy. Les chambres du haut permettent d'avoir une vue sur la ville (même si ce n'est pas un panorama exceptionnel c'est un bon moyen de se rendre compte de ce à quoi ressemble le ville).Le personnel est aimable et aux petits soins.Hôtel très calme. Très bonne literie.
Date: Date of stay: September 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Mr wille
Review Content: Casino Air conditioners placed on heating while it is 31 degrees Celsius. Manager on duty Lucky say talk to the general manager MR Putter on Monday. Service extremely bad. No semior manager on duty. Request to pay as you go at the bar. Have to ask to pay
Date: Date of stay: October 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bien si on veut un hôtel de type international
Review Content: Nous n avions pas prévu de nuit dans cet hôtel. C est Air Namibia qui nous y a conduit à la suite de l annulation de notre vol. Cet hôtel ressemble à tous ces hôtels de chaînes dont on ne sait pas dans quel pays on se trouve. Il est grand, les chambres et les sallles de bains sont grandes, bien équipées et bien insonorisées. La propreté était moyenne. Le dîner et le petit déjeuner sous forme de buffet propose un bon choix mais les plats ne sont pas très chauds et la qualité est moyenne. L accueil est très aimable. Bon wifi.
Date: Date of stay: July 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: NOT AS ADVERTISED
Review Content: Hotel definitely not as advertised. Only one elevator was working and it malfunctions. Zero parking for guests. The check in processing was a nightmare as the staff seemed under qualified and inundated. Hotel construction underway which the should inform guests of beforehand.
Date: Date of stay: June 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Able seafarer
Review Content: Awesome place, love the bar the service is of good standard. They have breath taking rooms very comfy makes you feel right at home, the food is wonderful I would recommend the place to anybody looking forward to a safe, luxurious and on a budget stay..
Date: Date of stay: May 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very good location and nice staff
Review Content: I stayed there only for a night but had a very good stay there. The location of the hotel is great, you can reach any museum and place of interest by foot. The room was tidy, the staff was nice and all in all the hotel was a very good one.
Date: Date of stay: August 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Pleasure
Review Content: I am visiting AVANI since round about 15 years. It had always the charme of a "good friend" and most different to many of the so called "modern" hotels. Hope it will maintain this character. You can not compete, if you are not different to your competitors. You can improve service, value, a menu, wine lists, but you should always keep your character if people enjoy.  I undertstand that mass tourism brings a good profit, but  a good reputation could be even more important.
Date: Date of stay: November 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: 朝食ブッフェが美味しい、安全なホテル
Review Content: スタッフは優しく、丁寧に話しを聞いてくれます。レストランのスタッフも皆優しく、英語も堪能でした。この日は生憎お風呂のお湯が出ず、カチカチに凍えそうになりましたが、時間をおくと温かいお湯が出て安心しました。朝食ブッフェは種類も豊富で美味しかったです！夕食はそれほどでも無かったので外に食べにいってもいいかもしれません。
Date: Date of stay: September 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: 都会のホテル
Review Content: ナミビア旅行の最後の1泊で利用しました。大都市によくあるきれいなシティホテルという感じで設備も整っており快適でした。ずっとナミビアを旅行して最後の1泊だったこともあり、都会に戻って来たという感じで何となくホッとしました。地下に大きなスーパーマーケットがありますが、夜7時頃着いた時には閉まっていて利用できませんでした。
Date: Date of stay: May 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Buena calidad
Review Content: Iba en grupo en un circuito así que no puedo informar sobre los precios. Bien situado en el centro, la habitación me pareció muy confortable con un muy cómodo colchón. También el baño era grande, limpio y con utilities. El desayuno ofrecía variedad en tanto que dispone de embutidos, parte caliente para huecos frutos y tortilla, frutas, zumo de naranja natural y de otros sabores aunque no naturales, yoghourts, bollería...El único handicup es que tuvimos que entrar y salir a través de un centro comercial... Menos mal que estaba cerrado por las horas en que llegamos y salimos!
Date: Date of stay: September 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: De lujo
Review Content: Hotel de Lujo en el centro de la ciudad, la ciudad es pequeña pero esta cerca de todo. Es un hotel de ciudad. Buena habitacion amplia, buenas camas y desayuno muy completo. Solo me aloje una noche ya que la ciudad no tiene mucho que ver.
Date: Date of stay: July 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best place to stay in Windhoek
Review Content: We hosted all our international Speakers for a conference in Windhoek at the AVANI and all of them just loved it. The rooms are spacious and luxurious and the service is great. With Avani's most central location in town, you can get everywhere easily and without problems (it's absolutely safe to walk around Windhoek downtown during the day!). For our next conference we will definitely chose AVANI again!
Date: Date of stay: June 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Hotel but food can be improved
Review Content: The hotel is in a great location for both business and leisure travellers. The al a cart menu should be updated and the quality of room service meals should be improved. The buffet served at dinner is "ok" but I would expect better for the price.
Date: Date of stay: May 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A Very Ordinary Stay
Review Content: I recently stayed at this Hotel. Situated in the heart of Windhoek, it is located in the middle of a shopping centre which is useful with a Supermarket Chemist and other shops on your door step.With regards to the Hotel itself, it is one of those situations where nothing is bad, but nothing is outstanding either.The rooms are clean and comfortable but are a few years old and could probably do with a spruce up. The bed was comfortable and bathroom was ok. I had to get them to replace a shower nozzle as water sprayed everywhere except on me.The restaurant once again was average and my biggest complaint was that you either had a bevy of waiters wanting to help you, or you battled to get service. There was no allocation of seating areas among the staff. The Buffet was very average, but nothing to rave about. There is a limited A la Carte menu which was available in the Casino restaurant, but I did not eat there.Also there is no Gym at this hotel, which is strange for this day and age.Internet access was acceptable.
Date: Date of stay: April 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Comfortable stay in the center of Windhoek
Review Content: Avani offers a comfortable stay in the center of Windhoek - walking distance to restaurants and the nearby craft market.The rooms are clean and spacious with all the normal hotel amenities expected.Breakfast is buffet and offers a good selection of food - from cold to hot breakfast, coffee, juice and more.If you want dinner, have a look at the room service options; it's not too pricey and offers an alternative to the buffet dinner they serve in the restaurant.All in all a good option for central accommodation
Date: Date of stay: April 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Plus que moyen et moins bon que très bon ... donc BON SANS PLUS et mauvais rapport qualité/prix
Review Content: Pour une nuit seulement  : accueil assez impersonnel, chambre normale, sans plus, wifi hors de prix, piscine au dessus de l'immeuble entre trois murs et pas chauffée ... par contre, petit déjeuner très bien ... on préfère beaucoup le HILTON qui est au même prix et qui est d'une classe supérieure ! Sans odeur ni saveur ... on voulait essayer un autre Hotel ... on a été déçu ..
Date: Date of stay: February 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Always where we stop by for lunch ahead of an evening flight .
Review Content: Having visited Windhoek regularly and needing to arrange a meet with agent or place to linger after drop off while waiting to go to the airport it has become our habit to take lunch hear. Either in the Restaurant, which is good value, or in the Oasis Bar which serves good snacks and where one can linger a while longer.Very comfortable and central. Luggage can be left with the concierge desk if some last minute shopping calls.Very friendly and attentive staff and altogether a nice place.Looking forward to the next visit.
Date: Date of stay: January 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Hotel at city center
Review Content: This is definitely a gem at downtown Windhoek. It's centrally located along Independence ave which runs the length of the city with amazing shops and eatery all around it. If your looking for a home base to explore and enjoy Windhoek, this would be the place. The hotel is located within a shopping center which means everything you will ever need is at walking distance. It's upstairs with escalators provided and banking ATM all around you. Our room was a double deluxe with flat screen tv and worked fine. They use DSTV and I was able to catch up on sports games, live. The rooms are cozy and does have air conditioning. We visited in the summer so not sure about heating. The bathroom came with a tube and a one-person sized standing shower. There are signs posted to conserve water and to limit shower to 6minutes, which was plenty enough. There is a refrigerator as well with complimentary 2-bottles of hotel-brand drinking water. Breakfast starts at 6:30am and ends at 9:30am. It was thesame everyday, but it was more than the usual complimentary breakfast you would find in other hotels. This was buffet/style and has variety of food- scrambled eggs, sausage, beans, ham, fish, toast, coffee, juice drinks. We noticed no waffles or pancakes. But overall breakfast experience was good. I recommend including breakfast in you hotel deal if you can. But there are plenty of places downstairs within the shopping mall that provide excellent breakfast as well. Outside the hotel, you can easily get shuttle cars to take you wherever you need to go. But we find them expensive, can charge no less than N$60. But We walked down the block and found local taxi that took us around the city for N$10. It's N$10 flat rate for anywhere within the city limit, which was easy for us and they can't cheat you.I would recommend this hotel, it can be expensive to stay here for the casual traveler. But it's well worth it. Front desk is open 24hrs and there is wifi at the hotel. You have to ask for the guest code to use wifi. The wifi needs improvement because it drops all the time and not very strong.
Date: Date of stay: November 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very comfortable hotel at the heart of Windhoek
Review Content: This is a modern hotel with nice, ample rooms, very comfortable beds, good wifi signal throughout the hotel and nice staff. The buffet breakfast is abundant and good, it's conveniently located at the heart of Windhoek and just about a shopping mall. Great for groups as well.
Date: Date of stay: July 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: BEL HOTEL BIEN SITUE
Review Content: Les chambres sont propres, spacieuses et confortables, le petit déjeuner très complet.Le personnel est compétent et à l'écoute des clients.Très bien pour commencer un circuit en Namibie. Seul petit bémol, l’ascenseur ne fait pas toujours ce qu'on lui demande et qui nous promène d'un étage à l'autre, mais ce n'est pas très grave quand on est en vacances....
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice hotel in center of town
Review Content: I spent a night at the Avani midweek. The hotel is very comfortable and the rooms are spacious, clean and neat. I only had one meal in the hotel and that was breakfast which was very pleasant. The staff are very friendly too. The only shortcoming is that there is no gym. There is a pool on the roof though which was great. I would stay in this hotel again. Free wifi is also provided. There is a casino attached to the hotel but I didn't try it out.
Date: Date of stay: October 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Clean Rooms and polite staff in the heart of the city
Review Content: From the check in counter I experienced friendly staff. The room and bathroom were very clean. Although they have carpets, I did not suffer sinuses as I usually do with unclean carpets. I can confidently say I was at home and did not have to brave any odours and avoid towels.It is conveniently located, as shops, casino, bars and restaurants are right at the hotel entrance. The rooms totally shield you from the activities write at the base.
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: very good hotel
Review Content: Very good hotel, all the people were very nice with us, rooms are cleaned and confortable. We had a very good diner and the breakfast is complete. I recommend this hotel before to have a trekking in Namibia.
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good hotel in Windhoek
Review Content: Overall the hotel was clean and pleasant. The staff were helpful and facilities well managed.  We didn't use the bar but it looked comfortable and was located next to a casino for those who like to gamble. I think you should be aware of the location of the hotel.  Although I knew it was located in a mall I was imagining a Sandton City lookalike, this is not the case.  When you drove to the location of the hotel you have to go into the mall car park.  Luckily the security card told us to go to the 4th floor for the hotel.  It is a busy concrete car park with little thought to the first impressions. You have to walk past various shops (cash converters, OK furnishers etc) and around the corner you find the more upmarket entrance to the hotel.  I didn't feel unsafe it was just a very odd place for such a nice hotel, so just be aware.Our rooms were clean and comfortable.  The windows were locked and it did feel very stuffy even with the a/c on. I would recommend this hotel to couples and business travelers but maybe not so much to those with kids who plan on staying longer than a couple of nights.  Very little open places to keep kids occupied.Breakfast was good although the dining room was very busy and we had to sit at a dirty table as it was all that was available.  The staff quickly came and cleared it though so not an issue. Staff were helpful especially when we realized our 2 rooms were quite far apart they went to extra effort to find 2 rooms next to each other. The porters were also very helpful in fetching our luggage from the car park.
Date: Date of stay: July 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Avani hotel windhoek
Review Content: very good rooms, nice staff, bad pool area, bad internet...good food.well located (inside a shopping mall were you can easily go to the supermarket our other store. you can walk and find a lot of restaurants shops etc...casino inside
Date: Date of stay: May 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice hotel but!!!
Review Content: Enjoyed the hotel but would not stay on a Friday or Saturday again.  There's s club that goes on all night till 7 am both nights. Couldn't sleep especially after traveling a long way.  What a shame!  This is a detriment to the hotel and its five star status. Otherwise nice place. Friendly staff and very helpful.
Date: Date of stay: April 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The perfect hotel for a business trip
Review Content: I stayed at the Avani hotel on recommendation from colleagues, having previously stayed at the Safari Inn, which was a disappointing experience.  The hotel is perfect for business travelers, as it is in the heart of the city and close to businesses and shopping centres.  The rooms have everything a business traveler needs, with excellent wi-fi.  What was mst impressive was the quality of food in their restaurant.  Breakfast was a veritable feast and the evening buffet was not your usual dreary affair, but offered stir-fry choices, fresh seafood cooked in front of you and excellent salads.  The desserts were to die for - I landed up having 3 pieces of mini cheese cake!
Date: Date of stay: February 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very good hotel at central location
Review Content: Big and clean rooms, friendly staff, good breakfast and very good value for money. Some hiccups existed like ordering a breakfast box the previous day only to find out that it was not prepared and had to be prepared when asked for it and that the wifi speed was not very good.The location is very central and there are a couple of good restaurants nearby.
Date: Date of stay: November 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bel hôtel bien situé
Review Content: En plein centre de Windhoek, cet hôtel est pratique pour se promener à pied et faire un peu de shoppingHôtel de chaine tout confort Repas et petit-déjeuner sous forme de buffets copieux et variésBonne étape
Date: Date of stay: December 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Zimmer gut, Personal ok, Umgebung langweilig
Review Content: Das Hotel liegt im absoluten Zentrum von Windhoek. Leider besticht es nicht gerade durch sein äußeres Erscheinungsbild (trotz der gut bearbeiteten Werbefotos).Das innere des Hotels hingegen ist durchgehend gepflegt und stilsicher eingerichtet. Die Betten sind angenehm und die Reinlichkeit des Housekeeping ist durchaus akzeptabel.Leider besticht der Service der Rezeption und des Restaurantpersonals nicht wirklich. Die Rezeption gibt je nach Tageszeit und Mitarbeiter gegensätzliche Aussagen bzgl. Taxikosten, Öffnungszeiten u.ä. raus. Im Restaurant wird einem (mit Ausnahme eines Kellers) durchaus klar gemacht, dass man nur dort arbeitet, weil man sonst keine Wahl hat.Der Pool ist in der obersten Etage des Hotels lokalisiert und bietet einen Ausblick über einen Großteil von Windhoek.Windhoek selbst ist hingegen keinen Besuch wert.
Date: Date of stay: September 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Noche de paso
Review Content: LA habitación era bastante grande y el desayuno muy bueno y abundante. El personal del hotel muy amable y solventaron cualquier duda que tuvimos con rapidez. La wifi rápida y gratuita pero solamente en recepción.
Date: Date of stay: July 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Buon servizio
Review Content: Camere spaziose e pulite;letti comodi e larghi. Ottima assistenza alla reception con un punto di merito per averci fatto un check in alle 7 del mattino e senza farci pagare nulla. Colazione a buffet super abbondante con tante portate più di un pranzo di natale (troppe cose) . Presente il casinò ma non si sente e l hotel ha stanze ben insonorizzate
Date: Date of stay: May 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A nice room for a high price
Review Content: The room is nice, located on top of a casino. Breakfast and fitness center access was included in the price. The breakfast was excellent, fitness centre was quite poor with very few weights for serious weight lifters. The gym was full of cardio machines so it might work for some other type of people. Room itself was luxurious and nice. Wifi is not included in the price. I bought one hour unlimited wifi access and it stopped working after 10 minutes or so. I was quite dissappointed about that. The locations is pretty good with all the important places in walking distance.
Date: Date of stay: December 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Confortevole
Review Content: Hotel all'interno di un centro commerciale dove abbiamo soggiornato la prima e l'ultima notte del nostro viaggio. Parcheggio sotterraneo. Camera molto grande, arredamento "standard" ma di qualità. Molto buona ed abbondante la colazione a buffet. Personale gentile ed efficiente.
Date: Date of stay: June 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Gutes bewährtes Hotel
Review Content: Wenn ich hin und wieder nach Windhoek gehe, habe ich einige Hotels zur Auswahl, in denen ich gerne absteige. Eines davon ist das Kalahari Sands Hotel, in dem ich mich immer wohl fühle. Das Hotel liegt zentral, die Zimmer sind geräumig und die Bar und das Restaurant sind immer einen Besuch wert. Wer spielen will, ist zudem im Casino gut aufgehoben. Die Preise sind vernünftig. Immer angenehm ist, dass man das Auto im angrenzenden Parkhaus in Ruhe und gratis stehen lassen kann
Date: Date of stay: July 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Gut und günstig
Review Content: Ein sehr schönes und zentrales Hotel, der einzige Minuspunkt war, dass die Zimmertüre defekt war und 2 Personen 20 Minuten damit beschäft waren die Batterie des Kartenlesers auszutauschen. Frühstück konnten wir leider nicht testen da wir nur für 1 Nacht gebucht hatten und früh morgens Richtung Flughafen mussten.
Date: Date of stay: December 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Ottima sistemazione e ristorante
Review Content: Un hotel di standard europeo 4 stelle, non nuovissimo, un po' sotto lo standard dell'Hilton ma perfettamente compatibile con un soggiorno di qualità. RIspetto all'Hilton ha un ottimo ristorante almeno per lunch e dinner. La colazione è ottima, ma Hilton offre qualcosa di meglio. Le stanze sono progettate bene ma la ventola del bagno è troppo rumorosa e la porta era imbarcata. Prese di corrente internazionali. Stanza luminosa ben oscurabile. Letto comodo ma non eccellente. Servizio cortese e qualificato. Colazione a buffet di buon standard, ma l'Hilton è una spanna sopra...
Date: Date of stay: September 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Avoid it if service is an issue for you
Review Content: This hotel has world quality facilities, but their service and ability to respond to guest needs leaves much to be desired. At breakfast for instance, when one asks for coffee the waiter/ress proceeds to clear tables, consult other customers etc before eventually going to get the coffee about 5 - 10 minutes later. Surprisingly, room service is friendly and very efficient. The thermostat for the water seems forcefully set on barely warm, to the extent that one is freezing when coming out of the shower. I logged a complaint every day for three days before the temperature was barely acceptable and this is winter! One night, upon returning to the hotel after 10pm I found the security guard blocking the lift with a couple in it, demanding proof that the lady was a resident. Mind you, I had seen this couple in the lobby and restaurant for three days at that point. I asked if I could use the lift and he just ignored me. My fridge was also locked, apparently I needed special permission to have it unlocked, and 'therefore accepting responsibility for the minibar', and yet, I was asked 3 times by three different people if I had used anything from the minibar when checking out! How? the fridge was locked!
Date: Date of stay: June 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A gem in the heart of the city
Review Content: This is a Sun International Hotel with a casino. The hotel is in a mall complex which has a great selection of stores on the ground level.The room was luxurious and the beds and pillows were very comfortable. my only complaint would be that the noise levels when there is a party on the roof terrace filters down to the rooms (roof terrace was on the 19th floor and I was on the 9th floor). I would stay there again and its a great venue for meetings and business trips as it is central, as compared to  the Windhoek Country Club which is a fair distance out of the city centre.I see that many people complained that the staff were slow. If one appreciates that this is Namibia and service is SLOW EVERYWHERE! People are not rude and bad at service - because they feel they are giving you the best service. The slowness is a cultural norm and one should expect this.I also went to the SPA and it was excellent with very well trained therapists.
Date: Date of stay: November 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Pleasant surprise in the middle of Africa
Review Content: While flying Air Namibia ( sucked ), our flight was delayed and we ended up spending the night in Windhoek.  Air Namibia put us up in this hotel.It was probably the first time during our trip when we were really pleasantly surprised by the food offered at the hotel's buffet.  Variety of European, American, and African foods.  All you can eat and delicious.The room was wonderful.  Really top notch.  Very clean and fun.  Gambling at this place was pretty uneventful and drinks at the bar were quite pricey, but all in all it was a really wonderful experience.If you happen to be in the area, spend a night at this place.  You won't regret it.
Date: Date of stay: February 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Old and tired, but great central city location
Review Content: I had a reasonable stay at this place but it is definitely getting old and tired. It’ll need a bit of work to get it up to international standards. Great central city location though, right in the thick of things, and helpful friendly staff.The first thing that I noticed upon checking in was a smoke filled lobby – not a nice reception. The place seemed really busy and noisy with not enough reception staff to handle things. The elevators were painfully slow, with long waits for an available lift. The hallways on my floor smelled old and musty and it looked like there was water damage on some of the walls and carpet. The location of the hotel is excellent, inside a mall complex in the heart of the city, directly across from the tourist info center. There is a bank right next to the hotel entrance and a big supermarket a couple of floors down – very handy – and no shortage of eateries in the immediate vicinity.The room was fairly average in most respects. It seemed clean enough but it definitely needed and little love and care. The TV was really old and the sound quality was just awful. The bathroom was fairly old and the water barely seeped out of the sink faucets. The shower was OK though, with good pressure. The internet system was a real disaster. For starters it was really expensive. Secondly, if you purchase 1 day’s worth of internet, it expires at midnight, rather than 24 hours after purchase, so if you want to use it the following morning, you have to buy another day’s worth. Also, the WiFi wasn’t working on all floors and a lot of people were complaining about this.The hotel doesn’t have a gym, but they will give you a complimentary pass to a commercial gym down the street. The buffet breakfast wasn’t too bad, with all the normal breakfast items you’d expect. The staff were always very friendly and helpful, really nice people. Check-in and check-out did seem to take a bit more time than usual though. I think they actually need to extend the reception area a bit as it was always over crowded.All up, a fairly average experience, and I think that I would look for another hotel the next time I visit Windhoek. I don’t really recommend it unless you really want to be right in the city center. I don’t think it was good value for money.
Date: Date of stay: February 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Ein Hotel ohne Risiko - und ohne afrikanisches Ambente !
Review Content: Das Kalahari Sands Hotel liegt direkt im Zentrum der namibischen Hauptstadt Windhoek und entspricht den gängigen internationalen Maßstäben. Es nimmt für sich in Anspruch, z. Z. das beste Hotel in der Stadt zu sein (allerdings wird schräg gegenüber gerade ein Fünf Sterne-Luxushotel von Hilton gebaut...). Die Zimmer sind geräumig und funktional eingerichtet, könnten aber ebenso wie das Bad eine Renovierung gut gebrauchen. Empfehlenswert ist auch das im Haus befindlcihe Restaurant. Sehr viel geduld braucht man mit dem Lift; das System ist permanent überlastet. Die Preise schwanken sehr stark: Vorausbuchen lohnt sich auf jeden Fall, vor Ort muss man z. T. mehr als das Doppelte bezahlen !
Date: Date of stay: May 2010This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: An almost perfect stay…

The first two nights were excellent with food and drink orders being served on time. The third night was a complete opposite of that experience! There were several issues:i) We kept requesting for our food and drinks more than 3 times before we were servedii) Some of the food served was over salted iii) They forgot one order (gourmet burger), which took over 30 minutes to prepare once we asked about it iv) Desserts were served while we were still eating the main course v) Some people received their desserts before others had even been served their main coursesThis last day’s dinner experience ruined an otherwise excellent stay!

Her attention to detail was impeccable—she anticipated our needs before we even had to ask and was always nearby without being intrusive.Not only was Shanice knowledgeable about the menu, but she also provided excellent recommendations that made my dining experience even more enjoyable. She handled all requests with grace and efficiency, even during the busy rush, ensuring that my meal was seamless from start to finish.It's rare to encounter such a dedicated and professional waitress, and Shanice truly made the visit memorable. I highly recommend dining here and hope to be served by her again on my next visit. Thank you, Shanice and I look forward to seeing you again next year!
