Name: Good place to overnight after arriving in or before leaving Namibia
Review Content: This is a good standard hotel for your first or last night in Namibia - central, safe, clean, comfortable, etc. but nothing particularly memorable.Try Joe's Beer House in town if you want a night out. Amazing food (as long as you're not vegetarian!) and a fun bar. Just about the only place to go.
Date: Date of stay: August 2004This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Top Lage in der Innenstadt
Review Content: Wir haben das Hotel sehr geschätzt betreffend der Lage , die Innenstadt ist sehr gut zu fuss zu erreichen. Die angrenztende Parkgarge welche überwacht und gratis ist, konnten wir durch einen Durchgang ins Hotel erreichen. im unterene Stock ist ein Supermarkt wo wir unseren Wasserstock und Esswaren einkaufen konnten. Die Zimmer waren sehr schön und frisch renoviert. Ein Scheribtisch mit Stuhl sowie ein Polsterstuhl, sowei das Badezimmer mit Duschkabine waren sehr schön. Die Betten waren die bequemsten unserer Namibiareise. Von unserem Zimmer hatten wir eine prächtige Aussicht auf die nahen berge und Bahnhof. Das Frühstücksbüffet war vielfälltig und sehr gut. Das Personal könnte jedoch noch freundlicher und hilfsbereiter sein, wobei dies der einizige negativ Punkt war. Die Toplage um die Stadt zu erkunden war für uns massgebend und das Hotel ist gerade darum sehr zu empfehlen.Wir würden wieder dieses Hotel wählen.
Date: Date of stay: June 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Gutes Haus, gut zur Innenstadt gelegen
Review Content: Eigentlich eher ein Business Hotel. Aber bei Ankunft in Namibia super geeignet um anzukommen. Zimmer häufig auch bereits am Vormittag verfügbar. Gutes und gut geführtes Haus. Sauber, professionelle Rezeption, gutes Restaurant und Frühstück mit umfangreichem Bufett, frische Eiergerichte eingeschlossen. Weitere Restaurants in der Nähe, dazu Shopping im Gebäudekomplex und auch in unmittelbarer Nähe eine Mall. Zu Fuß nur wenige Minuten ins Zentrum.
Date: Date of stay: October 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not Great
Review Content: stayed for 3 nights for a business trip. Was appalled by the prostitution activities occurring blatantly in the street in front of the hotel and in the hotel bar area. One evening my colleague and I were propositioned by a very obviously high/drunk man - offers of marriage and a place to sleep. The bar staff did take very quick action and the security staff removed the intruder. Still a very disturbing experience. Breakfast was very average although service was good. The hotel is located in a shopping centre so you have to walk through the centre with your luggage, very unpleasant. Room service took forever. Rooms ok.
Date: Date of stay: February 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Modern and clean
Review Content: We stayed here and the first impression was very good. The rooms are spacious and neat. Modern finishes, great decor. I will stay there again. There are however 3 things i didn't like. 1- there was a guy who asked me for money in the lift. I am 5 ft, he was 6,2ft, no contest, i gave him n$ 100. I reported it to security and they said they knew of him, he is a local taxi driver. Didn't help me feeling safer. 2- their bar and restaurant is very bad, no sock, no service. I will DEFIniTELY not use their restaurant again. 3- location: although it is close to a big shopping centre, garages and main roads, the hotel is in a remote are, surrounded by building development development, so it makes it a bit lonely isolated and with no view other than construction works.
Date: Date of stay: December 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Praktisch und gepflegt
Review Content: Ein sehr empfehlenswertes Hotel für die Durchreise bzw. den 1. Tag in Namibia. Durch die Lage in einem Shopping-Center ist alles in Reichweite. D.h. die SIM-Karte ist erhältlich, zudem kann der Lebensmittel-Vorrat aufgefüllt werden. Die Zimmer sind schön, wenig "afrikanisch", eher europäischer Standard. Durch das Casino ist es im Empfangsbereich eher laut, aber alles in allem eine gute Unterkunft, vor allem eben durch die zentrale Lage.
Date: Date of stay: February 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellente localisation
Review Content: Le Kalahari Sands n'est certainement pas un hotel de charme mais le meilleur choix pour un sejour d'une nuit apres ou avant un vol international.Il est en plein centre ville, l'entrée située dans une galerie commerciale dont la plupart des magasins ouvrent a 8h du matin.  Des banques et distributeurs de billets juste a coté de la réception.  Les attractions touristiques accessibles a pied.Quant a l'hotel, il s'agit d'un hotel 'international' donc des chambres 'standards' mais spacieuses ayant toutes les facilités de ce genre d'hotel. Le petit dejeuner avec show cooking et le soir buffet servant des plats internationaux mais aussi des plats nationaux.  Ce n'est pas de la gastronomie mais c'est correct.  Le service a la reception est correct, nous sommes en Afrique, il ne faut pas etre pressé...Le principal atout de cet hotel est sa situation.
Date: Date of stay: November 2008This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Sosta per arrivo e partenza dalla Namibia
Review Content: Abbiamo prenotato questo hotel come punto di partenza e arrivo del nostro tour in Namibia. A soli 30 minuti dall’aeroporto di Windhoek si trova nel centro della città.Camere pulite e spaziose, dotato di una piccola ma completa palestra, una terrazza panoramica dove sorseggiare un drink. Personale gentile e disponibile. Consigliato
Date: Date of stay: October 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Zentral gelegen
Review Content: Wir wurden durch die Fluggesellschaft für eine Nacht hier einquartiert, da unser Flug gestrichen wurde. Der Empfang war sehr freundlich, das Zimmer sehr sauber und groß. Das Gepäck wurde von Jürgen nach oben gebracht, der uns auch noch weitere Erklärungen gab. Er war sehr freundlich.Der Mitarbeiter im Restaurant lies uns sehr deutlich spüren, dass wir "nur" durch die Fluggesellschaft unterbracht waren. Freundlich ist definitiv anders. Das Essen war gut (Buffet) und es gab viel Auswahl.Die Abholung war für den nächsten Morgen, 5.30 Uhr geplant und uns wurde an der Rezeption zugesichert ein Frühstück zu bekommen. Es wurde auch noch gefragt wann wir dieses wollten, aber leider gab es nur ein lieblos gerichtetes Paket und auch keinen Kaffee. Warum wird man gefragt, wenn es schon vorher klar ist, dass es um diese Zeit kein Frühstück/ Kaffee gibt?????
Date: Date of stay: May 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Da consigliare
Review Content: Hotel in posizione centrale, anche se a Windhoek non c'è molto da vedere. Comunque ci siamo trovati bene, nonostante ci sia un solo ascensore (gli altri sono in manutenzione per rinnovo) le stanze sono ampie e luminose e la  colazione a buffet molto varia.
Date: Date of stay: September 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great hotel in good location.
Review Content: Really nice hotel especially after 2 flights from London. The room was very spacious (I think we got a free upgrade). Lovely bathroom and they had a mixture of international sockets to recharge ahead of our tour - a bonus!The breakfast was really good...a great choice of cereals, juices, fruit, smoothies, pastries, hot food,  eggs made to order. (ate too much)Would highly recommend, good location. There is also an open market across the road to get your african souvenirs. The hotel is accessed  from the first floor of a mall that has a supermarket, bank and other shops. The shops tend to close from around 1pm on Saturdays and i don't think opened on Sunday. There is a large supermarket and shopping mall about a 5min walk from the hotel though. There really is not much to see in Windhoek so only use as a stop off for your tour! Oh there is also a v small pool located on the roof.Would recommend getting a taxi (about 10mins) to Joe's beer house for dinner & drinks, chilled out with random decor.The hotel was in the process of being upgraded while we were there but should be finished by now.
Date: Date of stay: September 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Central location and great staff
Review Content: The room and amenities were very comfortable although it was showing its age. Great central location. The staff were very good particularly those on the front desk - had a bit of a "roobery" incident when I parked my car on arrival and the staff went above and beyond to assist.
Date: Date of stay: January 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: カジノ
Review Content: 現在はカラハリサンズではなくアヴァ二ホテルでした。フロントの脇からカジノ入り口があり、スロットのほか、ボードゲームも多数あり、お客さんもそこそこいました。それから、朝食も以外と美味しく満足しました。WiFiは遅いです。
Date: Date of stay: February 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Schönes Zimmer mit Abstrichen beim Service
Review Content: Hatten 2 Nächte im Avani, Zimmer waren sehr schön, sauber und Bad ebenfalls. In unserem Zimmer hat der Safe gefehlt. Sehr hilfsbereites Personal am Checkin. Hatten erst zu Zufahrt zur Parkgarage nicht gefunden, woraufhin die Dame am Checkin einen Security Mitarbeiter mit uns zu fahren. Ein ander Mitarbeiter wartete schon mit einem Trolley. Wir waren schnell eingecheckt. Hotelbereich sind auch schön gestaltet bis auf den Pool auf dem Dach. Alle sehr freundlich, bis auf einen Teil des Frühstücks Personal. Etwas chaotisch und begriffsstutzig....Dauert um einen Tee zu bekommen ewig. Auch das Essen in den Töpfen ist lauwarm und unansehnlich, außerdem ohne Schilder sodass man jeden Deckel öffnen muss. Frisches  Omelette war lecker, Auswahl war auch ok und Sitzbereich ebenso. Sehr zentral deshalb ok für 1-2 Nächte
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Cost effective
Review Content: Very reasonable bedroom, affordable, and excellent breakfast, but the restaurant its expensive. Shares the building with a small mall where you can have fastfood, currency exchange, supermarket (shoprite), and ATMs. You can buy handcrafted item across the street.
Date: Date of stay: June 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Much Improved
Review Content: I have stayed here frequently over the years because you cant beat the location for business meetings. It badly needed a refurb two years back but I'm glad to say the new look in the rooms is a huge improvement. Secure parking in the mall if you hire a car and very convenient for shops and offices. Staff are generally ok, breakfasts are good and the little bar in reception is a nice option.
Date: Date of stay: January 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great for business stay
Review Content: I spent 2 nights at the Kalahari Sands last week and was pleasantly surprised that the rooms had been completely revamped and refreshed. Linen crisp and fresh. The rooms are larger than the average business hotel which gives one a sense of space. Service was better and one had a feeling that a new focus was on this hotel.Although a customer complained very publically at breakfast, i found some of the staff very attentive. Especially the two older ladies at the grill, so pleasant, thank you.Wifi was good
Date: Date of stay: July 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Sehr ordentliches Hotel im Zentrum
Review Content: Das Kalahari Sands ist sicher die erste Wahl für Windhoek, wenn man zentral mit gutem Komfort untergebracht sein will. Die Zimmer sind ausreichend groß und absolut sauber, die Küche hat durchaus gehobenen Standard und das Personal ist freundlich und hilfsbereit. Immer wieder gern.
Date: Date of stay: November 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Super Frühstück
Review Content: Der Eingang war nicht gut zu finden und befindet sich im 4. Stock eines Einkaufzentrums . Mit dem Auto nur über die Garage zu erreichen . Sonst passte alles viel Sicherheitspersonal durch inkuludierte Kasino . Zimmer Top Frühstück ist wirklich Fantastisch
Date: Date of stay: July 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel with good amenities (which are not its own)
Review Content: If you are staying in Windhoek on business I would suggest this is the best place. Situated in the heart of the city this hotel offers all what a business traveler wants- close access to restaurants, shops & offices, transport, parks etc. Also, if you are the one who likes to do a bit of shopping then the hotel is situated to handicraft emporiums, local clothing stores, jewelry stores and so much more. And to keep you entertained, the hotel has a casino to keep you busy all through the night.The staff at Kalahari are experienced and I found them better than that at Hilton. But one word of advise is that if you are a foreign national then i would suggest that you get your booking confirmed in writing to avoid any misunderstanding.
Date: Date of stay: September 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A great place to stay
Review Content: Kalahari Sands Hotel is smack-bang in the centre of Windhoek, so everything is within easy reach. The hop-on bus departs straight in front of the hotel, at the tourist kiosk. There is a great park accross the street from the hotel, great for a lazy afternoon stroll or just sit there and check out the city life. I've found a great German restaurant about a block from the hotel, worth a visit! Ask concierce to make reservations. Hotel itself has got spacious rooms, and is very neat. Pool on the roof a bit 'impersonal' was my experience. Great breakfast, though! Will definately return!
Date: Date of stay: September 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Ok hotel in the city center
Review Content: I have stayed at this hotel for 1 night recently and have to say that it really was ok.Check-in at the reception was quick, the lifts worked properly all the time and the room was average and clean. If you ask for room on a high floor is will be quiet and you will have a nice view of the city.This hotel does not offer luxury, but ok quality for the price and the location is hard to beat as it is situated right on the main road in the city center. There is also a small mall (including a bank plus ATM) in the same building and it was easy and safe to walk on the streets nearby for shopping and eating at a really good restaurant called "Gathemanns" (only a 5 min. walk, 1 st floor).On top of the hotel there is also a small open air pool area with some chairs which was nice to relax.For me it was a perfect choice for staying in Windhoek for 1 night before leaving for Sossusvlei!
Date: Date of stay: December 2007This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very good food friendly  place  nice had a great  time with my friend  would  love yo come back  soon and will  tell eve
Review Content: Yamilah, was the BEST WE EVAR RECEIVED in Dunes Restaurant,   Fast, friendly and good listeners.  She attended to every request with a smile. It was really a pleasure being served by Yamilah......EXCELLENT check  dune restaurant  out great place
Date: Date of stay: October 2024This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Miserabel
Review Content: Es ist einfach nur traurig und erbärmlich. Wir haben 2 zimmer für 2 nächte gebucht, welche nicht einmal einen balkon haben nachdem das unfähige personal uns 3 mal einen anderen preis offeriert hat.Nichts desto trotz, das zimmer hält/hotel hält nicht im geringsten einen 4stern standart.Doch das beste kommt erst. Nachdem wir über 1000.- im hauseigenen „casino“ wenn man das überhaupt casino oder eher freakshow nennen darf, da scheinbar jeder da reingelassen wird und alles eher provisorisch, statt professionell ist, wollten wir um 3:00 noch ein bier trinken. Da wurde uns gesagt, sorry es ist nicht mehr möglich……….Obwohl uns gesagt wurde das „casino“ hat bis um 4:00 geöffnet wurden wir um 3:30 rausgeschmissen und mehr als 10 Angestellte standen blöd rum und behaupteten das es unmöglich wäre noch ein bier aus dem hahnen zu lassen!!!!Nach mehr als einer halben stunde zu diskutieren bot ein angestellter an für uns an die Tankstelle zu laufen um bier zu hohlen, obwohl wir noch neben dem bierhanen standen. Ich gab ihm also geld und nach weiteren 15 min kam er zurück und sagte, sorry die tankstelle ist geschlossen aber behalte das geld und bringt uns am nächsten tag bier!!!!!Ich denke mehr muss ich dazu nicht sagen. Einfach nur erbärmlich, vom einchecken, welches schon viel zu lange dauerte eine reine Enttäuschung!!!!!!!!!!!Finger weg!!!
Date: Date of stay: June 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Tolles Hotel mit super Lage in Windhoek
Review Content: Sehr angenehmes Hotel für 1-2 Tage Windhoek am Ende oder Anfang der Rundreise. Sektempfang, großzügige Zimmer, gutes Frühstücksbuffet, sehr engagierte Mitarbeiter an der Rezeption, tolle Lage, alles fußläufig. Eine Mitarbeiterin half uns bei einem liegen gebliebenen Koffer in Johannesburg, so dass er innerhalb von 1 1/2 Tagen, pünktlich bis zur unseren Weiterreise, vom Flughafen ins Hotel geliefert wurde. Mitarbeiter beim Frühstück könnten motivierter sein. Leider war der neue Pool-Bereich noch nicht fertig gestellt.
Date: Date of stay: January 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hafeni's journey to room 511
Review Content: AVANI Hotel and casino seems to know the definition of customer service. In fact the reception, the treatment, the meals and much more is simply of a class beyond every expectation. The presence of the staff at all the times makes costumers movements in the hotel's vicinity. Thank you AVANI Hotel and casino.

Name: Thanks but no thanks
Review Content: This hotel is under construction and nothing is mentioned on the website. Swimming pool and gym are not available but they still charge you the same price.Lifts are a nightmare to navigate as there is no guide and you can only operate them from outside. There are *, -1 and 0 with no indication of where these take you. Parking is a horror experience. You get a ticket at the (very difficult to find entrance)  and if you forget to validate it, you have to drive 4 floors up, take the lift down ( if you know which button to press), go back up and navigate through a construction site, to go 4 floors down to street exit. They were welding at the entrance from parking area and we had to ask them to stop as sparks were flying. At night the street at the back of the hotel was lined up with “ ladies of the night”. Staff are friendly. Rooms are comfortable.Not recommended.
Date: Date of stay: October 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Average Stay
Review Content: Stayed at hotel for business purposes and location was very convenient. Rooms are large and offers most amenities we looked for. WiFi is good but they do insist you provide personal details and then except that it may be used for marketing - found that a bit sneaky. Breakfast offered was good but nothing special. Hotel currently under renovations so expect some inconvenience. I do think there are other hotels to consider in area, maybe this would be better after renovations.
Date: Date of stay: September 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: I highly recommend hotel to others
Review Content: An ideal place to stay. Quiet, very comfortable, very friendly and attentive staff. May be try have namibian cuisine so visitors can sample the best of local dishes!Have brighter light for those who want to work at table.
Date: Date of stay: July 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Could be amazing, but not there yet
Review Content: One can understand how important it is for the hotel to continue with its upgrade efforts, but it does unfortunately get in the way of a comfortable hotel experience. It also doesn't help that the other service elements in the hotel don't work as well as they should. As other reviewers have indicated, it takes an absolute age to get a lift (only 2 in operation, with small capacity), and one has to occasionally share the lift with someone from housekeeping with massive bags of linen laundry or armfuls of towels because they don't seem to have a service lift. In my two days there, I had to build in 'travel' time in the hotel because I never knew how long it would take to get to my room on the 11th floor. My first room was inaccessible due to an issue with the locking system so I was moved to another room and to their credit, they upgraded me due to the inconvenience caused. The room was lovely and spacious, with a comfortable bed, couch, large bathroom, and tea/coffee facilities. My upgraded room was clearly meant for the serious business traveler as it included a printer, Bluetooth speaker, and a Nespresso machine. The problem is that if they failed to replenish your coffee station, it takes 3 attempts of requesting an item before it eventually arrives.The hotel's main restaurant offers breakfast and a dinner buffet. The breakfasts were enjoyable with many options available. The buffet dinner was somewhat disappointing, and rather expensive too. On my second night, I opted to eat in the Pantry, the bar/light meals space in the hotel foyer and the food was miles better than the restaurant! I would definitely have eaten all of my meals there if I knew any better.With the hotel undergoing major renovations, there is the issue of drilling and construction noises during the day, sometimes into the early evening. I can see that the hotel is hoping to improve its offer and its customer experience but the service levels leave something to be desired. The staff at reception were very professional and friendly, but the restaurant staff are the opposite. They are not particularly friendly or service oriented. My overall experience of the hotel is one of extremes. Things either work, or they don't . The hotel is next to a small mall and it includes a supermarket on the lower floor, as well as some clothing and touristy shops.You need a bit of patience to stay at the Avani in its current state, but overall an average business trip experience.
Date: Date of stay: June 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice modern business hotel in great location
Review Content: Modern business stule hotel adjacent to shopping mall and close by the parliament and museum buildings.  Situated close by the parliment nd museum buildings and just off the main W-E highway.  Very good value if you book ahead,

Name: Brief stay at the Avani
Review Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Avani. The room was great. The food in the restaurant was good, especially the seafood. Although the hotel was being renovated, it was not too noticeable except that some lifts were out of service. What was somewhat frustrating, was that the escalator to the hotel entrance was not working one way. It made entry to and from the hotel, whcih is situated in a shopping mall, difficult.

Review Content: We had a good couple of days at the hotel.Friendly and helpful staff made it worthwhile .Good food and prompt room service.Our room was cleaned on time and the staff of housekeeping are very friendly as well.Thank you!!

Name: Hotel céntrico y elegante con habitaciones amplias y cómodas
Review Content: Nos alojamos una noche para una visita rápida a Windhoek. Se trata de una hotel grande, con salas de conferencias y espacios para eventos. Nuestra habitación -la estándar- era espaciosa, con dos camas grandes y muy cómodas y con un lavabo equipado con ducha y bañera. El wifi era de calidad. Pagamos unos 105 € con el desayuno incluido. La ubicación excelente, en pleno centro de la ciudad. El desayuno era tipo bufet, con variedad y producto de calidad. Desconozco si dispone de aparcamiento porqué cuando nos alojamos ya habíamos devuelto el coche. Dispone de una pequeña piscina en la azotea. Recomendaría este hotel.
Date: Date of stay: September 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Retour à la civilisation

La restauration est très bonne et variée mais très mal organisée. Les chambres sont spacieuses et confortables. Attention les ascenseurs peuvent être capricieux. La situation géographique de l'hôtel est idéale, en plein centre ville. Hélas l'hôtel manque de charme. Il est placé dans une galerie marchande très glauque le soir.

Name: Mérite ses 4* mais sans plus...
Review Content: L'hôtel est bien placé en plein centre de Windhoek ce qui permet de visiter le centre ville et de faire du shopping.La chambre est très grande avec deux grands lits de 140.Les matelas sont très confortables ce qui est rare en Namibie.La chambre est climatisée. Il y a un coffre, un réfrigérateur mais sans mini bar (seulement de l'eau), une bouilloire avec café et thé, des grands placards et une télé.Il y a le WIFI gratuit dans les chambres.La salle de bain est très grande avec une baignoire et une douche ainsi que tous le nécessaire de toilettes.Le sèche-cheveux est dans le tiroir de la chambre devant le miroir !Les prises électriques sont internationales.Le restaurant sous forme de buffet est parfait tout comme les petits déjeuners du matin.Le bar en face de l'accueil et le casino sont un peu tristes.Il y a une piscine tout en haut de l'hôtel au 15ème étage.

Name: Wellness center💆

So we were given stained former white towels😵.i thought that was bad but when we got to the jacuzi it had stains.It was not white.the air con in the room was not working 😣.all in all it was not a pleasent encounter.i guess we get what we pay for

Name: geht so...
Review Content: Habe dieses Hotel aufgrund Nichtverfügbarkeit des Hilton Hotels gewählt. Die  Zufahrt, resp. das Parkhaus ist recht mühsam. Auch der anschliessende Zugang durch das ältere, kleine Einkaufszentrum passt nicht so. Das Zimmer war angenehm; Nachts wachte ich jedoch jeweils durch laute Musik aus einem der oberen Stockwerke auf. Das Frühstück war angemessen; die Lage an der Avenue ist gut; das Personal an der Rezeption nett. WLAN empfang sehr schwach!!
Date: Date of stay: April 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Ottimo hotel
Review Content: Abbiamo scelto questo hotel per la posizione centrale e la presenza di un (piccolo) centro commerciale. All'arrivo le signore della reception sono state molto gentili, in pochi minuti siamo stati registrati e abbiamo raggiunto la Camera,  spaziosa e pulita. Una volta entrati c'è una piccola anticamera, a destra l'armadio, davanti la porta del bagno e a destra un salottino con tavolino e due poltrone, una scrivania con bollitore e ovviamente il letto. Anche il bagno è grande e pulito, con un bel box doccia a destra, vasca davanti e lavandino sulla sinistra. Dalla nostra camera la connessione Internet era ottima, al momento del check in vi daranno la password da inserire nel vostro dispositivo. Abbiamo consumato in albergo anche la cena, dopo 24 ore di viaggio non avevamo nessuna voglia di uscire, e forse questa è la parte da migliorare. Si tratta di un piccolo buffet, anche con prodotti di qualità ma costoso (il pranzo Costa circa 140 dollari namibiani, la cena, chissà perché 245). Comunque quando abbiamo mangiato noi cucinavano al momento del pesce e degli spaghetti di soia (da abbinare con verdure varie, carne, pollo o pesce). Oltre a questo c'era della carne, pollo ai ferri e contorni. Pochissima frutta, purtroppo, e qualche dolce/gelato. Una sorpresa il caffè espresso, discreto e con un costo più basso che in Italia. Birra sempre più conveniente dell'acqua. Per quanto riguarda la colazione, invece molto meglio: buona scelta di frutta, brioche, pane tostato e non, marmellate e ... nutella! Ovviamente, per chi gradisce, anche salumi vari, uova e formaggio. Se avete necessità di una sim card locale, potete andare al supermercato ubicato esternamente, basta fare una rampa di scale, magari anche per prendere acqua (7 dollari a bottiglietta) o qualcos'altro, e acquistarne una per telefonare in Italia e avete anche internet disponibile: costo 7 dollari, ma fate subito una ricarica di almeno 150. Volendo, prima dell'ingresso dell'hotel c'è anche una banca per cambiare gli euro (attenzione agli orari, noi siamo arrivati quando era già chiusa). Insomma, io l'Avani lo consiglierei di sicuro!
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

One suggestion is that the security guard directs new guests towards the entrance to the hotel. Entering through the shopping centre is confusing when you first arrive. Definitely a place to return to in future.

An der rezeption herrschte völlige Hilflosigkeit und Desinteresse uns nach 18 Stunden Flugzeit um 11:00 vormittags ein gebuchtes Zimmer zuzuweisen!Erst als die Managerin merkte (nach einer Stunde Wartezeit), dass nichts sich bewegte waren wir um 12:30 erschöpft im Zimmer.

Name: Not a good place for business people.
Review Content: I was at the Avani for over a month for business purposes. Not once during my stay did the internet work properly. It was near impossible to do anything with the connection. I was promised repeatedly it would be fixed. It NEVER was. If you plan on coming to Windhoek and require an internet connection to do your work, find another hotel.Do not stay on the south side of the hotel as there is a nightclub across the street and plays music until 06:00 on the weekends.
Date: Date of stay: April 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: En plein centre ville
Review Content: La situation de l'hôtel Avani permet de se déplacer à pied dans le centre de Windhoek. On y accède via une galerie marchande. Ce n'est pas vraiment un hôtel de charme mais le confort est bon et le petit déjeuner offre un buffet d'une grande variété. Le personnel est souriant. Je n'y resterai pas une semaine mais pour un ou deux jours c'est OK.
Date: Date of stay: February 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel in einem Einkaufszentrum mitten in Windhoek
Review Content: Das Hotel liegt in einem Einkaufszentrum in Windhoek - ganz praktisch, wenn man noch was besorgen möchte. Die Zimmer waren groß und sauber und man hatte eine schöne Aussicht über Windhoek. Es gab auch einen Pool, allerdings recht klein. Da wir nur eine Nacht in dem Hotel verbrachten haben, kann ich nicht viel mehr dazu sagen - mir ist auf jeden Fall nichts besonders negativ aufgefallen.
Date: Date of stay: August 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Zentral gelegen im Zentrum
Review Content: Nach einem Nachtflug kamen wir früh 9 Uhr im Hotel an. Eigentlich wären die Zimmer erst ab 14 Uhr fertig, aber man versprach uns, dass das Zimmer 12 Uhr fertig wäre. Nach wenigen Minuten wurde uns dann gesagt, wir könnten jetzt schon in das Zimmer. Super und Danke! Das Personal war sehr, sehr freundlich. Das Zimmer war groß und gut ausgestattet. Das Frühstück war ebenfalls top.Das Hotel befindet sich in einem Einkaufscenter inmitten der Stadt. Jedoch sollte man beachten, dass in Namibia zwischen 17 und 18 Uhr die Geschäfte schließen.
Date: Date of stay: November 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Recent name change and difficult to find but excellent hotel
Review Content: This hotel used to be known  as the Kalahari Sands and on the GPS and google maps it is still like that and not AVANI. Further more, you can spot the hotel from a few blocks away, but due to the fact that it is located in a shopping mall makes it difficult to find. Drive into the parking at the mall, drive all the way up to level 4 and then enter the mall at the stairs, and look across the mall where you will see the hotel entrance. Once inside, this is an awesome hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful. It was hot and we would have loved a welcoming drink or wet towel, but no luck. We had a lovely room a bath and a shower and large bed. Some of the staff make a point of remembering guests' names and are very helpful. The hotel provide parking tickets in order for guests to park for free. In the breakfast room, Richard started to talk to my husband and they were like old friends each morning, Richard calling my husband on his name and remembering how he likes his coffee. O and each morning, returning from  breakfast, we found our room already cleaned and made up and fresh for the day - awesome. One night we went to the Oasis bar as it was very hot. We decided to have fish and chips with our beer and could not believe our eyes and taste buds! The food was presented beautifully on a very large plate and every thing, that is the salad, chips and fish were excellent. If not for the issues with finding the hotel and the lack of a welcome drink, I would have given AVANI Windhoek 5 stars. Will try to go back.
Date: Date of stay: September 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Lugar perfecto si tienes que pasar noche en Windhoek
Review Content: Sinceramente Windhoek no merece una parada pero si hay que pasar noche este es un lugar ideal. Habitaciones amplias y confortables, en pleno centro, muy buena comida en el restaurante y muy buena atención. No creo que regrese a Windhoek pero si lo hago este hotel será mi elección.
Date: Date of stay: July 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Ottimo. Centrale e comodo
Review Content: Facilissimo da individuare vista l'altezza dell'edificio, è già ben visibile quando si arriva in centro dall'aeroporto. L'entrata del parcheggio non è su Independence Avenue ma sulla via parallela dietro, si sale con l'auto al terzo piano e si entra già nel centro commerciale al piano giusto. Le camere sono molto spaziose, bagno con vasca e doccia, condizionatore intelligente che quando spegni le luci si mette da solo su "sleep" per far meno rumore. Non tantissime le prese di corrente in camera. Posizione centralissima. Colazione molto varia ed abbondante. Disponibili in reception dei timbri da apporre sul tagliando del parcheggio per non doverlo pagare all'uscita, in quanto ospiti dell'hotel. Consigliatissimo
Date: Date of stay: May 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Molto bello!
Review Content: Lo consiglio vivamente! Camere e parti comuni bellissime ed eleganti! Pulitissimo.. Personale cordiale e preparato! Si trova in zona super centrale.. E la colazione e buonissima e super varia dal dolce al salato! Lo consiglio andateci! L'unica nota non positiva e il wife a pagamento! Ormai dovrebbe essere incluso nel costo della camera come l'80% degli alberghi che ci sono nel mondo! Comunque nel complesso super soddisfatto!
Date: Date of stay: August 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel with bad smells from bathroom.
Review Content: This is a good business hotel, centre of town, good restaurant, big rooms and mostly good staff. Enjoyed my stay of 3 nights but got irritated with the 3x elevators, the only way to get to my room on the 7th floor. The management should ban the staff from using the elevators during peak hours, they move from one floor to the other, certainly they can use the stairs. Waited for 10 minutes at times. Going to the bar is useless, rather use outside cafe's etc. The service is bad, I think the bar man's name was Kenneth, I managed to get one drink and then waited for 20 mins and left without second drink.  The plumbing need attention, I had bad smells from the bathroom and had to complain twice before they attended to the problem but the disgusting smell just came back on the last day. Room 709.
Date: Date of stay: October 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bon rapport qualité prix
Review Content: Hôtel fonctionnel, bien situé dans le centre ville de Windhoek (avec une entrée un peu particulière dans un centre commercial). Parking gratuit ce qui est appréciable.Chambre confortable et spacieuse, idéale pour une famille (2 adultes  - 2 enfants). Petit déjeuner (buffet) copieux et de qualité. Room service rapide et satisfaisant.Seule petite ombre au tableau, des remontées d'odeurs depuis les sanitaires malgré une ventilation fonctionnant à plein régime.En conclusion, idéal pour une étape en famille.
Date: Date of stay: July 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Zentral in Windhoek
Review Content: Wir bereisen Namibia und andere afrikanische Länder seit fast 20 Jahren.Wenn in Windhoek angekommen, hier lässt es sich gut nach langer Reise ruhen oder auch vor dem Rückflug übernachten. Das Preis-leistungsverhältnis stimmt, man kann Primäre oder letzte Einkäufe in der Umgebung tätigen.Bitte lassen sie sich Zimmer in höher gelegenen Stockwerken geben, man kann dann sehr schön über die Stadt schauen.restaurant war diesmal mässig.
Date: Date of stay: April 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: bel hôtel mais service très médiocre
Review Content: Dernier hôtel avant de rentrer. Belle chambre.Bonne restauration mais service médiocre et pas du tout souriant.À la réception idem, pas de sourire et pas d'effort pour rendre service.Après 13 jours de périple à travers la Namibie, c'est à cet hôtel que (bizarrement) nous étions 3 sur 15 qui n'arrivions plus à ouvrir nos valises avec le code.Obligés de forcer nos valises.Au moment du départ, devant l'hôtel, alors que le chauffeur fermait à clé une soute à bagage, 2 ou 3 voleurs en "taxi" on dérobés 2 valises dans la soute opposée pas encore fermée à clé. Bizarre aussi !!! :(
Date: Date of stay: October 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Comfortable, centrally located.
Review Content: Right in the heart of Windhoek, walking distance from main shops, restaurants, tourist attractions. Lovely cuisine! I remember experiencing Christmas there, while staying at the hotel during some of wintry months. It was their special promotion. Just imagine, how surprised i was walking through the lobby and there was beautifully decorated Christmas tree! For breakfast I could choose from variety of Christmas and festive dishes. A surprise treat!
Date: Date of stay: June 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: hotel internazionale in centro
Review Content: anche se difficile da individuare se non sei accompagnato, in quanto è all'interno di un centro commerciale e per di più al 2° piano, è comunque il classico albergo internazionale di un paese meta di turismo di gruppo. le stanze e i servizi sono assai spaziosi, pulizia e organizzazione all'altezza delle stelle, prima colazione notevole per assortimento.tutto perfetto quanto anonimo e spersonalizzato, ma questa non vuole essere una nota negativa, è solo il denominatore comune di questo tipo di alberghi. lo consiglierei comunque ad un amico.
Date: Date of stay: November 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: comodo e pulito!!!!!
Review Content: E' stata la mia ultima notte in Namibia. albergo comodo nel centro della città.(anche se il centro della capitale non regala grandi attrazioni)Camere pulite e molto spaziose, piscina al piano superiore discreta ma acqua gelida. buono anche il servizio bar ristorante testato sia per cena che per colazione. Il casino alla sera regala qualche emozione in più nel senso che è pieno di gente matta.Parcheggio comodo.Ci tornerei!!!!
Date: Date of stay: February 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: viel zu überteuert, aber zentral
Review Content: Hotel im 1. stock eines Einkaufszentrum, Parkmöglichkeiten sind vorhanden. Empfang und Lobby sehr repräsentativ, allerdings mangelt es an Freundlichkeit des Personals. Nur widerwillig werden Fragen beantwortet und "Gast ist König" war definitiv nicht die Einstellung des Personals. Zimmer sind abgewohnt aber geräumig. Badezimmer hätte ich keinem 4-Sterne-Hotel zugeordnet. Ausserdem wurde gerade umgebaut, von früh bis spät nachmittags war es höllisch laut, sodass man sich im zimmer nur schreiend unterhalten konnte - vorgewarnt wurden wir nicht, entschuldigt hat sich auch keiner (sind ja schließlich doch immense preise die man zahlt für ein 4-sterne hotel). Neuankömmlinge nach einem langen Flug haben es da schwer Ruhe zu finden. + Lage- Freundlichkeit- Komfort
Date: Date of stay: January 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: sehr alt  und  ekelhafte Zimmer
Review Content: Musst beruflich nach Windhoek und die Hotelauswahl ist sehr begrenzt. Das Kalahari Sands Hotel gehört zu den drei 4 Sterne Häusern der Stadt. So ein altes und abgewohntes Zimmer habe ich lange nicht mehr gesehen. Das Bad war eine Zumutung (wurde seit dem Bau in den 50er Jahren nicht mehr renoviert). Preise sind absolut überzogen für das Haus. Gott sei Dank eröffnet Ende des Monates ein HILTON gegenüber. Die Lage ist nämlich gut, direkt in einem Shopping Center und zu Fuß ist einiges zu erreichen. Personal ist leider auch sehr unfreundlich !
Date: Date of stay: April 2010This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Old Darling needing a facelift (or two)
Review Content: I have stayed at Kalahari Sands twice. Both times, the lifts have not been working properly resulting in long waiting times - which can be as long as 15 minutes.The property is undergoing some sort of refurbishment, which caused some noise during the day. Otherwise, the hotel is very quiet and peaceful.The rooms I have stayed in were quite spacious and decent. Nothing fancy, but a solid slightly worn ***-gear. Bathroom was clean, but again not from the latest collections.The front office staff was very kind and efficient. They even knew that the wireless network is not strong in the room allocated for me and asked if I wanted another.As some earlier reviews discounted the dinner buffet, I decided to try it. It was not actually so bad, but neither was it something special. I think it will not be difficult to find better alternatives. The lobby bar serves some light meals, which are better value for money. The staff at the bar is slightly uninterested, but they are an exemption from the rest. The bar houses also some local entrepreneurs, which may make it inconvenient for other ladies or those with children.There also is a small roof-top pool and a couple of sun chairs. It usually is a nice and quiet place, if you somehow manage to get up there… the same dysfunctional lifts referred to earlier should take you here. In the interest of time, I took the stairs.The location of the hotel is very good. There are many nice restaurants just around the corner. The area, and especially Independence Avenue, usually is safe during daylight, however the streets behind the hotel may not be.
Date: Date of stay: March 2008This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not pleasant staff
Review Content: Restaurant Staff especially staff Working during breakfast were gloomy and rude. Do not possess requirements for guest relations personnel. We I arrive the room was not ready coz I was checked into a room that was not functional (air conditioner not working) and later moved to another room with tv not working properly. I was at this point tired of complaining so I just kept mum.

Review Content: Avani Windhoek a good , affordable and excellent hotel for both families and travelers.My family and I spent two weeks there and we were frankly impressed with the service we got.The front office staff are so lovely to talk to.Our stay was made homily away from our home in Lusaka. The location of the hotel is just perfect, right in the CBD and makes access to any point so easy whether by foot or car.

At the Pantry I remember two ladies, Sylvia and Shanice. They are friendly and shows that they really love their job. On a particular day, the pantry was full but I was surprised at how they managed to deliver at every customer's expectation.I don't mind coming back to AVANI anytime.

Best hotel experience thus far is amazing and will give it a 5star rating.

Name: Excellent service! 👍👍👍👍👍
Review Content: My family stayed at Hotel Avani Windhoek for 5 days. All the hotel staff were very friendly and welcomed us. From receptionists, bellboy, housekeeping and service staff.The breakfast buffet offered a wide variety of fresh fruits, pastries, and hot dishes that catered to every taste. I particularly enjoyed the made-to-order omelet station, where the chef prepared my omelet exactly to my liking. Oh ya, my sons love the salmon and waffles! 😋The staff at the Dunes restaurant were incredibly attentive and courteous. Our server, Michelle ensure we had everything we needed and made excellent recommendations from the menu! Thanks for your kind assist.The ambiance in the dining area was elegant and relaxing, with soft music playing in the background. The tables were always clean and well-presented, which added to the overall dining experience.Thanks Avani Windhoek Hotel!
Date: Date of stay: July 2024This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Review Content: Spectacular views of the city, that showcase the pristine and unpolluted skyline of of Windhoek. The ambiance is tranquilly, serene, and relaxed. The crowd’s oft-laid back, quiet, and cosmopolitan.  PS: Shanice is a perfect hostess and Buffy was great too

Name: A must stop to enjoy downtown Windhoek
Review Content: We had a lovely lunch at Pantry today. Our table faced the street so we got to enjoy all the bustling citygoers while we dined. The cafe latte hit the spot as did all the yummy juices. We ordered the chicken burger, Greek salad, mushroom pasta, cheesy meatballs, and toasted sandwiches. The food was all fresh and served promptly. Best for us was our server Olga. She was delightful and made sure we enjoyed everything. Highly recommend this spot for a leisurely and delicious lunch!

Name: Roof top Pool and view and dj expeience while rating class food!!!
Review Content: It's not my first visit to the Avani rooftop bar restaurant. But since asked hereby the review. It is a place that has everything. And that's coming from a solo eater/chiller Who doesnt like to go solo.Ambiance is very good. Regular DJs with good music. Staff is great. Food is even better.Not the cheapest but that shouldn't hold u from enjoying amazing views and even a cheeky dip in the pool from this great casino hotel that is setup to entertain and feel lush.5 out of 5 or 10 out of 10What are you waiting for? Get your a$$ in here!! So I don't have to come solo anymore :-)Oh yeah as a Disney lover and alcoholic loved the Hakuna Matata cocktail on the menu..!!!

Name: Worth it if you don't get embroiled with reservation
Review Content: The breakfast crew was amazing! Many thanks to the whole team, who tried to satisfy our requests.The room management staff were also great in providing the best comfort.Lunch/dinner at the pantry was yummy, albeit we had to wait some time to get served.The reception personnel was a mix...some very capable and efficient staff on one side while some terribly hopeless people on the other hand. And i prefer not to mention the mediocre back office.Some of the staff go out of their way to make sure you are enjoying your stay at the Avani. They truly are dedicated. All our thanks go to Zigo, Sascha, Moses, Helvi, Katrina, Laula, Ti-a and Kavemunu and their colleagues. Near the hotel a lil shopping area. Other shopping outlets within walking distance. Also near are the craft markets and landmarks, including the church.Nice view from upper rooms and from 15th floor bar. Enjoy beautiful sunrise and sunset. Nice gym also available 24/7.

Name: Добротный отель в центре города
Review Content: Добротный отель. Находится в центре города. Нашли вход в него не сразу, так как он находится в торговом центре. Номера просторные и чистые, кондиционер работает хорошо, постели удобные. Санузлы большие, есть ванна и отдельная душевая кабина. Завтрак добротный, но ничем не выдающийся. Около отеля много магазинов и небольшой рыночек с поделками местных ремесленников.
Date: Date of stay: January 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Gehobenes Hotel?
Review Content: Wir mussten uns die Zeit in Windhoek totschlagen, da unser Flug am Abend ging. Windhoek selbst ist meiner Meinung nach keinen Besuch wert. Alles ist lärmig, lauter Baustellen, keine wirklich ansprechende City, die einlädt zum Verweilen. Also sind wir zu einem kleinen Snack in das Avani Hotel gegangen. Erst einmal ansprechend und freundliche Sevicekräfte begrüßen uns. Nach einer Weile stellen wir fest, dass wir zwar die Karte bekommen haben, niemand kommt aber wieder, um unsere Bestellung aufzunehmen. Währenddessen stellen wir auch fest, dass wir immer mehr anziehen, da die Klimaanlage auf sehr kalt gestellt ist. Sehr unangenehm. Mir ist es immer ein Rätsel, wie Leute in diesen vollklimatisierten Räumen ohne Schaden zu nehmen, aushalten. Wir sind in Afrika und gedulden uns, unsere Bestellung wird von der sehr freundlichen Bedienung schließlich aufgenommen. Bis das Essen kommt, dauert es ebenfalls recht lange. Was mir sehr negativ in diesem Hotel aufgefallen ist, ist der Zustand der Hoteltoilette im Foyerbereich. Für ein Hotel diesen Standards unterirdisch!
Date: Date of stay: October 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Sehr gutes Hotel, aber der Zugang ist schrecklich
Review Content: Das Hotel liegt in guter Lage an der Independence Ave im Zentrum, das man von dort aus fußläufig erkunden kann. Sollte man mit dem Taxi ankommen, muss man durch eine viel besuchte Einkaufspassage, mit der Rolltreppe in den ersten Stock, an Bankautomaten vorbei zum Eingang des Hotels. Gleich gegenüber der Rezeption befindet sich das Casino - lauter Spielautomatenlärm dringt ins Foyer, Spielsüchtige - vor allem ältere Frauen - stehen Schlange. Wir empfinden diesen Eingang einfach schrecklich.   Mit dem Leihwagen ankommend fährt man auf der Rückseite des Hotels in das Parkhaus bis in den 4. Stock. Dort sind Parkplätze für Hotelgäste reserviert, der Zugang aber genauso schrecklich. Der Zugangsbereich zu Lift und Zimmern wird nochmals durch Personal abgesichert.Unser Zimmer war groß, sehr sauber und entsprach nach der überfälligen Renovierung nun wieder einem 4-Sterne Niveau. Wir hatten im 9. Stock einen schönen Blick über Windhoek.Das Fruehstueck ist sehr reichhaltig, wurde immer frisch aufgefüllt und so hatten wir täglich einen hervorragenden Start in den Tag. Das Preis- /Leistungsverhältnis ist in Ordnung, wenn das Frühstück im Zimmerpreis eingeschlossen ist. WLAN ist vorhanden, jedoch kostenpflichtig. Im Zimmer angekommen fühlten wir uns sehr wohl.
Date: Date of stay: January 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Great central situation which again good for business visits. Staff attentive and main restaurant good quality. Stayed 16 nights

Name: Kalahari Sands Hotel is back on track
Review Content: Some time ago i was very sad about the Kalahari Sands after having stayed there with a group of clients last February.  I wrote a rather negative review about the service and the elevators and some other stuff.  Today I am happy to tell you that i think the hotel is back on the good track.  I stayed at the Kalahari Sands for three nights this month and i noticed the change for better.  The first good news is that the three elevators are now working and that is a considerable improvement!  Service in the Dunes restaurant during breakfast is unbelievably better.  There's more people to help the clients, coffee is almost immediately served as you sit down, tables are reset much faster than before.  It is in fact a lot better!
Date: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: ON REFERME LA PARENTHESE  NAMIBIENNE
Review Content: Et voilà, le rêve se termine, il nous faut rentrer chez nous et reprendre l'avion mais avant nous passons une dernière nuit sur le sol Africain dans cet immense hôtel ou nous nous sentons un peu perdu . La chambre est immense et la salle de bains luxueuse, toutes sortes de produits sont mis à notre disposition, bain moussant , shampooing, peigne, charlotte, necessaire de rasage pour les hommes. Petit bémol, impossible d'accèder à la salle de restaurant, nous sommes vendredi , fin de semaine et la fête bat son plein avec un chanteur dans la salle de restauration : résultat, une cacophonie sans nom, on ne s'entend même pas parler. Nous nous empressons de prendre un plateau repas et l'emportons dans notre chambre. Par contre le lendemain matin après avoir chercher vainement le sèche cheveux, caché dans un tiroir du bureau, nous nous sommes tapé un excellent petit déjeuner avant d'affronter 15 heures de vol. Si vous avez le temps, pensez à monter découvrir le restaurant panoramique et la piscine au dernier étage.
Date: Date of stay: September 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Incorrect
Review Content: L'hôtel, où nous avons séjourné le samedi 21 octobre, est en complète transformation, à commencer par les 4 ou 5 étages de parking. Un avis posé dans la chambre fait état des très gros désagréments que cela provoque mais aucune information lors de la réservation. Comme je l'ai indiqué à la réception, c'est lors du booking qu'il faut le préciser afin de pouvoir chercher un autre endroit. Impossible de dormir, les marteaux piqueurs ont sévi le samedi jusqu'à 23h et, surtout, le dimanche matin dès 5h !!. Entre deux, déménagement, coup de marteau et autres bruits sourds nous ont valu une belle nuit blanche. Cerise sur le gâteau: il y a 3 ascenseurs dans l'hôtel mais 2 étaient en panne. Et comme tout le monde part en même temps, pas besoin de préciser le temps d'attente des bagages le dimanche matin.... Pour terminer sur une meilleure note, le buffet du repas du soir est très bon.
Date: Date of stay: October 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Dinner at Avani Windhoek
Review Content: Had dinner with friends at the Avani 's Dunes restaurant the food was cold and below par from the starter since they only offer a Buffet the selection was limited with soup cold on a cold evening to make matters worse it wasnt only the Soup but all the food was cold not sure if their beinmarries are working but our waitress was kind and swift which was the only positive from the dinner
Date: Date of stay: May 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice hotel terrible food
Review Content: We stayed at this hotel as an overnight stop on the way to kobo kobo Hills. The hotel is situated in a small shopping centre. We stayed in a superior room on the 3rd floor facing the road. The room is a nice size and the bathroom is sufficient with a separate bath and shower. The airconditioner in the room works very well. The dinner at the hotel restaurant was a buffet which we weren't to keen on so we ordered fillet steak from room service. Both steaks arrived ice cold and were as tough as leather (I would be very surprised if it was fillet). We then decided to give room service another try by ordering apple pie served hot with vanilla pod ice cream and cream anglaise. What arrived was ice cold tasteless apple pie from the fridge decorated with whipped cream from a can on top of it. The vanilla pod ice cream on the side was a tasteless scoop of bright blue ice cream. We didn't bother to eat any of it after one bite. Okay hotel but I would make other eating arrangements if you stay here.
Date: Date of stay: January 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Awful Room Service
Review Content: I am at Avani hotel now, checking out on Saturday the 10th. I just experienced the worst treatment with their room service. While am busy working in my room I decided to order dinner with the room service. First there was no response after calling for more than 4 times, when I enquired at the reception they were happy to assist by taking my order-- I should have known better. Then I waited for more than an hour, of course I didn't notice the time flying by coz I was busy. When I decided to check, coz I was now desperately hungry, the room service hadn't received my order and the reception simply dismissed it as a misunderstanding in the kitchen. Am going to bed very hungry, very angry coz it's rather too late to order anything else risking another hour's wait.It's a shame that incompetences and sheer laziness of the staff should overshadow what would've be an excellent stays the hotel. A four star hotel could do better in monitoring their standards. I doubt whether they care at all. This has left a very bad taste in my mouth, literally.
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Review Content: Would choose this place for business trip as the location is in the city centre in the shopping mall, has its own casino.Food at the breakfast is better than average but service is far away from great. There was no welcome "hello" neither at the reception not at the breakfast.Very little pool at the top of the building. Late check out is $200 (i.e after 12pm).
Date: Date of stay: August 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: ein wundervoller Start ins Abenteuer Namibia
Review Content: Das Hotel ist ein Traum Schon der erste Eindruck war super - wir waren mit dem Auto unterwegs und waren nicht sicher, ob wir am richtigen Ort fuer die Garage sind, ein netter Herr hat uns  dann gesagt er zeige es uns und ist uns vorausgegangen - er hat uns gebeten  ins Parkhaus zu fahren und in den 4ten Stock zufahren. Dort hat er auf uns gewartet und uns einen Parkplatz zugeteilt. Anschliessend half er u ns mit dem Gepaeck vor die Hotelempfangshalle die eben in diesem 4ten Stock ist.Das Zimmer was sauber und gross. Wundervolles Badezimmer mit einem Brausekopf, der sich von Regendusche bis hartem Wasserstrahl einstellen liess. Die Bar im Hotel ist gut sortiert und wir hatten das grosse Glueck, dass an diesem Abend eine Live-Saengerin in der Bar war - super Stimme  - genialdie Bar hat gebebt, super Stimmung, es wurde getanzt und es war ein wunderschoener erster Abend in einem tollen, interssanten, spannenden und noch unbekannten Land.Das Fruehstueck haben wir im eingenommen es ist reichhaltig und schoen presentiert wordenwir haben das Hotel in bester Erinnerung
Date: Date of stay: January 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: It's nice!
Review Content: I was quite surprised with the free internet (before it runs out) and the speed, for a South African, is quite fast. Nothing like free slow internet.The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Pity the entrance to the hotel is through a mall which is not appealing at all. When we got there there was only one lift working and this took at 3hrs for them to fix it.All in all a good hotel. Is give it a 3,5 but not a 4.
Date: Date of stay: July 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Namibia - Windhoek
Review Content: This is  a great hotel if you are doing business in central Windhoek as you could probably walk just about anywhere you needed to be in the city centre. Its not far from Klein WIndhoek and is accessible from all the main routes in and out of town. Although the hotel has apparently been refurbished, it could do with a good clean and polish but its a comfortable stay with all the things you need if there on business. It does have WiFi but you have to buy the airtime which I think is ridiculous in today's time with connectivity being a pre-requisite on any business trip. The staff are friendly but the service isn't that great - I had to wait over two hours for my room service meal to eventually be delivered. Management are not that visible and although when I did find someone of authority I was promised that this cold meal would not appear on my bill, this wasn't the case.Not bad overall but they need to pull their socks up if they want to stay competitive.
Date: Date of stay: July 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: OK for business travellers
Review Content: The hotel is located in the heart of downtown Windhoek (which is not a big city). The rooms at the hotel are comfortable and spacious. Wifi - which is not free - works well in the rooms. The hotel is in a shopping mall that is busy during the day but dies completely at night. Staff I found were general not particularly friendly or helpful, and the area was deserted and a little eerie after dark. Don't feel this is the best option for leisure travellers to Windhoek, but well located for business.
Date: Date of stay: June 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Australians like the Kalahari
Review Content: My wife and I and a friend spent a pre trip night at the Kalahari Sands Hotel and found it to be a pleasing experience. The hotel offers good quiet rooms and comfortable beds. Breakfast was more than adequate. Situated in a shopping complex did not detract from the experience and indeed it was convenient to have a super market in the building. The staff were couteous and efficient and indeed the concierge was most helpful.The hotel is situated in central Winhoek and in walking distance of restaurants and shops. A pleasant hotel most suitable for a stop over.
