Dommage, nous serions restés avec plaisir une ou deux nuits supplémentaires. L'hôtel est très bien situé, calme et les chambres sont propres, le personnel est charmant. Toutefois la douche de notre salle de bain était trop étroite. De plus, pas de viennoiseries au petit déjeuner, dommage !L

Name: The right place in Windhoek
Review Content: Good situation in center of Windhoek, very good breakfast. Good to be there too if you like gambling. Rooftop was closed during my stay. They also arranged transportation  for Airport. Situation is perfect in center of Windhoek with restaurants and bars nearby.

Name: Solid experience
Review Content: During my 1st visit to Namibia, the Avani was my hotel of choice.  From reception, to the rooms, to the dining area, it was pretty much standard for a business stay.  Friendly staff was the highlight.  The hotel offered exactly what you would expect.  I would say the lowlight was that the hotel pool was undergoing renovations, and in the Windhoek heat (35 degree + for the week) a pool to cool down would have been really welcome.Would I stay there again?  Yes I would. It’s central location is probably the biggest selling point.
Date: Date of stay: November 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Stay review
Review Content: Service great Room are spacious Bathroom spacious have a shower as well as a bathtub Service is great staff very friendly rooms clean and neat room service is great air conditioner was functioning wellFeel safe and secure

Name: Second Visit- Staff on Point
Review Content: I visited Windhoek on business, for one night. I walked into a newly renovated foyer and friendly staff. I was not too happy on arrival, the hotel arranged for city cabs to pick me up from the airport but I was left waiting for an hour. The front desk manager and reception staff were very eager to listen to my complaint and follow up with the cab company.  The hotel is under renovation, expect a lot of drilling noises and slow elevators(if this is new, that is disappointing). I noted a few issues and handed it to reception on check out and I was happy with the level of customer service I received. Well done to all the staff, who knew of Mrs. Naidoo and her complaints. Keep up the great service, I will be back, hopefully the third time’s the charm!
Date: Date of stay: July 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The Avani experience.
Review Content: We have a really pleasant stay at the Avani Hotel Windhoek. The most memorable feature of our stay was the excellent and unforgetable breakfast - it was super!The only negative feature was the problems that we had with the lifts but as you are busy with upgrading,  I believe that this will be dissolved.

Name: Umbau
Review Content: Bei diesen Beeinträchtigungen ist es eine Unverschämtheit den vollen Hotelpreis zu verlangen. Dreck, Lärm, kein Fahrstuhl, kein Schwimmbad, keine Wellnessbehandlungen, Frühstücksbuffet mit verschimmeltem Brot..
Date: Date of stay: April 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Run form this hotel
Review Content: This hotel was beyond awful.  There were bird feces all over the windows (the entire side of the hotel), no garage, hotel under construction.  Elevators take forever.  When we called to complain, no one answers at reception so we packed our bags and immediately checked out.  They said it was a holiday (December 26) so limited staff but that is no excuse for a hotel.  Could not print out boarding pass (printer down) etc..We moved to a fantastic hotel on same street.  Avani called us there to apologize and said to contact Expedia and they would authorize a full refund and it has been a month and still no refund from the Avani or Expedia after numerous calls.Hotel is in major need of renovation and experienced, accountable staff.
Date: Date of stay: December 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Mooi hotel in het centrum van de stad
Review Content: Windhoek is geen grote hoofdstad en dus ook vrij rustig qua verkeer. Het hotel was ideaal gelegen, alles bevond zich op wandelafstand, geen geluidshinder, proper, alles in orde. Op de bovenste verdieping was een klein zwembadje aanwezig. In het restaurant hebben wij alleen ontbijt genomen en dit was prima in orde. Een klein minpuntje: het hotel was aan het renoveren en overdag (tijdens de werken) was slechts één lift beschikbaar. Dus het was altijd wachten op de lift.
Date: Date of stay: October 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Arrivo in Namibia dall'Italia
Review Content: Dopo un viaggio con tappa ad Addis Abeba, siamo arrivati a Windhoek e abbiamo soggiornato per una notte  prima di partire per il tour. L'hotel è all'interno di un centro commerciale e la sistemazione è stata confortevole con cena di buon livello. Unico neo (!) su tre ascensori ne funzionava solo uno e vi lascio immaginare la confusione per il trasporto valige. Nel complesso, lo consiglio.
Date: Date of stay: October 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Très bien
Review Content: Situé en centre ville, cet hôtel est idéalement placé pour commencer une immersion namibienne.Les chambres sont très spacieuses et confortables et la cuisine est très bonne.Une valeur sûre. Je conseille vivement.
Date: Date of stay: September 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great Location
Review Content: Stayed for a couple of nights for the first of a series of visits to Windhoek and I will certainly be booking here again. Nice large room with views over the city towards the mountains.The hotel is conveniently located for the CBD and attractions such as the zoo park, craft market and parliament gardens. Food in the restaurant is a buffet for all meals although room service meals are available. I found the choices to be good for me, and at around £18 for the dinner buffet generally good value compared to other hotels I have stayed in around the world. The price is higher than local restaurants and food outlets, but that is normal for a hotel.Service was excellent throughout, with polite and respectful service from all staff I met from reception, restaurant or housekeeping. The only downside was redevelopment work which was a little noisy at times but did not disturb sleep.
Date: Date of stay: August 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Belle le stanze, luminose, pulite, dotate di ogni confort. WiFi funzionante in tutta la struttura, piacevole e rinfrescante la mini piscina sul terrazzo.

Name: Back home to Avani hotel
Review Content: After 25 years of coming to Kalahari sands thats now Avani Hotels, still have the same quality, same warmth and same service,I was really excited to be back to the hotel after soo many years, my heart melted form the great warmth and great service we  got as we were checked in by Tutaleni, sweet juice but relieving after a long trip, we are really thrilled to know that such personality still exist since we were here, she checked us in, and all went smooth, restaurant food is OK not really bad and Westa took good care of us and we are glad.Carpets a little old but wider rooms and clean and very spacious.Thank you Avani for welcoming us back again.

Name: Highly recommended!
Review Content: We received a very warm welcome from the friendly staff, and swift service . Close to all amenities,  which makes it very convenient.  We had a great time at Avani and will definitely visit again. Highly recommended.

Name: Zentrale Lage, geräumige Zimmer, aber etwas unpersönlich
Review Content: Das Avani eignet sich aufgrund seiner zentralen Lage gut für eine Stadtbesichtigung und Shopping in Windhoek oder als Ankunfts-/Abreisehotel. An der Rezeption und im Restaurant wirkte auf uns alles etwas unpersönlich. Unser geräumiges Zimmer lag zur Straßenseite, was bei geschlossenen Fenstern nicht weiter groß störte. Das Abendessenbuffet ist recht üppig und qualitativ o.k., bietet sogar Show-Cooking.Wir haben hier den besten Malva-Pudding unserer Reise gegessen. Das Frühstücksbuffet fanden wir auch o.k. Direkt neben dem Hoteleingang befindet sich auch ein Geldautomat, so dass man sich bei Ankunft recht einfach mit ersten Nambischen Doller versorgen kann. Im Untergeschoss des angeschlossenen Einkaufszentrum ist auch ein Supermarkt. Hier konnten wir vor unserem Trip noch einiges einkaufen.Für einen kurzen Aufenthalt ist das Stadthotel gut geeignet.
Date: Date of stay: July 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: very good
Review Content: I stayed in Avani hotel in Namibia twiceboth times I had a great time,rooms and services from the receptionrooms are very nice and compfortablemany shops and molls including supermarket nearby th hotelnice people and great serviceespecially recommended
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Pouco sinal Net no quarto
Review Content: Hotel muito confortável, limpo e com excelente pequeno almoço e muita variedade nas refeições principais. Numa zona central e calma, com um shopping incluído no edifício do hotel. Certamente repetiria.
Date: Date of stay: May 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A very nice hotel with excellent staff.
Review Content: From the moment we arrived we were given every assistance and made to feel welcome. The rooms are quite modern and well serviced, the food is excellent, even room service (A+). The cleaning staff were meticulous. In fact, all staff were friendly and very helpful.The breakfast was sumptuous with lots of fresh fruit, cereals and almost excessive hot dishes.The location is well placed downtown for shopping and restaurants.
Date: Date of stay: June 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: perfektes Stadthotel, zum ankommen und abfahren die perfekte Unterkunft
Review Content: Das Personal war freundlich und professionell, die Betten sehr bequem, Dusche ok, Frühstück war das beste auf unserer Reise, es gibt alles was das Herz begehrt.Bewachtes, kostenloses parken im Parkaus. Die Lage ist top, man erreicht vile "Sehenswürdigkeiten" fussläufig und auch Restaurant. Vor allem Shoppingwillige kommen auf ihre Kosten, Geschäfte für alles mögliche sind in der Nähe.Einzig die Dachterasse machte wenig her, aber da kann man auf das Hilton ausweichen, was 200 m entfernt ist.
Date: Date of stay: May 2016This review is the subjective opinion of an individual contributor and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: pour une étape "parfait "
Review Content: Mieux vaut s'arrêter dans cet hôtel au début d'un voyage en Namibie, on retour c'est plus que déroutant comparativement aux lodges du séjour. C'est un hôtel bien placé en centre ville, permettant un accès à  tout. Situé au dessus du centre commercial il vous remet tout de suite "dans la réalité" foule et bruit; L'hôtel parfait, mais comme tout ces hôtels de chaines en ville il est impersonnel .Les chambres sont spacieuses et confortables, magnifique salle de bain -  donc rien à dire -Buffet pour le diner : large choix Petit déjeuner : de même large choixc'est un peu l'usine tout de même Serveurs le matin : débordésle bar : un peu petit, nous étions 13, mais un accueil plus que chaleureux;
Date: Date of stay: March 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: …naja, so als "Notlösung" OK
Review Content: Aufgrund einer Überbuchung im Hilton mussten wir ins Avanti ausweichen…die Ankunft ist bereits sonderbar, der Eingang läuft über ein etwas "veraltetes" Einkaufszentrum. Die Casino-Atmosphäre ist auch nicht grad förderlich. Herzhaft überlastete Rezeption…aber sonst eigentlich alles OK. Sauber, völlig veraltet - aber ruhig. Restaurant (nur Frühstück) OK. Preis/Leistung stimmt hingegen - für dieses Geld darf man schlicht nicht mehr erwarten.
Date: Date of stay: February 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: The rooftop pool is a haven
Review Content: For anyone who doesn’t want to go far to enjoy shopping and a bit of gambling; this would be the prefect recently refurbished hotel. The hotel forms part of a shopping mall with local market just across the road. And the rooftop pool is a haven for just relaxing.
Date: Date of stay: November 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bon plan pour une étape à Windhoek
Review Content: Hotel moderne situé dans un centre commercial sur l'Avenue de l'Indépendance.Les chambres sont propres et confortables. Les buffets du diner et du petit déjeuner sont copieux et très bons, le personnel est un peu dépassé mais accueillant.
Date: Date of stay: November 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bonne situation
Review Content: Cet hôtel est très bien situé dans le centre de Windhoek sur la rue principale. L'entrée n'est pas directement sur la rue mais dans le hall d'un centre commercial. Chambre  confortable, propre, au calme. Large choix pour le petit déjeuner et le diner (buffet). Il y a une piscine dans l'hôtel mais non chauffée.
Date: Date of stay: August 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Angenehm mitten im Zentrum Windhoek
Review Content: Sehr freundliches Personal sauber und ordentlich. Late Check in sowie Late Check oft und auch Check in morgens um 07:00 ohne Aufpreis möglich. Nebenkosten im Spa Bereich und Restaurant sensationell günstig. Einzig eine Sauna und Dampfbad fehlen.

Name: Start rondreis
Review Content: Hotel centrum Windhoek, boven winkels. In nabijheid van een paar restaurants. Ligt aan hoofdstraat, maar geen hinder van geluid. Ruime kamer, schoon. Personeel attent en vriendelijk. Hier eerste avond van onze rondreis gegeten. Prima buffet ook geschikt voor vegetariërs.
Date: Date of stay: November 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Preis-Leistung in Ordnung, gute Lage
Review Content: Wenn ich in Windhoek übernachte, dann im Kalahari Sands. Das Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis ist in Ordnung und die Lage im Zentrum ist gut. Alle ist zu Fuß leicht zu erreichen.Die Zimmer sind groß und seit der Renovierung wieder schön.Das Personal läßt allerdings zu wünschen übrig. Alle benötigen unbedingt einen Kurs zum Thema lächeln. Das Verhalten des Personals untereinander ist genauso schlecht, wie gegenüber dem Gast.Als Gast fühlt man sich nicht unbedingt willkommen, sondern eher als störendes Etwas im Betrieb.
Date: Date of stay: October 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Buona scelta
Review Content: Ho pernottato in questo hotel collocato all'interno di un centro commerciale la prima e l'ultima notte del viaggio in Namibia. Stanze belle, curate e pulite. Nel bagno set di cortesia. Ricca la colazione. Posteggio gratuito con collegamento diretto con l'hotel. Dispone di wifi a pagamento. Il casinó nella hall non reca disturbo
Date: Date of stay: August 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Sembra di non essere in Namibia
Review Content: Albergo bello, letti comodi, cena ottima.Solo che non sembra di essere in Namibia.Situato all'interno di un centro commerciale con Casino.Posto bello ma da usare soltanto come sosta strategica (noi avevamo il volo la mattina presto).
Date: Date of stay: July 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Unfreundliches Personal und defekter Lift
Review Content: Die erste Begrüßung wär sachlich und unfreundlich. Ein Gepäcktransport aufs Zimmer wurde nicht angeboten. Das unfreundliche Personal fiel auch im Restaurat auf. Einzig positive Ausnahme war in der Bar war Elesea Neumann. Das Zimmer Ansicht läßt keinen Wunsch offen, der Kühlschrank und die Klimaanlage sind nachts recht laut. Ein Lift wurde an einem Tag repariert. Tagsdrauf haben wir eine halbe Stunde bei großer Hitze in dem Fahrstuhl festgesessen. Das Telefon im Lift funktionierte nicht. glücklicherweise war eine Dame in der Lage, die Rezeption zu rufen. Die "Befreiung hat aber sehr lange gedauert. Es folgte keinWort der Entschuldigung. Dr Pool auf dem Dach erinnert an einen Gefängnisinnenhof. Es ist das erste Mal, dass ich eine negative Bewertung schreibe.
Date: Date of stay: March 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Luxus am Ende der Rundreise
Review Content: Sehr geschmackvoll und großzügig ausgestattetes Hotel in zentraler Lage.Leider war der Pool zu kalt!! Das Buffet hat ein sehr großes Angebot sehr schmackhafter Speisen, die vor den Augen der hungrigen Gäste zubereitet werden. Die Preise für die Getränke halten sich im Rahmen.
Date: Date of stay: September 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Potential for better, but decent experience
Review Content: The site itself is lovely, and being in the heart of Windhoek, amenities are close by. However, I just cannot tolerate that this hotel is sharing its space with a mall - I felt a bit clumsy and insecure walking through the mall to the reception with my luggage with onlookers everywhere. check-in took an age and a half, check-out even longer (some arguments and altercations regarding "children's" breakfasts). An inconsistency on the Sun website and the hotel - Sun International accepts "children" aged under 18, yet the hotel charged my family with kids in their mid-teens as adults (full price). The receptionists argued a lot with me, unable to sympathise with my plight, and were quite rude, refusing to accept my "thank you's" despite me having to, against my will, pay the full fee. The rooms were decent and spacious,fairly clean as well. Very disappointed with the breakfast (at the price I paid) - no great variety compared to its 4-star competitors, and was not value for money. Potential is there for improvement, but an average stay overall.
Date: Date of stay: March 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Slow and ignorant service, nice premises
Review Content: Rooms, lobby and restaurant (incl. buffet) ok, but service very hard to get, even by phone and sometimes even at the reception desk. Prepare to be patient especially in the restaurant, and do not bother when cleaning lady is entering your with her own keys in the morning at 8 ("oh, you are in"). One exception: laundry service was excellent!
Date: Date of stay: November 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: albergo comodo ma senza personalità
Review Content: Si tratta di un grande albergo nel centro di Windhoek. Le stanze sono spaziose pulite comode e ben arredate, e la posizione dell'albergo è ottima per fare una passeggiata nel centro città. Nel complesso però l'albergo manca di personalità nel senso che è simile a qualsiasi altro grande albergo per affari che si può trovare in altre città del mondo. Fastidiosa è la presenza nella hall dell'albergo del casinò con un via vai pressocchè continuo di gente che bivacca fra i divani della hall e le slot machines, non si capisce perchè non abbiano previsto di separare gli ingressi! La colazione è stata abbondante e gustosa.
Date: Date of stay: October 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN
Review Content: We stayed in this hotel on a stop in Windhoek in Dec 2010.  The service stunk, the rooms stunk (of smoke), the bed was extremely uncomfortable and the pool was pathetic.  The steps to the pool were falling off the wall!   I seriously have never stayed in such a bad hotel and it was so expensive.  There is only one reason to stay in this hotel - its location and even that is bad. Wait until the other hotel is built - I hope they tear this down.
Date: Date of stay: December 2010This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Höchste Zeit,dass das Hilton nebenan eröffnet!!!
Review Content: Wir waren am Anfang und Ende unserer Reise in dem Hotel. Es war somit kein schöner Start und auch leider kein schönes Ende. Das einzig gute ist die zentrale Lage und das angeschlossene Einkaufszentrum mit Supermarkt, Souvenirgeschäften und Bankautomaten. Der "Service" an der Rezeption ist sehr langsam, unfreundlich und unzuverlässig. Messages erhält man nur per Zufall oder zu spät. Wofür ist eigentlich die Welcome Lounge im unteren Geschoss? Welcome Drinks gab es nur widerwillig und auf Nachfrage. Die Angestellten grüßen nicht. Aufzüge sind eine einzige Zumutung, pro Fahrt ca. 10 Minuten einplanen. Zimmer sind ok, aber schon ziemlich abgewohnt. Fazit: wir können kaum auf die Eröffnung des Hiltons gleich gegenüber warten, vielleicht ändert sich dann endlich was.
Date: Date of stay: March 2010This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: OK Business Hotel - think 1980's Forte Posthouse
Review Content: I was booked into the Kalahari Sands by my company - as a big customer i think we get a very good rate!Looking at the website, having stayed at other Sun International Hotels (Gabrone Sun) and looking at thier in house booklet I thought the hotel would be of a high standard and well maintained.  You will notice that the Sun website has very few pictures of the hotel!Arrival is a bit strange - either though the multi-storey car park or at the front via the shopping centre.  The lobby is quite grand - although dated - and there are G4S Security guards everywhere (who double up as porters).  Check in was friendly and fast and I was staying on the 7th floor.  The building is a 14 storey 1960's concrete monstrosity - but right in the City Centre - easy and seemingly safe walking distance to the main sights and station.I notice a lot of past reviews commenting on the lifts - they are currently replacing these.The hotel claims to have a Sauna and Gym on the roof terrace - but I could not find it (unless it is in the wellness centre).  The roof top pool however was very nice (although quite small) - and possibly the best feature of the hotel!The room was enormous with 2 double beds, DSTV (which kept going off and retuning one night) a work desk and large bathroom.  The room has WiFi Internet Access (payable) and a multi naiton plug (but only by the desk!).  The rooms - like most of the hotel - are very dated - think 1980's Forte Posthouse.  Fixtures and fittings very old fashioned and in some cases in need of replacement.  The beds are quite soft and could probably do with new mattrasses.  Having said all that the rooms are very large with good views (although not much to look at!) and very light and airy with quiet air conditioning.  The rooms are also very quiet (although mine was to the side of the hotel).The buffet breakfast had a good range - a bit strange with cooked to order bacon and sausage etc (the beans, mushrooms etc are in pots buffet style) - so not great for a quick bite if thats what you are after - but they have good juices, a wide range of meats and fish, cheese, salad, cereals and pastries etc and also offer cooked to order omlettes and eggs.  Trying to get a coffee was a little harder as they dont seem to offer it - rather you have to ask for it.  The sun deck is a nice place to enjoy your breakfast although the view is not very good - a large surface carpark and the busy Independence Avenue.The hotel restaurant offers buffet & "cooked at the buffet" meals.  Cooked for you are stir-fry with chicken, beef, pork, seafood, the usual veggies and rice or noodles.  They also cook steak versions of the meats plus fish.  They have a number of stews, veggies, salads etc.  The quality was not great and the restuarant atmosphere and service is poor.  The carpets need replacing with large tears and threadbear in parts!  OK - but I would recommend one of the better restaurants nearby and very close to the hotel.The bar is OK - but lots of smokers.  Prices not too bad - but obviously more expensive than outside the hotel.The casino is a good size with a large number of slots and table games.  Brught and busy and good fun.
Date: Date of stay: December 2008This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Debmarine
Review Content: Am from Debmarine and coming from the ocean to Windhoek is very nice, especially sleeping in this hotel is peaceful and quiet. Party and Dunes one of the nice places to eat with reasonable prices. Soecithanks to Tia at the concierge desk very attentive and helpful with guest
Date: Date of stay: January 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Overall great hotel with some minor flaws
Review Content: The hotel itself was clean, the staff was friendly, the location was good and breakfast has a big variety. The gym was well equipped and good enough for two nights! However, we stayed there twice with 2 weeks inbetween and both times we didn't have any towels in our room. When we asked for towels it took them almost an hour to provide us with some. Second the pool is very small, and it is very noisy as it is in the restaurant so not really useable. And the last thing that bothered us the most was, that when we went to the rooftop restaurant (the one with the pool) it took them an hour and a half to deliver out food. When I ordered food they did not have any of the stuff i wanted, why put it on the menu then? But the biggest faux par was when we ordered pasta. On the menu it said broccoli pasta with parmesan, but what we got was a mushroom pasta with spinach (they didn't even have such pasta on the menu???). When we talked to them the waitress said she's sorry but didn't offer any compensation and also didn't ask if we wanted something else and didn't even know that it said broccoli on the menu? Overall good hotel just avoid the restaurant and don't expect a pool.
Date: Date of stay: March 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Review Content: My visit to Avani Windhoek was really impressive, I walked in to the Stratos Restaurant , and I felt right at home, I was received by the beautiful and very energetic Samoline. Her service was very effective and she made it easier for us to understand the food menu, which was very accommodative, for kids, vegans and just so many options to choose from. The supervisor, Justina kept checking up on us which really made our stay at the restaurant more comfortable. Thank you so much for the Impressive experience… We are coming back 🤩

Name: It might be a nice hotel once renovations are finished
Review Content: At 9 pm at night we had difficulties locating the entrance to the hotel.  When driving by there were a number of big trucks blocking the view from the street as you’re driving by, so very hard to see it on approach. Parking was also difficult to find and there was work going on which meant access was not good or attractive. Also a number of sex workers were hanging around the parking entrance.  The hotel had difficulties finding our booking we had to wait 35 minutes before we got a room. The room (701) was quite large in size and beds were comfortable. In terms of eating at the hotel, we only had breakfast - it was average at best.
Date: Date of stay: October 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Mediocre experience at best
Review Content: The Avani is well located within a shopping centre and a couple of upmarket shops are close by.   It is also within walking distance of the banking business district.  The room was large, clean and spacious, with a very nice bathroom.  The breakfast buffet was good.This hotel has what it takes to be very nice, but a lot of training and effort needs to go into the staff.  They are all mostly very gracious, but here are a couple of things that in my opinion should not happen at a 4 star hotel:•	Upon check in, I provided my GHA Discovery number.  On check out, it had not been recorded•	No list of amenities was anywhere to be found in the room, other than a room service card•	Almost impossible to willingly choose a bottle of wine for room service as no wine list seemed to be available.  Eventually I said “just send me a bottle of South African Sauvignon Blanc”!  This arrived well after I had eaten my food and with no wine glass accompanying it.•	A staff member manning the lift area asked me for money for cigarettes•	I arranged a late check out the day before I left.  Shortly after normal check out time, I received a phone call asking me when I would be leaving.  Upon explaining that I had pre-arranged to leave 2 hours later I was informed there was no record on file.Next time I will book in at the Hilton.
Date: Date of stay: January 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Klasse Cityhotel
Review Content: Die Zimmer sind sauber und eben genau wie ein Hotelzimmer in einer Großstadt ausgestattet sein muss.Die Lage direkt in einem Einkaufzentrum ist ideal, um noch ein paar Souveniers zu kaufen. Kostenloses Parken im Parkhaus auf der Rückseite des Hotels.Highlight ist definitiv die Bar auf dem Dach und auch das Essen ist spitze. Hier kann man den letzten Abend in Namibia genießen, um am nächsten Morgen ganz bequem zum Flughafen zu fahren. Achtung: Morgens ist hier ganz schön was los (rushhour), also etwas Zeit einplanen...
Date: Date of stay: February 2020This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great breakfast but relatively bad service experience
Review Content: We stayed in Avani for 2 nights with friends. Hotel is located inside a shopping mall, which is bit odd and not cozy. However, the breakfast was really amazing and definitely the best of all our 5 hotels in Namibia. But unfortunately the service was not that great: 2/3 of the elevators were broken for whole our stay and it took over 40 mins to queue to the elevators with our luggage when we arrived. Also, none of the elevators worked in our floor, so we always needed to climb at least 1-2 floors with the big luggage, baby equipment etc. to get an elevator. The hotel staff did not offer their help in bringing our staff to the room even though it was located in 9th floor, and we needed to climb there the whole way! In the end way paid for one of employees to do so and claimed the stairs for 2 days. The pool located in the 14th floor, so you can only imagine how many stairs we climbed during the 2 days. I cannot imagine how they do not fix the elevators as soon as possible, when they notice them broken. Or give any discount to the guests when causing that big harm for them. Many in our group had fever during our stay, so it was really rough to climb 9 floors continously. In addition, there were lack of towels continuously in our room. The staff didn't understand at all, that since we had booked an extra bed for extra guest, of course he/she would need towels as well. We needed to call continuously to the reception to fix our room, it was really frustrating.
Date: Date of stay: October 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bom
Review Content: Passei uns dias da minha vida neste hotel e gostei muito, bons pequenos almoços, bem localizado e muito limpo, tive que ficar mais uma noite e essa custou dinheiro a mais! Mas tudo bem, é África. Claro que voltarei, nem que seja para jogar uma maquinada no casino
Date: Date of stay: October 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: It's fine
Review Content: No, really, it's fine.  I had a pleasant enough three week stay there, between mid September and early October.  My conclusion?  Yes, it's fine.  I was a little bit worried given some of the reviews here, but I'm pleased to write I was mostly happy.  So what's to like?- Large clean, renovated room, with comfortable bed- Clean, functional bathroom- Proper satellite TV (with receiver in every room) with a good selection of channels - The typical African hotel buffet restaurant is better than many I've been to  (though not as good as the often excellent Southern Sun Oliver Tambo, at Johannesburg Airport)- The bar is friendly, with a decent enough selection drinks, and the bar grub (fish and chips, steak, burger and so on) is decent enough- Responsive, friendly front desk (though it did take a few calls to get them to come and sort my telly out, one evening)- Reasonably prompt room service- Hotel is in the centre of the city, though you may have to put up with views of the swanky new Hilton- There's an empty fridge in the room and a supermarket downstairs (and nature abhors an empty fridge, so mine was rarely empty)- And the glassware, made of actual glass,  is refreshed daily (compared to the disposable, plastic and polystyrene everything you get in a four star hotel in the US, and increasingly in Europe).So what's not to like?- The room was a twin (thank you, thank you, thank you, beloved corporate travel agent), but I think they could have made room for a more comfortable chair (could never find a comfortable reading position in the room)- Internet is slow (albeit reliable, as opposed to West Africa, where the internet is twice as fast and half as reliable)- House Keeping a bit mean with the soap.Tips:- Try to get a room facing the city (the view from the Hilton is great, but the view of the Hilton is not so great)- Try to avoid a twin room- On week nights, I'd say it is probably safe to walk up and down Independence avenue (walking in the opposite direction of the Hilton, and no more than two blocks) until around 8PM- On a Saturday morning, do visit the gardens of the Tintenpalast, and the craft markets- On a Saturday afternoon, the Hilton's rooftop bar is well worth a visit- For a Sunday, visit the front desk and see if you can arrange a tour (I recommend a game drive, at the Okapuka ranch - Windhoek is pretty dead on a Sunday afternoon)- If faster internet is vital, take an unlocked smartphone and buy a local pre paid SIM (MTC offers various data bundles that are reasonable value for money, and allows tethering).
Date: Date of stay: September 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: 10 years later, big time upgrades and improvement to rooms
Review Content: Service here has always been excellent. I've never had a problem at the "Sands" and this was my fifth stay. Also I've never managed not to win some extra spending holiday cash at the Casino. Maybe just lucky that way but it certainly helps with petrol and expenses when vacationing. The location can't be beat because of "Checkers" supermarket directly underneath it in the foyer. Ideal for getting water, snacks and supplies for the trip ahead. There is a cafe next to the Supermarket that has afforable breakfasts, good quality coffee and service if you want to save some money. The staff have always been friendly. Breakfast is great but expensive compared to the cafe next to Checkers. Dinner menu is buffet style and I found the choices limited. Still, compared to the newly opened (2011) Hilton Hotel that competes with it this place has character, more to do and is in a better location. We did check out the Hilton while we were there but it was a relatively, umm, sterile is the best word, experience. The rooms are being progressively upgraded, so try to ask for one of the renovated rooms. Compared to my last stay in 2001, the new beds, renovated bathrooms and clean carpets are welcome additions. Not cheap but an excellent place to rest up after a long flight before starting your adventure.
Date: Date of stay: August 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Standard Fare
Review Content: Avani is a very typical business hotel. Nothing offensive, nothing exciting. We were surprised though that the rooms weren't ready for two of our travellers even though we arrived after 5pm - that's a late check-in to be so ill prepared for. We did get a personalised written apology and a platter of snacks waiting in the room when we returned after dinner.Was disappointing that the upstairs deck bar was closed - what a huge miss to not enjoy a drink with the wonderful view.The front-desk was always exceptionally busy - definitely understaffed which is a shame as the staff were clearly under tremendous pressure.Breakfast, your standard buffet. All good there.Wouldn't stay again but also wouldn't recommend specifically against it.
Date: Date of stay: October 2021This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Estancia muy agradable y calidad del servicio en general
Review Content: Hotel limpio, buena ubicación, habitaciones espaciosas y muy correctas. El  desayuno completo y las vistas y servicio de copas de la planta 18 no se deben perder.  Omimos en un par de ocasiones en el bar de la planta baja. Calidad y precios muy buenos, quizás podría mejorar un poco la rapidez, pero si estas de vacaciones como en nuestro caso, no importa. Volveríamos sin duda
Date: Date of stay: September 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Superb Service, Modern Rooms
Review Content: We stayed for just one night before we head to Johannesburg. The hotel is a delight to stay in. The room is spacious and nicely decorated. Comfortable beds and an adequate size bathroom. The staff was polite and service was very efficient. There is a huge supermarket close by. Breakfast choices was good. What a pleasant surprise staying here.
Date: Date of stay: April 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Locked in the elevator
Review Content: we stayed in this hotel on July 31st 2018 and the lift worked wrongly and we got stuck in the elevator. We pressed the emergency  button several times and nobody answered and nobody helped us during 10 minutes. As we had the telephone number of the front desk of the hotel, we decided to phone with our cell phone to the front desk to explain the situation "we are locked in the elevator, please help us".After 10 minutes later we continued stuck in the elevator and nobody came to assist us and to be interested in what it was really happening. We were in the elevator for 20 minutes without any assitance and suddenly and finally the door opened and we went downstairs to the front desk really angry and dissapointed to ask for some explanation why nobody has assisted us. We talked with the Front Desk Manager and the only thing tha we received was a brief apologize and she did not show any worries about the situation. In our opinion, this is totally inacepptable.
Date: Date of stay: July 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Centro città
Review Content: Seconda tappa della nostra luna di miele,hotel situato all'interno del centro commerciale, con piscina sul tetto e bar, ristorante e casino nella hall. Camere grandi e pulite, nel nostro caso con due letti Queen size. Cena a buffet soddisfacente,colazione un po' meno. Sono nel bel mezzo di un'importante ristrutturazione, quindi rumori poco graditi durante la colazione.Abbastanza complicato trovare l'ingresso del garage dell'hotel, poiché coperto dalle impalcature è poco segnalato.Altro neo solo due ascensori funzionanti su 3, quindi attese abbastanza lunghe al piano
Date: Date of stay: September 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Night in Windhoek
Review Content: Nice hotel. Service was a bit slow but very happy to say we were well served. Casino is small and not enough tables open. Breakfast was good. Rooms are good size and clean. Overall pleased for the prices. Parking is a bit odd for the entrance to the hotel. Nice pool area at the top of the hotel.

Name: Good hotel in city centre
Review Content: The hotel (now called Avani Hotel) is right in the city centre and, oddly, is entered through a shopping centre. The rooms are modern, well fitted out and a reasonable size. Beds are comfortable but the push-buttons to control room lighting are odd and don't work 100%. The staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet is excellent. The restaurant only offers buffets (a bit pricey for lunch/dinner) and an a la carte menu is available in the bar. The bar is comfortable but can be a bit seedy at times as it's next door to the hotel  casino, also the bar staff are not as customer-oriented as the rest of the hotel staff. There are a few restaurants within walking distance but you have to be a bit careful walking in Windhoek at night..
Date: Date of stay: July 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Review Content: Spent my first night at Kalahari Sands....beautiful place with wonderful service. We forgot our jackets at the hotel and came back to enquire and we were helped with a smile..thanks to the kind staff members....memorable and worth every penny. A must when in Windhoek...

Name: If you value your peace, stay away from this hotel
Review Content: this hotel staff are extremely unproffessional and the management even worse. i had breakfast on the 10th of june at the restuarant where an eldery "guest" or employee of the hotel came and swore at me by my mother and worse because i dared to sit on a 'reserved" table with such a minor reserved sign its impossible to notice. the staff watched as i was verbaly assaulted without intervening. almost choked on my food to finish and get out of there and to-date never recieved even formal acknowledgement or apology from that hotel. i would sincerly recommend any hotel in namibia but this one. no service at all. Worse hotel ever and their four star rating must be the greatest injustice done to travellers as this hotel does not even deserve a star at all.
Date: Date of stay: June 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Un buon posto per iniziare e finire il circuito Namibia
Review Content: Ho soggiornato in questo hotel il primo e l'ultimo giorno del mio viaggio in Namibia.Si trova sulla centralissima Independence Avenue, la zona dello shopping, dei negozi e dei ristoranti. E' un posto funzionale, un palazzone moderno, non nuovissimo, ma ha tutto ciò che serve. Le camere sono abbastanza spaziose e pulite, i letti comodi, il breakfast è buono e abbondante. Adatto a chi vuole potersi muovere autonomamente a piedi, dal momento che i lodges più "affascinanti" sono tutti fuori città. Al piano terra c'è un casino', piuttosto frequentato da ospiti e clientela di passaggio.
Date: Date of stay: October 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Exellent hôtel
Review Content: L'hôtel est idéalement situé dans la capitale de la Namibie : Windhoek . C'est un luxueux 4 étoiles disposant de chambres avec un grand lit et d'une salle de bain avec baignoire et douche . On trouve également un casino ouvert de 10 h 00 à 4 h 00 où l'on peut venir tenter sa chance . L'hôtel se trouve en plein centre ville et près de tous les commerces , quoique , jouxtant l'hôtel , une galerie marchande avec plein de boutiques , et cela sans presque sortir de l'hôtel .
Date: Date of stay: September 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Fun and good sleep
Review Content: After long days in in wilderness, this place offer a good place to rewind.....Thanks to the staff, they are "good"Cheers

Name: Ongoing refurbishment much needed
Review Content: We stayed here one night prior to a trip to Etosha as well as one night after and got two different room experiences. The first night we had a standard room wich was ok but not perfect. The room was spaceous but guite dark and very much in need of refurbishment. The same can be said for the rest of the hotel. Although clean, almost every piece of furniture was totally worn out. Luckily the hotel is refurbishing as we speak so I assume that in a year or so the hotel will be much better. We got a little preview on our second stay as we opted for a de luxe room. This room was bright new, spacious and comfortable with a huge bathroom with both a shower and a bath.Both breakfast and dinner was buffet style and as most other buffets I have been to, nothing much to write home about.The hotel is located inside a shopping mall so I guess the entrance can be hard to find if you do not know where you are going. Location in general is great with all major sites within walking distance (Not that there is that much to see in this small city...)We booked airport transfer through the hotel and while the pick up from the airport was on time and without any problems, the return was a different issue. We were suposed to be picked up at 5am, but at 5.25am we hade to get a taxi in order to catch our plane. The reception guy helped us with this.I wrote an e-mail to the transport company when I got back home and instantly got a nice replay saying that they deeply appologized and would offer us transportation for free on our next visit to Windhoek.We also tried the SPA at he hotel and it was wonderful. Unfortunately the pool was closed for repair of some sort so I can not comment on that.
Date: Date of stay: March 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very good choice
Review Content: Great central location. Attached to a mall with a supermarket, forex and a couple of cafes for drinks and snacks. Staff very friendly especially Ti'a on reception who was really helpful solving details on our reservation and getting our room ready early. Breakfast buffet had a good selection - hot, cold and cook to order items. Rate included dinner at the Pantry - good food, big portions, reasonable prices. Stayed twice at either end of our Namibia tour - the first time we had an upgraded Superior room and the second a standard Avani room. The Superior room was significantly bigger but both were clean and comfortable if a little dated. Free parking if you have a car which was easy to arrange and use. Drinks on the top floor are a must especially in the evening - great surround views. Also a small pool on the terrace which was a little cold. Easy walk to the main sites of interest. Also a gym on site which had some basis equipment. On our second visit we came from Omaruru - for anybody coming that way, stick on the C33 until the B2 as it is tarmac the whole way. Would stay here again.
Date: Date of stay: March 2024This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Never again!!! Lovely hotel TERRIBLE staff & service
Review Content: The hotel amenities are brilliant ... it's a pity the staff are just one BIG miserable bunch of human beings. They are just so miserable, like they are doing you a favour for just about anything. "I'd like to check out"... got a glare & my key card yanked from my hand. "Please can I order something to drink", 3 people, 1 after the other glare at you like you've done something wrong, & then tell you, they'll send someone. We met 2 people that smiled & listened to an order. Never again!!!!Was part of a larger group of about 25 people,  it was the topic of conversation every morning & every evening, for the 2 days we were there.
Date: Date of stay: December 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Comfortable hotel in Windhoek CBD
Review Content: This hotel has just completed extensive renovations. Situated above a small shopping mall in the centre of the Windhoek shopping precinct.  Rooms are large, clean and comfortable. Service and food in restaurants is good. Also has a casino on the premises.

Name: Avani
Review Content: The ambiance and overall client service was great. Stayed there on the 3rd of March and the room needed some attention, but when I stayed there again on the 17th, in a different room it was flawless. The food is great and the service is excellent. They were accommodating in the sense to prepare breakfast packs as I had to checkout at 06h00 for an early flight. Great place and should keep up the good work. Just to get maintenance going on some of the rooms. I must say after the revamp the reception area is spectacular. Also just look at your loading zone. Its unsafe to load or offload in the main street. Other than that its a great place.
Date: Date of stay: March 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Avani Windhoek
Review Content: Avani Windhoek has finally been refurbished, the lifts are working, even the casino seems to have been upgraded a bit. Rooms are neat, sleep quality is good. I enjoyed the stay, and would stay there again. The only issue I experienced: Staff working at the reception and the pantry were largely unaware of the free N$ 200 pantry vouchers offered to guests who had booked online.
Date: Date of stay: February 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Conference venue
Review Content: Hotel well situated for business but meant that a number of delegates found it too easy to have to go back to office.  The actual room was stuffy and not cool enough.  The old-fashioned microphone-speaker system suffered from a bad 'overlay' of extraneous sounds, ranging from 'feedback whine' to 'distorted voice':  many speakers preferred to not use it!The hotel was undergoing 'renovations' that meant that not all facilities were available.The food was excellent and in a pleasant setting.The heat in Windhoek required the air-conditioner to be on all night.
Date: Date of stay: November 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Rotary Induction Dinner
Review Content: Last Saturday we had our yearly Rotary Induction dinner for the first time in the Conference facility of the Avani hotel. We were all impressed. The newly renovated venue looks stunning. It looks like first world venue.  The food was also very delicious, the price reasonable.  Thank you very much to the waiters too. They rounded up the evening.
Date: Date of stay: July 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great place to stay ... if all the elevators are working...
Review Content: A friend and I stayed here in April, for two nights, between safari trips. Staff very friendly, location great (right downtown) and breakfast buffet very good. I stayed in the same hotel four years or so ago, and the upgraded entrance is much, much better than having to get  there through a shopping mall. Rooms are very clean and well-appointed; bathrooms spacious and clean with shower and bath-tub.The main downside on this visit was that only one elevator of four was working. That meant loooooonnnnnggggg waits, to go up or down (ended up using the stairs to get down most of the time). When a big tour group was trying to leave the last morning we were there, it was a debacle trying to fight piles of luggage and frustrated guests.I would stay there again, but I would make sure the elevators were all working before I made a reservation. I would have rated this four circles, but the elevators resulted in a lower rating.
Date: Date of stay: April 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Disgrace to the country
Review Content: We stayed here after our flight was cancelled, the elevators were not working. The rooms are excellent but the restaurant is a disgrace to the country. Why try to mimic the show cooking you find everywhere if the country has so much to offer. The food was ok, but nothing more and the organization was terrible. An experience we could have missed in an otherwise wonderful country.
Date: Date of stay: April 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bien situé pour une halte dans la capitale
Review Content: Nous avons séjourné le 1er jour et le dernier jour de notre séjour dans cet établissement. Chambre et salle de bains spacieuses.Le personnel de l'hôtel est agréable, cependant pour le restaurant je dirai que le personnel n'est pas très accueillant et ne s'occupe pas vraiment des clients...Repas sous forme de buffet comme petit déjeuner avec très large choix. Cet hotel est bien situé et pour une halte dans la capitale convient parfaitement.
Date: Date of stay: September 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Ett hotell i centrum
Review Content: Hotellet ligger i ett köpcentrum i de centrala delarna av Windhoek.Du checkar in på 2 våningen och du måste gå in i köpcentrumet för att ta dig dit.Hotellet är helt okej och ett av de bättre jag bott på i Namibia.När vi bodde där den första gången under resa så fungerade två av tre hissar. När vi kom dit andra gånger under resan så fungerade bara en. Det byggs en hel del runt hotellet. Men det var inget som störde mig eller de andra som jag resta med.Det finns bra mat på hotellet och du kan få mat från restaurangen eller från baren.Internet fungerar bra och det är lätt att koppla upp sig. Under kvällstid så är det inte säkert att gå runt själv ute. Vi var fyra och höll på att bli rånad under tidig kväll strax utanför hotellet. Men tack vare att en civilperson svängde in och skrämde de som försökte råna oss gick det bra. men det är inte hotellets fel. Där känns allt säkert.Det finns pool på taket där det finns solstolar och några bord. Vattnet är kallt. Jag har bott här förut och kommer säkert bo här igen.
Date: Date of stay: November 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bridal lunch at the restaurant
Review Content: We had a bridal lunch for a friend and went in for the buffet in the afternoon. The food was really tasty but unfortunately there was a delegation and the restaurant was serving buffet whereby they cook the meat for you while you wait and that meant food service was super slow, However it was tasty. The starters station was not impressive as they weren't even enough croutons, even upon requesting for them. Service not so impressive but kudos to the chef....
Date: Date of stay: August 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Under construction
