Name: New rooftop pool and sun deck
Review Content: For any families or person that might book this hotel for its pool and sun deck, forget it.  Don’t bother. Whilst it has uninterrupted views across the city the actual pool is nothing more than a plunge pool. If you wish to lay in the sun you’ll be nothing more than a metre away from someone eating or drinking. This is the worst design for a pool deck I have ever seen. There is no privacy whatsoever and I doubt any bikini clad lady would want to sunbathe next to an inebriated businessman gawping at her.
Date: Date of stay: March 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Waiting for the lifts
Review Content: Nobody had adviced me when booking the hotel they were going under renovations. The system that manages the lifts do it separately so while you stand there thinking the lift is coming, it’s not until another person comes and knowing the system, shows you what to do, you stand there forever. Even knowing it can keep you waiting up to 10 minutes at breakfast times. Even so, the service is excellent and with the exception of being told about the lift, I felt welcome, and have to acknowledge the attention to detail. And the great view. So far the best hotel I stayed in in Windhoek!
Date: Date of stay: July 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Need an upgrade
Review Content: Stayed three nights earlier this month. Good service. However, be aware that they only accept laundry for same day delivery. This means that you will have to get up before 8 am on Saturday to deliver laundry as they deny to collect it the evening before. Nice breakfast buffet. Only buffet dinner available, no a la carte. Generally the hotel is in a need for an upgrade especially if you compare to Hilton where we poped in for a dinner. One of the elevators are in urgent need for service as the noise might keep you awake during the night if you don't use earplugs. Rooms ok, nice and soft beds.

Name: Gorgeous
Review Content: The hotel located center of town. The hotel has nice restaurant and casino. You are able to have a nice buffet at breakfast and dinner. You can choose a lot of kind of food. The room looks like Hilton style and enough space for relaxing. The view from the room is also beautiful. The hotel has shopping mall, too. You can get anything without go outside.
Date: Date of stay: August 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Why stay at the Hilton when you can stay here?
Review Content: It is about four years since I stayed in Kalahari Sands and in that time it has been completely renovated. The rooms are very clean, the beds very comfortable, the linen pristine.  The staff and service is very friendly.The breakfast at Kalahari is world class and the range of food is excellent. You even get a morning paper. I am having withdrawal symptoms now I am home because I will not see a breakfast like that for a while!Kalahari is central in Windhoek with excellent shopping facilities. There is hotel parking and there is free access to a gym a very short walk from the hotel. There is also a pool area on the roof where you can lie in the sun but don’t forget that at 1600m above sea level you will burn quite quickly.WiFi is available at small charge (it works well) and the bedrooms have a range of power sockets that will cater for all charger connectors. There is also a good business centre where you can print documents.Kalahari Sands is excellent value for money and an excellent base from which to explore Namibia.If you want an airport transfer or tour of the city, contact Michael on  00264812368666. He is a very good driver.
Date: Date of stay: April 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Unremarkable
Review Content: A common dilemma I presume is choosing between the Hilton and this hotel. I enjoy a bit of fun at the slot machines and there fore it became the automatic choice. Booked two rooms for one night at just over R1800 each which brings it very close to the more upmarket Hilton. The rooms had a dreadful view up the back end of another building. Quite small room. Nice big TV. Beds of average comfort. Clean all round. Worn towels. Check in was a long laborious process. No greetings or smiles. No one to assist with luggage. Bar staff friendly and helpful and good atmosphere and a few laughs at the immaculately dressed hookers milling around. Internet is not free. Had a breakfast pack prepared because of early departure - don't bother - you will likely choke on the stale and dry sandwiches. It will have to be the Hilton next time - it's in walking distance to the casino anyway.
Date: Date of stay: October 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Très bon hotel, bien situé.
Review Content: Bon hotel très bien situé en centre ville, exactement ce qu'il nous fallait pour le dernier jour de notre voyage en Namibie avant de reprendre l'avion du retour. L'hotel souffre de tous les défauts des grands hotels internationaux de toutes les grandes villes mais nous y avons trouvé tout le confort et les services que nous espérions. Le plus de cet hotel est sa position centrale qui permet de faire une petite visite et quelques achats dans le temps limité disponible. C'est particulièrement important dans une ville comme Windhoek qui semble pensée pour le tout voiture.
Date: Date of stay: December 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: OK and not more
Review Content: we stayed  in the hotel for 3 nights on a business trip. The hotel is nice, rooms are specious and convenient though a/c is a bit noisy. Location is very good.The problem was that there was no hot water in the hotel for day and a half out of the 3 days we stayed there. We were told about the problem only after we checked in and were on our way to our rooms (a very long process as always in Africa). A cold shower after 28 hours on the way is not something that you wish for. By the way, they didn't offer any discount or compensation for this inconvenience.
Date: Date of stay: December 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: ... mitten in der Stadt
Review Content: Mitten in geschäftigen Windhoek gelegen, ein etwas ältlicher, hoher Betonbau an einer Durchgangsstraße gelegen mit angrenzenden Parkgelegenheiten und Casino im Haus. Die Zimmer sind in durchschnittlicher Größe jedoch mit allen Annehmlichkeiten ausgestattet. Das Publikum ist international. Das internationale Essen wird stets in Buffetform gereicht und wird dort oft frisch zubereitet. Vom Hotel aus sind alle städtischen Sehenswürdigkeiten und Einkaufsmöglichkeiten leicht zu Fuß erreichbar. Das Hotel ist etwas 30 Min. vom Flughafen entfernt.

Name: Dunes Christmas Lunch
Review Content: The Christmas 23 Lunch that was hosted by the Dunes Restaurant was truly delicious.  This was the first time we as a family decided to deviate from the traditional home cooked Christmas lunch and opted to eat out for Christmas Lunch.  We were not disappointed with our decision.  The buffet was exceptional! The food was fresh and it was tasty.  The variety of dishes were so many it was difficult to decide what to eat and what not.  The best part of the experience for our family was the seafood, there was also crayfish, yummy, that was freshly prepared.  Also a first for our family, to eat mostly seafood for Christmas Lunch. Lol! The dessert section also did not disappoint, with a selection of cakes, fresh fruit and ice cream.The service was great, all the staff was very attentive and quick.The entire experience was amazing, and it was great value for money.We look forward to the next Christmas Buffet Lunch, as we will definitely be makin this a new family tradition.
Date: Date of stay: December 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Enjoyed
Review Content: The customer service was totally professional and I enjoyed my stay. I'm willing to come back and receive the same treatment. All the best to all staff members that were in charge during my stay. Thump up👍

Name: Schönes, zentral gelegenes Hotel mit toller Dachterrasse
Review Content: Das Avani Hotel ist sehr zentral gelegen, man kann fußläufig viel erreichen. Die Zimmer sind groß und wirklich schön. Das Personal ist freundlich. Einzig der Aufzug ist extrem gewöhnungsbedürftig. Hier muss man beim „Rufen des Aufzugs“ bereits die Etage angeben, zu der man will. Dann wird angezeigt, in welchen Aufzug man einsteigen muss, damit man in die richtige Etage kommt. Im Aufzug selbst gibt es keine Knöpfe.
Date: Date of stay: November 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Conveniently situated
Review Content: I stayed at the Avani for a couple of days and it is conveniently situated in terms of proximity of everything, however I would like to note as much as the foyer has been revamped to look modern and portray that look its a totally different story in the rooms. The carpets are old and dirty and have a bad smell esp the 9th floor where I stayed. They could do with a revamp and maybe consider laminate flooring considering the traffic of guests they have. I experienced a noice issue on Saturday the 19th with loud music coming from their 15th floor sky bar, until after 1am and was told its a private party there is nothing that can be done about it, which I found to be unfair.
Date: Date of stay: October 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Avani Hotel Windhoek
Review Content: Central in Windhoek close to shopping mall, nice ambience with live food counters you can have your favorite dish anytime.The rooms and bathrooms quite spacious, staff very responsive to guest requests

You go to refill your plate and they clean out your table

Name: Avani Hotel - Windhoek
Review Content: very good place to stay and eat in Whk but i had a small challenge with my air con and  lights and they took long to come and sort out the problem. besides that it is a cool place at the centre of the city

Name: 清潔感のあるホテル
Review Content: ナミビアの砂漠に行く前に一泊しました。施設自体新しいためかとても清潔感があり、快適に過ごせました。隣にはショッピングモールがあり、朝早い時間にもかかわらず開いていたので、砂漠に行く前に買い出しできてとても便利でした。
Date: Date of stay: January 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: V. K. Chadha
Review Content: Renovation is coming to close and old Kalahari Sands is taking its position back, as the best hotel in Windhoek, with new team and banner as Avani Hotel. I have been staying with Kalahari from 1998 and then in between moved to Hilton and now for past one year, back with Avani !!
Date: Date of stay: November 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Unrestful and unpleasant
Review Content: I stayed here for eight days on business.I will just give a statement of some factually true things which were in place whilst I was there without any comments....maybe some people would enjoy this sort of place...Building works are ongoing. There is one lift for the guests but they are allowed to go in the dirty staff lift which, after waiting for a lift for almost ten minutes, is what you have to do.The swimming pool is closed. There is nowhere at all to sit outside. When I asked, they offered to put a chair in the car park for me.On Saturdays and Fridays there is desperately poor quality, loud music in the Pantry - the only place to get something to eat unless you want a huge buffet blow out. I had to resort to room service on those two nights. I had to go to reception to order my room service as the phone was broken.The service, especially from the the meet and greet ladies at breakfast, is slow and not polite, in most cases. There are a couple of waiters/ waitresses who do their jobs fantastically, but they are the exception rather than the rule.The rooms are generally clean.Building noise started before 8am and finished after 8pm on some days.When I asked for help booking a tour on my day off, I was given a leaflet and told to book it online. Some of the reception staff are very helpful.
Date: Date of stay: October 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel moderno y centrico
Review Content: Moderno y bien equipado hotel en el centro de Windhoek, con habitaciones amplias y bien equipadas, modernas y con un buen bufet desayuno, si bien con escasos y complicados ascensores. Ideal para pasar una noche de paso en esta ciudad o bien para negocios.
Date: Date of stay: August 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Schönes Hotel, an dem die Aufzuge nicht funktionieren und man keine Unterstützung erhält
Review Content: Schönes Hotel in zentraler Lage.Leider wird jedoch umgebaut, so das die Bauarbeiter durchs Fenster schauen, der Baulärm sehr laut ist, die Aufzüge nicht funktionieren und hunderte Gäste ihre Koffer in das 10. OG schleifen. Hilfe vom Hotel sucht man vergebens.Auch Kompensationsleistungen für all die Abstriche sind nicht freiwillig zu erwarten.Nachdem man sich massiv beschwert hatte, wurden einem Freigetränke an der Bar ausgegeben.Alles in allem nicht hinnehmbar, das Hotel in diesem Zustand weiterhn geöffnet zu lassen und dies auch noch zu diesen Preisen...Zimmer sind dafür geräumig und sauber.
Date: Date of stay: December 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Back for a second time.
Review Content: Came here previously before the renovations. Friendly front desk staff. Room service prompt and good quality. As they are still renovating the hotel is not fully operational but that does not stop one from having a good nights sleep. Beds are good. Bathrooms are clean and serviced daily. Although we were there for a few hours only we had a good rest and thus could attend to business refreshed. Wi-Fi was good. Left before breakfast unfortunately but next time. Only down side no assurance with bags. But we were traveling light and it was late. So they get away with one. Recommended stay for business in Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: June 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Avani，出行方便，门口左转还有购物商店，很不错！
Review Content: 这次有大惊喜，酒店给升级，房间很大也很温馨，特别喜欢酒店的装饰。早晨醒来，窗外还有小客人的到来。早餐也很丰盛，非常不错的一次住宿，下次来温得和克还住这里！
Date: Date of stay: February 2018This review is the subjective opinion of an individual traveler and not of Tripadvisor LLC nor of its partners. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Zentrales Stadthotel dem einiges fehlt....
Review Content: Zimmer sind groß und gepflegt, wie man sie in einem Hotel dieser Preisklasse erwarten kann. Ebenso das Frühstück. Das Personal ist sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit !!!Der Pool und Aufenthaltsbereich auf dem Dach sind sehr ungepflegt- die Aussicht nur durch Fenster in Kniehöhe zu "genießen". Der Speisesaal ist mit Gipsplatten abgetrennt, welche mit Postern und Heftzwecken verziert sind. Das Hotel liegt über einer Einkaufspassage- die hinabführende Rolltreppe war mindestens 5 Wochen defekt.Von den 3 hoteleigenen Aufzügen war abwechselnd immer nur einer in Betrieb, und der gab wenig vertrauenserweckende Geräusche von sich. Am Abflugtag haben wir vorsichtshalber das Treppenhaus genommen, das dem eines alten Parkhauses ähnelt- ist wahrscheinlich nur als Notausstieg gedacht.....
Date: Date of stay: December 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Ottima posizione centrale
Review Content: Abbiamo soggiornato due notti in questo bell'albergo, moderno e in posizione centrale all'inizio del nostro tour in Namibia.L'albergo è situato all'interno di un centro commerciale, che purtroppo, durate il weekend, è sempre chiuso. Camera spaziosa all'undicesimo piano. Bagno grande e pulito. Ottimo Wi-fi in camera. Personale gentile e accogliente alla reception. Unico punto negativo la lentezza degli ascensori e il loro cattivo funzionamento che obbligano a lunghe attese al piano. Ottimo il buffet della prima colazione ricco di frutta esotica.Rapporto qualità-prezzo adeguato. Raccomandabile.
Date: Date of stay: October 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Review
Review Content: It was a wonderful stay.  However the hotel was fully booked with only one elevator working. Was frustrating at some point as we had to wait for long periods for the elevator to arrive. But otherwise the staff were friendly and helpful.
Date: Date of stay: October 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Confort
Review Content: I Really really loved the place, is very nice place to stay. I dont have the opportunity to enjoy more the swimming pool because the water was too cold. maybe you guys should start thinking to something to keep the water warm..

Name: Bell'albergo in pieno centro
Review Content: L'albergo sorge al di sopra di un centro commerciale e appare subito elegante e ordinato. Il buffet è buono con un servizio talvolta non adeguato allo standard dell'albergo  (eravamo in gruppo e forse questo aspetto ha influito).Belle le camere co letti ampi.

Name: Easy access into town
Review Content: Located, in the heart of the city, it doesn't get anymore central than this. Food is decent, albeit a tad bit expensive, unsustainable over a long stay. Rooms quite nice,but staff's service levels could be greatly improved. This hotel has a great name, and international reputation, to say the services offered match such an image would be slightly stretching the bounds of truth. No shuttle
Date: Date of stay: February 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good location and good value.
Review Content: I stayed for two nights on a business trip.  The hotel is located in the middle of Windhoek CBD, opposite the FNB and RMB bank building, with all shopping amenities within walking distance.  Parking is provided as part of the shopping center's parking with access from the back of the hotel (western side,  Werner List Street).  The hotel access is not on street level but on the second floor of the shopping center.  Do not be too worried about the slightly warn nature of the shopping center as it is not indicative of the hotel itself.  There is a Foreign Exchange literally 5 yards from the hotel entrance!  The staff was friendly with no hick-ups when booking in.  I stayed on the 9th floor in a standard room which is very spacious and well appointed.  Bedding on the king size bed was of a high quality.  A kettle with tea and coffee was provided.  The bathroom is clean and has a shower as well as a bath tub. There is also a mini fridge in the room.  The room surprisingly quiet given the location of the hotel.  The views from the upper floors of the hotel is great.  The television in the room is bigger that what you would usually get in hotels, with a choice of sport, news and movie channels, mainly sourced from DSTV form South Africa. WIFI is strong enough to make Whatsapp calls.Breakfast was fairly standard, but did provide a fair choice of  traditional and continental options.  I suggest (weather permitting) that you take breakfast outside on the terrace looking out over Independence avenue to feel the Windhoek vibe.  Despite the construction currently underway across the road, it is still the best way to have breakfast.Check out was fast and very efficient.  Just remember to have your parking ticket validated at reception before you leave.
Date: Date of stay: June 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Angenehm in Windhoeks Mitte
Review Content: Sehr angenehmes Zimmer, frühes Frühstück sehr reichhaltig und abwechslungsreich. Allerdings fehlte mal der Toaster, dann ein Messer bei der Käseplatte... Internetanbindung katastrophal schlecht (selbst wenn "Verbindung hervorragend" angezeigt wurde, ungenügende Versorgung). Zimmersafe fehlte in meinem Zimmer. Turndown Service unregelmäßig. Dass es innerhalb einer nicht gelang, die Rolltreppe abwärts von der Lobbyebene zur Eingangsebene zu reparieren, gibt kein gutes Bild. Positiv: Die Freundlichkeit aller Mitarbeiter und Mitarbeiterinnen.
Date: Date of stay: May 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Isabel fernandes
Review Content: Good hotel! Good service and a central location! Nice staff! Very pleasant to stay for a nice relaxing weekend with children!! I would just improve the entrance from the garage ! It's important for safety reasons
Date: Date of stay: April 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Professor
Review Content: The reception staff were very helpful and professional. The room was clean and I was pleasantly surprised at checkout to find breakfast package. I will definitely return. Breakfast buffet was excellent
Date: Date of stay: March 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Perfect location, best breakfast, friendly staff
Review Content: I have stayed many times in Avani, Windhoek for business and pleasure- central in the main street within walking distance of shops and city attractions. I regard their breakfast buffet as the best in town (I have stayed in many hotels in Windhoek). Rooms are spacious with a view over Windhoek - from any room. Beds big and comfortable. I like their  decor - desert theme artworks. Staff go the extra mile! Quality shops in the same building as the hotel - shoes, clothing, etc. Parking good and accessible. Great conference rooms. Swimming pool on roof with a nice view over Windhoek. Getting even better very time because management implements renovations. I hear a great new entrance is forthcoming. Close to Head-offices af many local businesses.
Date: Date of stay: January 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bon hotel
Review Content: belle chambre propre et spacieuse, Hotel au centre de la ville et souvent point d'arrivée en namibie. petit dejeuner copieux et variée.Centre commercial dans l'immeuble, bien pratique pour faire ses courses avant un road trip
Date: Date of stay: December 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bon hotel, sans âme.
Review Content: Dans un centre commercial moderne (tout fermé dès 17h30), à proximité de l'église Chirtukirshe, à deux pas d'un petit marché à souvenirs et d'un beau jardin, voilà pour la situation.L'accueil en anglais fut bon Tout ici est propre et en bon état, communs et chambres confondus. On est dans un bon hôtel 3* de standard international. Déco moderne sans âme, pas de cachet particulier, mais confortable..Notre chambre  (n°809) faisait environ 25m², propre, en très bon état, lit de 1m80, TV de 1m, coffre fort, sèche cheveux, thé café, eau minérale.La clim était bruyante, nous l'avons stoppée car inutile en septembre. la ventilation de la sdb, couplée à la lumière, bruyante également. Des bruits de portes dans le couloir.Repas buffet bien. Choix de plats  correct. Coin avec une employée vous qui fait cuire ce que vous voulez, genre Wok.Petit déjeuner avec grand choix, très bien.  Pour résumer, bien pour une ou deux nuits, pour le confort et la situation.
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Thank you Ryno van Wyk
Review Content: I have been staying at this hotel for a few years now, even before the name change, and it has always been ok. This time, however, I was very impressed with the manager, Ryno van Wyk. He cam to introduce himself personally, something that has never happened before. Aske all the right questions and wanted feed back on the hotel in general. This gentalman is an asset to the hotel and yes I will be back.
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Ottimo Ristorante internazionale
Review Content: La prima tappa in Namibia e il primo ristorante ci ha fatto capire che mangiare in questo Paese sarà' un piacere. Ottimo ristorante, buffet vario e tutto ottimo , sopratutto i gamberoni e l'orice strogonof , il tutto accompagnato da musica dal vivo anche essa ottima
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Der Service hat nachgelassen
Review Content: Der Service beim Personal im Restaurant hat nachgelassen. Einzig die Angestellten am Empfang sind noch relativ freundlich und hilfsbereit. Wenn man im Restaurant am Tisch sitzt, laufen mehrere Angestellte am Tisch vorbei aber keiner fragt ob man schon bedient sei. Ich musste praktisch jedes mal die Angestellten darum bitten mir etwas zu trinken zu bringen. Das Abendbuffet ist praktisch jeden Abend das selbe. Es gibt keine Abwechslung. Die Zimmer sind immer noch gross und hell. Doch sollte das ganze Gebäude mehr in Stand gehalten werden. Die Wand im Bad hatte Risse und die Badewanne war zerkratzt. Die Rolltreppe vom Hotel in die Etage im unteren Stock war schon das letzte Jahr defekt. Jetzt war sie wieder defekt und zwar im August und im September. Es ist sehr unangenehm mit 2 schweren Koffern eine defekte Rolltreppe hinunter zu laufen.
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: un très bon hôtel moderne et spacieux
Review Content: très bon hôtel pour faire une halte a windhoek le seul bémol cet hôtel est situé dans une galerie commerciale les chambres sont spacieuses et confortables l'accueil est parfait le restaurant est  acceptable voir très bon en revanche la piscine au dernier etage n'est pas terrible  le seul bémol il existe un hôtel hilton plus moderne plus confortable et spacieux a 100 metres avec une vraie piscine et un bar au dernier etage magnifique qui offre une vue sur toute la ville
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel estupendo
Review Content: Hotel estupendo, totalmente recomendable, habitaciones muy amplias, limpias y muy bien ubicado, está metido como dentro de un centro comercial, y al entrar jamás te esperas lo fantástico que está el hotel. El personal de lo más atento, repetiría sin duda ninguna.
Date: Date of stay: July 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Event/seminar room booking is unorganised
Review Content: I booked one the hotel rooms to hold training on the 18th June with my employees. I handed over all the necessary signed documents on the 10th June to the lady who deals with these types of booking. The lady confirmed that everything was fine and showed me the room where our training will take place. We arrived on the training day at 8am as planned, but we were told nothing was booked for us, the training room showed to us was locked and no one seems to know anything about it.  We were told that the lady who deals with event booking does not work on Saturday and when the duty manager called her she said she did not book the room because she did not receive the signed document from us, which is a big lie. We were all surprised because my two colleagues and I deliver all the signed documents in person a week earlier to this lady.  The signed documents gave the hotel authority to take a payment from us which they have done, although they have not booked the room. We ended up starting our training after 9am instead of 8am as planned. They are unreliable, unorganised and liars. So think twice before you book their event rooms
Date: Date of stay: June 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: "The Oasis" before and after all activities in and around Namibia's !!!!
Review Content: "The Oasis" before and after all activities in and around Namibia !!!After 17 Years I decided , to stay here again and took the Presidential Suite ,......the decor, spaciousness, outlay with amenities and cleanliness of the room is simply in a class of its own. The food was delicious,.....a Buffet never to be missed!!! The Breakfast staff was great,Naftali in Room Service and Ndenaove to be valued!! Free Wifi superb!! Keep it Up !!
Date: Date of stay: May 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: For the shopper
Review Content: Centrally located in the heart of the business district with a casino, banks, shops, restaurants and Wernhill Park within walking distance. You'll love the atmosphere. I normally stay there for +/-2 days if i go for business trips and i haven't encountered any issues with any of my stays. Room service is great at anytime of the day 24/7 👌🏽
Date: Date of stay: March 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Duas noites e correu tudo bem.
Review Content: Bem localizado. De fácil acesso.  Restaurante ingresso bom. Atendimento bom,  equipe dedicada. Quartos espaçosos. Internet boa,  limpo,  banheiro limpo. Cassino no local,  mas não sei avaliar pois não o usei
Date: Date of stay: May 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Business hotel in mixed use environment
Review Content: Set within a mixed use block which includes a retail shopping center in the city of Windhoek, the hotel is uniquely sited to cater for different interests.Busy and popular with easy and tourist - friendly check in front desk officers.Tasty and rich buffet menu, environmentally friendly sensor controlled lighting system in the rooms and lobby. It is a fitting and comfortable business hotel. Getting a city view  room can shield away from the noise of the casino and Shopping Centre.
Date: Date of stay: October 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: My suggestion is to choose Hilton instead
Review Content: I can not recommend this hotel. Although sunday and the hotel was almost empty they gave us the worst rooms. The rooms were on the lowest floor and in front of the windows we had a wall full of air con compressors making a lot of noise 24/24. In front of the door there was the service entrance of the staff. The T.V was not working, the telephone was not working the air con was not working ( we changed the batteries and resolved ourselves). Wi Fi connection for free but was very badIn the other room the T.V was not working either. The rooms are a bit run down.We went to Hilton just across the road for dinner and if returning to Windhoek we will for sure choose the Hilton.
Date: Date of stay: November 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: It will do
Review Content: This hotel has a very nice finish, the bedrooms are nice and the bathrooms are wonderful. Larger than normal TV and nice finishes all round, however where it fails for me is the restaurant and service, mainly the food got me down a lot. After visiting the Lesotho version of these hotels I have to say I expected more, rightfully it did deliver in the room department, neater and more up to class. However it failed with food, the food doesn't have taste, doesn't feel like you eating at a place that looks so nice, real shame as Lesotho wasn't as nice however the food was above standard. Desert was the worst, I ate three different kinds and none tasted any different. The options is more limited than one would like and the service is ok, people are friendly to a degree however not nearly like they want to be friendly. Front desk was good however, sadly that wasn't the only true highlight during the stay. Lucky the hotel is within a mall, so other food options are close. Another let down was the pool area, it's located on the roof however any option of a way is let down by the fact it's walled up and you can only see out the Windows at knee height, otherwise it's just walls. All in all, I would say it's a good place for quick stop over or business trips, however not something special.
Date: Date of stay: September 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Never again!
Review Content: We booked for 2 nights but only stayed 1 due to the noise from a nightclub which prevented us sleeping until around 4am. The staff in the bar area were less than happy in their jobs which showed in the lack of customer service, also the bar appeared to be  frequented by some ladies of the night! The reception staff were lovely and in fairness did offer to move us to a different room which we declined and re booked for the Hilton for our remaining night in Namibia.
Date: Date of stay: May 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great food -comfortable room
Review Content: enjoyed the sea food night - clean rooms great location, but they need to show how you how to book there free shuttle bus from the airport to there town location online via there website I couldn't find out how...

Name: Plein centre
Review Content: Hotel sur l'avenue de l'indépendance,en plein centre,vers l'église . Entrée par le parking( gratuit si ticket tamponné par l'hôtel)  et le petit centre commercial. Belles chambres spacieuses offrant tout le confort.Buffet petit-déjeuner très varié. Dîner sous forme de buffet uniquement. Wifi payante !!
Date: Date of stay: October 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Average...
Review Content: Like my title says, the hotel was average. Pleasant bed, acceptable standard of cleanliness with the exception of the bath which was not particularly inviting. Staff were quite nice and did their best to answer questions & address concerns. My standout for this hotel was the room service, my burger was utterly delicious, great and grilled to perfection with crispy fries. My compliments to the chef! The absence of the salad I initially requested though due to 'the avocado not being ready' took me aback somewhat though given the considerable size of the hotel. Multi- plug wall fittings were present (a personal favourite touch I always appreciate as a business traveller). However there was no complimentary internet access. Indeed one cannot even enter their room details and name on the hotel site from their room but must instead head to the business centre to purchase a hard copy voucher (which incidentally barely lasted an hour). I see a need to step into the future at least on that score if they are not prepared to provide complimentary wifi (at $250 per night, I really can't see why not). Great TV channels though with up to date movies. The provision of breakfast boxes for very early departures was appreciated. I should also point out that the hotel is located within a mall so you shopaholics will love that! It's a good location from which to do a spot of sightseeing. I didn't have time to pop by the casino so I'm afraid those with the gambling bug won't get anything from me on that score. Overall, a nice enough hotel if you're passing through. Give it a go.
Date: Date of stay: August 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Lovely!
Review Content: Great location right in downtown Windhoek. Close to everything, shopping wise. Excellent buffets at their restaurant and rooms are nice, clean and spacious! Great staff too. I would definitely stay here again when in Namibia.
Date: Date of stay: June 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Belles chambres mais service nul
Review Content: Un hotel bien situe dans le centre ville de Windhoek , l'exterieur est une tour sans aucun charme ..tres laide même comme beaucoup de bâtiments de Windhoek qui ne brille pas par les talents de ses architectes a priori..Les chambres sont vastes et confortables avec une bouilloire , du the et du cafeMais...au restaurant , le service est totalement chaotique , la serveuse passe 3 fois redemander ce que vous avez pris comme boisson puis n'arrive pas a apporter une note correcte qu'il faut attendre 30 minutes , les serveurs sont tres desagreables , absolument pas souriants ni prevenantsLa cuisine est correcte Le " pompon " c'est que lorsque vous demandez un expresso , la serveuse attend pour le preparer avec la machine à expresso bien en evidence ( vous profitez pleinement des etapes de la preparation...20 minutes pour obtenir l'expresso demande ...normal..il faut attendre que le client precedent ait termine son cafe !!! ) de recuperer une tasse sale sur une table puis elle la passe sommairement a la vapeur et vous apporte le cafe tant attendu...degoutant
Date: Date of stay: November 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Más que correcto
Review Content: Situado en la calle principal de Windhoek, a 50 metros del Hotel Hilton, tiene su entrada por un centro comercial. Habitación muy grande y cómoda con baño amplio con bañera y ducha (la ducha un poco pequeña). A unos 5 minutos en coche del aeropuerto EROS de donde salen las avionetas y a unos 45 minutos del aeropuerto internacional. Wifi de pago, por horas. Si no se consumen todos los minutos se puede utilizar la misma clave en días sucesivos e incluso en otro país (nosotros la usamos en Johannesburgo). Tiene restaurante, casino y un bar agradable en el que tomamos un sándwich. Mejor hotel de lo que esperaba. Lo recomiendo.
Date: Date of stay: August 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Do not visit the Bar/Restaurant
Review Content: ... I just know from my friends the rooms are now renovated and look much better (Hilton is now on the other side of the street), but today I had dinner in their restaurant (buffet) which was between ok to bad (fish totally salty, most of the meat tasteless and poor quality).But the cream on the top was the bar. Sorry, but the way they serve there (time, attitude, friendliness) is not acceptable. Also I would expect in a hotel like this, that the staff at least speaks English on a Thai Bar Lady level. Also if you order rum without ice and then you have to watch them how they remove the ice (because of their own miscommunication) by using 3(!) glasses, the the only positive thing I can say is,that luckily they did not do with their fingers.When I was already out of the bar and my friends complained that their attitude is not ok, the answer was "You do not come to my country and tell me ...." But half of them hold Namibian passports ...Sorry, there are other places where you can spend your money.If you have no clue, you could at least be friendly.
Date: Date of stay: January 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: its a very good value for the money
Review Content: We got a very good rate when we stayed at the Kalahari Sands. You will not have a better value for money in town. Rooms are very modern and well equipped; above all spacious. Food choice including the room service is poor, so you will be better off eating out. It is a Casino hotel but if you need something in the City Centre then it is the place to go.
Date: Date of stay: November 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: VERY good overall....
Review Content: new renovated rooms ,bit slow service but seems they are doing their best .very nice view and GREAT location in the city center.I hate the fact you can’t open (even partially ) the window for fresh air !!!
Date: Date of stay: July 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Beginn einer Rundreise
Review Content: In den frühen Morgenstunden nach einer durchflogenen Nacht /Grenzformalitäten/Transfer endlich an der Hotelrezeption. Aus der Zusage, wir werden bald  möglichst  unser Zimmer bekommen wird zunächst doch nichts.Erst gegen 14:00 Uhr haben wir unseren Zimmerschlüssel.Zimmer sind groß, aber doch schon sehr abgewohnt. An den obersten Stockwerken wird dzt. jedoch eifrig renoviert. Hotel liegt ganz zentral in Windhoek und ist gut geeignet für den Beginn einer Rundreise.Europcar hat uns das Mietauto im Hotel übergeben. Hotelgarage dient gleichzeitig einem Einkaufszentrum und wird bewacht. Dieses Einkaufszentrum ist praktisch für eventell erforderliche Einkäufe vor einer Rundfahrt (Sim-Card für´s mobil-phone,Proviant, Getränke alles erhältlich).Abendessen im Hotel in Buffetform ist zu empfehlen.Im Hotel herscht internationales, geschäftiges Treiben.  In Hotelnähe startet auch ein Bus für Stadtrundfahrten um 14:30.Die Weiterempfehlung gilt im Grunde für einen kurzen Aufenthalt. Für mehrtägige Aufenthalte wurd´ich mir dann was anderes  suchen.
Date: Date of stay: September 2010This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Kein wirkliches 4 Sterne-Hotel
Review Content: Zimmer sauber, geräumiges Bad, Mini-Bar abgeschlossen, Fahrstühle brauchen sehr lange, der Service im Frühstücksraum ließ sehr zu wünschen übrig. Mehrfach mussten wir um Butter, Kaffee und Milch bitten, Kellner machten einen lustlosen und uninteressierten Eindruck. An der Rezeption dauert es auch sehr lange, bis sich jemand um einen kümmert.Lage des Hotel günstig mitten im Stadtzentrum. Fazit: ok, aber nicht wirklich zu empfehlen.
Date: Date of stay: October 2009This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Don't be fooled....
Review Content: ...by the seemingly shiny and glitzy first impression. I have stayed here on business many times over the past 6 months and the lifts have been constantly out of service resulting in intollerable queues to access your room at all times of day. The hotel staff have hit me up for money (which I expect on the street, not inside the hotel) and prostitutes proposition in the lobby. Service is variable and indifferent. Expect to be wokrn up at all hours by loud voices and drunken, seedy clientele. Do yourself a favour and go to some of the privately run (with German efficiency and cleanliness) smaller hotels and guest houses in Windhoek and give the Sands a miss.
Date: Date of stay: December 2007This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent
Review Content: Friendly and welcoming Service from Hotel personnel.  I would prefer different type of coffee.  The cleaning staff opened the door on sunday, felt they invaded my privacy.  I would suggest them not to open the door when ever they want.  Or receptionist should tell guests before checking in about the time they will come for cleaning.
Date: Date of stay: February 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great stay in Windhoek
Review Content: The customer service at this hotel is fantastic.  I would like to acknowledge the service we received from Sylvester.   He did a great job of checking us into the hotel and providing us with any information we required.  The hotel is adjacent to a shopping mall which is great if you forgot something at home or just wanted to browse for a souvenirs.  There is also an adjacent coffee shop (Seattle Coffee Company) which had delicious coffee.  It is in a great location across the street from a market and close to the Supreme Court.  There are several options for meals available.  We had dinner on the patio overlooking Windhoek.The food was ok (the appetizers and sundowners were a highlight for us).   My girls were excited to use the pool, but be warned it is actually in the middle of the rooftop bar, so it is kind of awkward to use.  The rooms were average (North America standard) but the bathrooms were beautiful.  Our shower had great pressure with warm water. The beds and pillows were comfortable. The air conditioner in both of our rooms was not working (but that was ok as it was not very warm while we were there)There are plenty of television channel options and the wifi is fast.
Date: Date of stay: October 2024This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Slightly surreal but a Good location
Review Content: Great location.  The hotel is located in a shopping center.  Lobby has a small casino.  We had the deluxe room which faced the Supreme Court Building and was very roomy.  The decor is dated.  We stayed for two nights when we arrived in Namibia and one night as a stop over on our way to the desert.  Some of the staff remembered us.  Overall it's a decent hotel but it's slightly overpriced and there is just something very surreal about it - in a good way.Be forewarned that downtown shutdowns after 1pm on Saturday until Monday morning.  It's a good time to go out to Panduka and support the folks in townships.
Date: Date of stay: March 2007This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Clean and convenient, but not for someone who likes to breathe!
Review Content: The Kalahari Sands is in the centre of town, and convenient, but particularly "airless". The windows in the rooms are locked (no jumpers, allowed!), so I assumed the pool deck (on the 15th floor) would be a good bet to breathe the evening air…Well, the pool deck is a huge disappointment, cramped, walled in and - you guessed it - a smokers refuge! Disappointing that there is nowhere in the hotel where one can enjoy the balmy Windhoek air on a summers'  evening.  On the whole, the rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff friendly. The automatic power-save mechanism is a bit quirky  though - by day 3 I had discovered that the only way to get the hairdryer to work, was to exit the room (with wet hair) and in so doing reset the power, before the hairdryer worked…!
Date: Date of stay: February 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: staff training in professionalism's imperative!
Review Content: This hotel looks like it has had a revamp - the rooms are fresh even though is is an old establishment - kudos there!!From the welcome to asking for ANYTHING - everything seems to be an effort! -waited till 4pm for my room after Air Namibia booked 10 of us here (so perhaps the reason for the unwelcoming faces & slow room readines)-no irons in the rooms(typical in thsi regions) but asking for one I was told I either pay for the service or I go down to the laundry room & do the honours myself!-I baulked at this and the taxi I then asked be called for was never called - I had to go down for reception to action and so ended being late for a dinner with colleages-ordered room service breakfast & hung teh card at 8pm - I woke up & the card was still hanging & of course....no breakfast to be seen!!Business centre needs some workSaving grace : the Spa with the lovely owner and my therapist Izolda .. even thpough it's no 5* just the breath of fresh air of good old professionalsim & kindness to guests appealsthe Dunes restaurant served the most stunning lunch the day I was there. buffets are usually flat but here it was lovely. staff is attentive too.the afct that there's a way to train - relationship with a small gym in the same complex
Date: Date of stay: May 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great service during a difficult time for us
Review Content: My wife and I were booked into the Kalahari Sands Hotel on Oct 28  for one night at the end of our Namibia holiday. That one night turned into four nights because of the closing of JFK following Hurricane Sandy. Despite being very full, the staff went out of their way to make us welcome and very comfortable as we dealt with the uncertainty of when we would be able to go home. On the front desk Therresa Rudifo deserves special mention. She was great, upgrading our room at no additional charge and securing it every day as we waited until 3:00 pm to hear if we were going or staying. The bellman hauled our bags up and down four times with a great sense of humor, keeping us calm during a time of stress. When we thanked a member of the room cleaning staff for a service, she very graciuosly said "It is no problem. You are my guests." sounding like it was her hotel not like an employee. We were touched and impressed.About the hotel in general, we found the rooms very comfortable. Breakfast, which is included in the rate, and the lunch and dinner buffets, are very good with a lot of variety of choices. At first we found the hotel's entrance on the second floor of a shopping arcade a little odd, but it turned out to be very convenient, with a restaurant, coffee shop, supermarket, pharmacy, and many interesting shops right outside our door. There are also two excellent restaurants within a block of the hotel.We went out every morning at 6:00 am for exercise and always felt very safe in the neighbor. The hotel is right in the heart of downtown Windhoek which we got to know very well on our extended stay. We would have two suggestions for improvement. Because the casino and the lounge are just off the lobby, the smell of cigarette smoke is very strong there. This was not an issue in the rooms. Since smoking seems to be more common in Namibia than the US, I don't know what the solution might be; but the air quality in the lobby is challenging for non-smokers. Second, the coffee and tea service was very slow at breakfast, despite the appearance of adequate staff. Why not put a coffee and tea service station out where quests can serve themselves if they choose to. It's already a buffet. What's one more station? Service at lunch and dinner was much more responsive, so we don't know what might cause this issue at breakfast. But the solution of an extra station seems like an easy fix.To the staff of the Kalahari Sands Hotel, thank you for making us feel welcome and well looked after during a time if stress and uncertainty. We will be back and we will recommend your hotel to our friends.
Date: Date of stay: October 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Zentral gelegen, guter Standard
Review Content: Von hier aus haben wir Windhoek erobert. Das Hotel liegt mitten in der Stadt an der Hauptstrasse in unmittelbarer Nachbarschaft von guten Geschäften und einem Supermarkt direkt im Hause. Alle Sehenswürdigkeiten ließen ohne Probleme zu Fuss erreichen.Achtung: Plötzlich um 17 Uhr Ortszeit schließen die Geschäften und die Strassen leeren sich bltzschnell. Auch wenn wir keine Kriminalität erlebt haben, wer vorsichtig ist, kehrt jetzt zum Hotel zurück.Das Zimmer war gross, etwas dunkel, aber i.O., das Badezimmer ok.Sehr gut war das morgentliche Frühstücksbuffet.

Name: Okay

Name: Merita le 4 stelle
Review Content: Hotel in centro sulla via principale di Windhoeck all'interno di un centro commerciale.Le stanze, piuttosto grandi, sono ben attrezzate e dotate di vari confort. Il wi-fi è a pagamento. La colazione molto buona e molto abbondante, altrettanto dicasi per la cena a buffett (se si arriva tardi e stanchi in hotel è la soluzione migliore). Il personale è molto educato ed affabile. Fanno un po' di confusione alla reception e in sala da pranzo sembrano svogliati, ma occorre tenere sempre conto di dove ci troviamo.E' un posto ottimo per congressi/affari e per una notte di passaggio.

Name: Don't bother staying here...
Review Content: The service is slow....probably the worst of the many African hotels I've stayed at.  The bathrrom was not cleaned properly. The lobby stinks of cigarettes. Ther are prostitutes in the bar. The buffet is sub par. The rooms are a decent size.
Date: Date of stay: November 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Average at Best
Review Content: The air conditioner was noisy as hell and stuck on 25 degrees, the room was a sauna.  I complained twice but it was not fixed.  There was no tomato sauce on the first day, "it's locked up".  They had no beef in the restaurant or room service the second day.  Room service had no idea what the restaurant could offer.  I eventually went downstairs to ask them and they said they also had chicken available which they could deliver.  A can of Coke was N$20.  Breakfast is N$150 and dinner N$185.Reception smells like smoke from the entrance of the casino and bar right next to it.  There is no direct road access to get into the hotel.  Parking is virtually non existent in front so hopefully you'll be dropped off instead.  You need to walk through the mall and up the escalators to get to the hotel.  I was there 3 days and the escalator was broken all three days - I had to haul my very heavy suitcase full of training material up and down by myself.  Beware of walking around in that area flashing cameras, wallets and bags - my client (locals) warned me that there are plenty of pickpockets around there and can see a tourist a mile away.  I did not have any issues even though I had to walk to my client along that road every day with a full suitcase.The staff are very friendly at reception.  The bed was very comfortable and the room would have been very quiet if it wasn't for the aircon.The staff at breakfast don't have much to do and stand around in groups just watching you eat.  The shower is minuscule in a huge bathroom and there's a glaring bright light right about your head.  So when you've had no sleep from sweltering all night and being kept awake by a noisy aircon, and have to get up at 6am; you get greeted with a strobe light in your face as you wash your hair.  Very unpleasant.The TV and light switches give off a bright glow when switched off effectively illuminating the entire room at night.  I had to cover the TV with a blanket and the light switch with paper so I could get some sleep.  The bedside lamps were not working.There is a a new Hilton hotel right over the road.  I will definitely be staying there next time instead - least you are guaranteed of a consistent experience at the Hilton's across the globe. This was not a 5 star experience for me.
Date: Date of stay: January 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Updated review from last year...
Review Content: I stayed at the Kalahari Sands in Windhoek in March 2009 and again in April 2010.   I am updating my previous rating.Pros-- Fantastic breakfast buffet - one of the best I've ever had! Its included in the price and makes the stay well worth it.  -- Wireless internet, which didn't work last year, is now up and running.  However, it is EXPENSIVE.  Get ready to pay!-- Spacious room -- A/C in room-- TV with DSTV-- Located in a mall with grocery store, shopping, etc.-- Centrally located in Windhoek and within walking distance to the Craft Market (eat at Paul's!), Gathemann's, and Sardinia, a great Italian restaurant. Nando's and KFC are also within walking distance.-- Friendly staff-- I felt VERY safe in the hotel and in the area surrounding the hotel.Cons-- Elevators are  SLOW. I stayed on the 7th floor. I took the stairs down but waited to take the elevator up, primarily because there are 3 flights of stairs between the ground floor and the 1st floor, making my total trip 10 flights of steep stairs. Luckily, they have someone stationed at the elevators calling them for you so there is almost always one on its way down to pick you up.-- I think they've changed their sheets from last year as mine were so scratchy, they rubbed a sore on my knee.  Ouch.-- Everything in my hotel room was tired.  Tired carpet, tired A/C unit (it barely worked), tired linens, tired TV (always fuzzy reception).  Make no mistake - this is not the nicest place you will ever stay.  However, its clean, comfortable, safe, and centrally located...
Date: Date of stay: April 2010This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bien situé mais un peu froid
Review Content: Hôtel très bien situé à 2 pas du centre de Windhoek et en face d'un petit marché d'artisanatBelle chambre bien confortable et bien équipée, avec douche et baignoire, bel écran de télévisionPetit déjeuner copieux et surtout dès 6 heures du matin, ce qui est un plus pour ceux qui ont un avion tôtRooftop très agréable avec petite piscine et une superbe vuePar contre, nous ne conseillerons le restaurant du rooftop. La nourriture n'est pas mal mais peut mieux faire. Nous avions commandé un vin de 2015 et nous apporte un vin de 2020 au même prix et si nous n'avions pas vérifié la bouteille au moment de l'ouverture, on nous la servait (700 dollars namibiens quand même). Raison : on n'a plus de 2015 alors, on vous met du 2020. Bouteille donc refusée et nous n'en avons pas recommandé car cette bouteille nous a été apportée 10 minutes après que nos plats nous aient été apportés. Quant aux plats, un kudu saignant de 250 g avec risotto aux champignons et sauce chimichuri et un kudu saignant de 400 g saignant avec pommes de terre et sauce au poivre commandés, et tout est arrivé inversé. Plutôt qu'un retour en cuisine, le serveur, quoique fort gentil (le seul a à travailler et à se démener), nous a tout bonnement demandé d'échanger les viandes d'assiettes. Pour un hôtel qui se dit de standing, c'est un peu léger. Par contre, les plats étaient bons et copieux. Prix raisonnablesPour les desserts, catastrophe : apportés au bout de 35 minutes et pour un dessert au café avec de la glace, c'était tout bonnement un café avec un boule de glace qui a fondu immédiatement. Prix bof bofPour le personnel, froid à part le jeune serveur du restaurantPour le transport à l'aéroport, clim à fond dans le minibus à 7 heures du matin et musique forte. Le chauffeur n'a même pas demandé si cela nous plaisait ou non mais tôt le matin, on respecte un peu les gens
Date: Date of stay: October 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: MATHEUS SHIKONGO
Review Content: I want to be offered good prices on my next visit, because am always visiting every month for business trip. please i want to be recognized as regular customers, i like the place , well located in the central of windhoek, with friendly staff
Date: Date of stay: May 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Schönes Hotel mit gutem Service und tollem Ausblick über Windhoek
Review Content: Wir verbrachten im Rahmen einer Gruppenreise den Abschiedabend im Avani Windhoek. Der Service ist gut, das Personal ist freundlich. Die Zimmer und das Bad sind sauber und geräumig, allerdings hat die Dusche wie so oft in Hotels den Nachteil eines fest montierten Duschkopfs. Sowas können sich wahrscheinlich nur Männer ausdenken, die nicht daran denken, daß Frauen gelegentlich andere Bedürfnisse beim Duschen haben. Frühstücksbuffet und Restaurant bieten eine gute Auswahl, allerdings fehlt bei Frühstück -- wie nicht selten in Hotels und Lodges im südlichen Afrika -- eine Auswahl frisches Obst.Von der Dachterrasse im 15. Stock des Hotels hat man einen großartigen Ausblick über Windhoek, vor allem im Licht der Nachmittagssonne. Der nächtliche Blick ist zwar auch schön, aber nicht so spektakulär, da Windhoek über nur wenige prägnante Strukturen verfügt. Wir hatten im Dachgeschoß allerdings ein sehr gut zubereitetes Dinner, das sich lohnte.
Date: Date of stay: March 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Tolle Aussicht vom Dachrestaurant
Review Content: Das Avani liegt sehr zentral in Windhoek, die Zimmer sind groß und sauber. Die Corona-Regeln (Abstand und Maske) werden eingehalten. Leider war unser vorab über die Avani Webseite  zusammen mit dem Zimmer bestellter und bezahlter Transfer nicht am Flughafen. Dies wurde an der Rezepion leider nur mit  Schulter zucken zur Kenntnis genommen. Zusätzlich kam wenige Tage nach Abreise eine Mahnung, dass wir unseren Transfer nicht bezahlt hätten...ohne Worte. Das Personal ist sehr freundlich, das Restaurant auf dem Dach hat einen tollen Ausblick und guten Service, doch leider ist der Service an der Rezeption nicht besonders. Auf Fragen nach "außergewöhnlichen" Dingen wie Geldtausch, Kauf einer SIm Karte, etc. erhält man nur "Vielleicht"-Anworten, nach dem Motto "nix genaues weiß man nicht". Dass das im Zimmerpreis enthaltene Frühstücksbuffet für Hotelgäste im 1. Stock serviert wird und nicht im Coffee-Shop neben der Rezeption, sollte vielleicht auch zum Wissen eines Rezeptionsmitarbeiters gehören. Ansonsten ist das Hotel in Ordnung für eine Nacht nach Ankunft oder vor Abreise.
Date: Date of stay: December 2020This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: I love the service you offer.Keep it up.
Review Content: I love your staff, they are friendly and good people. May they keep on good work and i am proud of them and I love the service you offer.Keep it up. Rooms are always clean, no disturbing.I love Avani service.

Name: Windhoek Avani Experience
Review Content: I like Avani hotels, and what I expected is what I got. The rooms were nicely cleaned, with friendly house keepers. It was my first time in Windhoek and i booked a room with a view to enjoy the views within my busy schedule of work after hours.

Name: Good Location, Nice rooms
Review Content: The food was nice and the room was nice and clean but the hotel is not as clean as I would expect. Especially on the ground floor.I had extreme trouble with the elavator, the elavator kept on going to all floors except mine, several times a day. It was quite annoying as I would need to leave earlier than required.

Name: Très bon hôtel, à chaque visite
Review Content: Depuis la rénovation (anciennement Kalahari Sands) l'hôtel est vraiment monté en gamme. La réception en base de la gallerie commerçante est bien située, le parking est gratuit si vous séjournez à l'hôtel (accessible par l'arrière du bloc et depuis le parking à pied par la gallerie commerçante). Le top c'est le bar en terrasse en dernier étage, c'est une sacré concurrence pour le Hilton just à côté. Les chambres sont grandes et bien insonorisées, petit déjeuner au top.
Date: Date of stay: May 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Perfect location!
Review Content: Beautiful hotel! Right next to the mall. Rooftop terrace bar with magnificent views of the city! Would gladly stay here again! Good food and very friendly staff make you feel very relaxed! Enjoy ice cold Hansa beer on the rooftop
Date: Date of stay: May 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: God location and good service
Review Content: The drive from the airport to the hotel was reasonable quick, the issue turned out to be getting to the parking lot for the hotel. It took a couple of tries and one circle but eventually got there. The parking for hotel guests is on the 4th level of a lot for the adjoining shopping centre. This is one level above the hotel reception and it’s a schlep and a half to get there.  Staff at the front desk were pleasant and very helpful, giving directions to sites nearby and places to grab a snack.The rooms are comfortable, view was so, so. Dinner was buffet still, nothing special but the dessert offering were for want of a better term, habit forming.  I had thirds.  Breakfast the next day was also standard fare, nothing to write home about.
Date: Date of stay: February 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Service
Review Content: First room door did not want to open. Second room aircon did not work. One out of the three lifts worked but will cancel your floor while in the lift. Breakfast could be good if the have the staff hot breakfast served cold
Date: Date of stay: March 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Not the best buffet
Review Content: We had dinner at the Avani restaurant's buffet one evening. It is overpriced for what you get. The meat cut was very tough and since I do not like too complain, I just left it on the plate. The table for the stirfry was over crowded and slow and the waiters took very long to take and deliver the drinks order. There are better options in town

Review Content: Un grand hôtel classique avec une très grande chambre. 1 douche plus 1 baignoire. Nécessaire thé/café, coffre et sèche cheveux. Très bon wifi et bonne restauration buffet.Bref que de classique mais du bon classique!

Review Content: I've been to Windhoek 3 times over the past 6 years but this was the first staying right in town. I would definitely stay here again.

Review Content: I enjoyed my stay at Avani. Looking forward to coming back very soon, in one month time. However, I did not like the toilet facility downstairs. The feeling was shared with numerous guest ang suggest should be looked at with urgency.

Review Content: Rooms are large and well equipped. Good work desk and amenities. Elevators and internet go out on occasion but staff fixes them quickly. Breakfast buffet is big and varied and lunch buffet is very good with several specialty food stations.

Name: Construction
Review Content: I love this hotel but the refurbishment is taking its toll on the overall rating of this establishment. The lifts aren’t working properly and the general disruption throughout the hotel due to construction work is catastrophic. I wish they could close off areas that are out of bounds but the lifts are stopping at floors that aren’t accessible.
