Name: Windhoek for 24 hrs
Review Content: I stayed at the Avani in WDH, it is Centrally located, next to a mall / supermarket in case you wanted to pop out and get a few goodies The renovations in the reception area and new restaurant  are gorgeous, the rest of the property could do with a bit of an update, rooms and bathrooms were clean, staff all very friendly and polite, lifts were a  bit of a pain, took ages to get to the floor you needed to get to. Breakfast was great, had a good selection of fresh fruit / tasty food
Date: Date of stay: February 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Buen hotel centrico pero deficiente mantenimiento
Review Content: Estuvimos mo esposa y yo alojados por una noche en noviembre pasado firmando parte de un grupo .El hotel rs de buen nivel centrico con buena y amplia cama cuidada limpieza y excelente bufet de desayuno variado y con productos de calidad. Lastima el manteniento muy descuidado tv no funcionaba agua caliente deficiente luces de mesitas sin funcionar .. una pena pues es un buen hotel.
Date: Date of stay: December 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Eigentlich sehr empfehlenswert, aber....
Review Content: Wir haben im Avani zu Beginn und am Ende unserer Namibia-Trips jeweils eine Nacht verbracht. Beide Male waren die Zimmer gross, gepflegt und sauber. Einziger kleiner Minuspunkt waren die schmutzigen Fenster, welchen wieder einmal eine Aussenreinigung nötig gehabt hätten. Der ganz grosse Teil der Mitarbeiter am Empfang und im Speisesaal waren sehr freundlich und bemüht. Auch das Gratisparkdeck für Gäste mit Mietwagen ist ganz einfach toll und die Roof-Top-Terrasse mit kleinem Pool und Sicht auf die Stadt stehen ebenfalls auf die Plusseite. Trotzdem erhält das Avani von mir nur 3 von 5 Punkten. Das Gebäude mit etwa 14 Etagen verfügt nur über 3 Fahrstühle mit Platz für jeweils etwa 8 Personen. Dies ist für ein Haus dieser Grösse sehr knapp bemessen. Wenn dann wie bei unseren beiden Besuchen nur zwei von dreien und beim anderen Mal gar nur einer funktioniert,  ist langes Warten unvermeidlich. Wir mussten uns jeweils entscheiden, ob wir wieder 15 Minuten langes Anstehen riskieren sollen, oder ob wir die 10 Etagen nicht besser zu Fuss in Angriff nehmen  Zudem waren wir doch sehr überrascht, dass beim Einchecken um 18.15 Uhr unser gebuchtes Zimmer noch nicht bezugsbereit war. Man bat uns in der Lobby Platz zu nehmen und uns zu gedulden. Dort sassen allerdings bereits andere Gäste denen  das gleiche Schicksal wiederfuhr. Da es nicht so recht vorwärts gehen wollte,  entschieden wir uns nach einiger Zeit verschwitzt, schmutzig und müde erst einmal Essen zu gehen. Dies war nicht gerade der Ferienstart welchen wir uns nach der langen Anreise erhofft hatten. Diese beiden Vorkommnisse liessen mich ein wenig ein am Hotelmanagement zweifeln. Nach meiner Meinung sollte es selbstverständlich sein, dass bei technischen Störungen rund um die Uhr ein Notfalldienst aufgeboten werden kann und immer genügend Ersatzteile vorhanden sind. Auch gehe ich nicht davon aus,  dass man ganz kurzfristig vom Gästeansturm überrumpelt wurde sondern schon längere Zeit wusste, dass das Haus gut gebucht sein wird. Daher sollten auch Verspätungen bei der Zimmerreinigung nie so aus dem Ruder laufen.
Date: Date of stay: October 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Misleading and disappointing
Review Content: From the moment we arrived, couldn’t find hotel entrance, no signs showing Hotel entrance/parking lot, parking building covered with scaffolding’s and under renovations. Call button for porter service at the parking lot was not working. Had to lug small kids and all the bags to the reception. Most of the time only 1 out of 3 lifts were working to go to the rooms. Rooms were stuffy and AC was warm even with 16C. Swimming pool was cloudy and looked like had too much chlorine in it and was bubbling.
Date: Date of stay: October 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: klasse Stadthotel
Review Content: Sehr zentral gelegen, nur 2 Minuten Fußweg zur Christuskirche.Sehr große, saubere Zimmer. Eigenes Parkdeck und Pool mit herrlichem Ausblick auf der Dachterasse. Personal super freundlich und hilfsbereit.Leckeres Frühstücksbuffet.Günstiger Shuttle Service zum Flughafen wird angeboten.
Date: Date of stay: September 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: hotel centrico, de lujo
Review Content: esta en el centro de Windhoek, las habitaciones y las instalaciones son excelentes. y el personal es super amable desde los de recepción, los maleteros y el personal del restaurante. la entrada esta dentro de un centro comercial. el buffet tanto del desayuno como de la cena es inmejorabke.de 10wiffi en las habitaciones

Name: Central and comfortable
Review Content: Centrally located in Windhoek. Front desk staff service excellent. Rooms fair size, and clean. Could however do with more light on the desk. Parking area difficult to locate. Overall a pleasant stay..certainly improved after the rebranding.
Date: Date of stay: July 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Stop in Windhoek
Review Content: We stayed overnight at the Avani Hotel on our way through Windhoek.  We were driving, so found it complicated a) to find the Hotel and b) to find the underground parking behind the Hotel and then not easy to get all the luggage upstairs to the Hotel, although someone did come to help from reception, but once settled in it is very convenient right in the middle of town and easy to walk to all the interesting spots and shops.   We had the buffet for dinner and breakfast and this was exceptionally good with a huge choice.   Rooms very comfortable, spacious and with a beautiful view over the City.
Date: Date of stay: April 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel in guter Lage
Review Content: Zimmer super und die Betten ok, aber Service beim Frühstück katastrophal. Entweder gab es kein Geschirr oder kein Essen. Das Personal verzog keine Miene und servierte Kaffee nur nach mehrfacher Aufforderung

Name: Solid option in city centre
Review Content: Visited Windhoek for a weekend. Convenient location. Walking distance to the main tourist attractions and there are some coffee shops and  restaurants in the vicinity. Check-in  probably took longer than it should have. Room was clean and comfortable. Buffet breakfast was very good. Had room service on one night which was also surprisingly tasty.  Staff were generally pleasant.
Date: Date of stay: March 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Comfortable and Clean
Review Content: Rooms are clean and spacious with comfortable beds. Killer breakfast and dinner buffet. Excellent staff- Very hospitable and go out of their way to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Great job!

Name: Nice atmosphere and friendly staff
Review Content: The hotel has very nice and spacious rooms, clean and bright, with balcony, sofa and king size bed, in the bathroom bathtube and shower . There is swimming pool outside surrounded by the small river and some rocks. It looks quite ineresting. Staff is usually friendly but could improve a bit. I tried beef burger and it was tasty and big enough. Recommended for short stay.

Name: good
Review Content: just do something about elevators it takes a lots of waiting time specially if you have a pickup need to come way ahead of time the only short coming in this hotel and have a guard down stairs to protect the guests

Name: Good Business Hotel in the CBD
Review Content: AVANI is conveniently located and provides comfortable accommodation for the business traveler.  I would recommend it if you are making a short stop in Windhoek, the staff are friendly, the facilities are good and the food cannot be faulted.

Name: Centrale e funzionale
Review Content: Ci abbiamo dormito la prima notte appena arrivati in Namibia. Le finiture sono adeguate alla categoria ed il servizio appare efficiente. Certo non ha alcun tipo di fascino, é un po' stereotipato, tipico di questi alberghi forse più business, con poco charme. Comodi i negozi alla base delle scale mobili di accesso.
Date: Date of stay: October 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: ottimo hotel
Review Content: ottimo hotel nel centro di windhoek. si trova all'interno di un piccolo centro commerciale ed è molto comodo. le stanze sono belle e spaziose, la colazione ottima, ed è disponibile il wifi gratuito con ottima velocità di connessione. Personale molto cortese

Name: A place to stay
Review Content: This hotel seems to be above what was a main shopping mall many years ago.  It is on the main street of Windhoek.  You arrive past deserted shops and up escalators to the upper shopping level. I am told it has been recently refurbished and the rooms and reception are decent. No gym, no indication of a pool.  Simply a place to sleep on a business trip.
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good location
Review Content: We arrived there after 24 days of round trip, parking was full so we park one floor up and rang the bell for assistant for our suitcases ..unfortunately we carried them to the reception ..was so busy only one poor girl   was alone ,..for a 4 star hotel the reception was not well organize ,the room was very comfortable and clean ..we had dinner 16th August night i want to thanks waiter Richard and the grill cook.they made our dining experience unforgettable. we can easily recommend this hotel .nice place to stay  inside a shopping mall .
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Ticks All The Boxes
Review Content: Wow! An amazing breakfast awaits the weary traveler. Thick slices of toast pork and apple sauce (yes, for breakfast), crisp croissants and delicious Danishes plus all the eggs you can swallow. And that's after bedding down in a comfortable room, good reception service and helpful service people. Highly recommended.
Date: Date of stay: July 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Très bon hotel
Review Content: Situé en centre ville, les chambres sont très confortables, le buffet petit déjeuner est copieux. Tout le confort d'un grand hotel comme aux États Unis. Situé dans une galerie commerciale, l'hôtel dispose aussi d'un casino sans grand charme. Staff efficace et très professionnel.
Date: Date of stay: June 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice place
Review Content: This hotel is in the mall but still a very decent place to stay in and it was actually nice that you could pop down to a store to go and buy something when needed. The breakfast was not bad at all and the free wifi could definitely be a plus. It is also situated in town so quick to get to places around there.
Date: Date of stay: May 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Staff were amazing especially their Guest Service Relations Personnel Cheneviev Beukes.
Review Content: We were welcomed by friendly, helpful and professional staff, check-in is at 2:00pm in the afternoon but we arrived at 7:00am exhausted from a bus trip Cape Town to Windhoek. A sweetest gentleman from behind the counter (reception) was so helpful he checked us in so we could get some sleep we really appreciated that. The hotel is nice and clean, our room was very clean big and comfortable with free WiFi.Breakfast was beautiful with a variety to choose from. Dinner was nice too a buffet dinner, it would have been nice if we had a la carte menu as well.Location was convenient although confusing because the hotel is inside the mall and had to drag our heavy luggage up the escalator as we did not have anyone to help us which we felt a bit vulnerable as you could get mugged without the hotel knowing with no visibility to the street. Overall the hotel is perfect for people visiting Windhoek its in the city centre and reasonable priced I would highly recommend it. Guest Service Relations Personnel Cheneviev Beukes was an exceptional she was so helpful with her professionalism she organised our day tours and airport transfers she was oustanding an asset for Avani.
Date: Date of stay: March 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: New Management .......
Review Content: Was here last about 8/9 months ago while still under previous management.Check-in and out were conducted with the usual efficiency. Old faces & welcome backs from regular staff was also encouraging.Some issues: My room's cistern was continually running, the hot water basin tap also dripped continually. Shower frame beading was loose. Not really 4 star maintenance....For breakfast I must confess the previous management offered a greater variety - same friendly waitrons running the restaurant.
Date: Date of stay: February 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great for Business People
Review Content: I have been staying at the Avani hotel on a weekly basis, on and off, since August until December. It is a great hotel with superb breakfasts, excellent room service and very clean and modern. I would highly recommend anyone to stay here.The wifi is reasonably fast and stable compared to other hotels and the service is quick and efficient.
Date: Date of stay: August 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good location in the shopping centre
Review Content: During my stay in Namibia I stayed in this hotel twice, I also stayed here 2 years ago when the name was Kalahari Sands Hotel. The service in the reception is now much better than two years ago. Buffet breakfast is very good, but service in general can be very different depending on the day (e.g. according to our experience on Monday morning you hardly see motivated people in the restaurant). The service in the bar is slow and there are always problems with change if you pay cash. Rooms are big and clean with comfortable beds. There is a nice terrace with a small swimming pool (with cold water) on the roof. It´s safe and easy to go shopping, because the hotel is located in the shopping centre. Room rates change a lot. It´s worth to compare rates e.g. using Trivago booking site.
Date: Date of stay: October 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Neu renoviertes Hotel im Zentrum der Stadt (ehemals Kalahari Sands Hotel)
Review Content: Das Hotel liegt im 1. Stock eines Einkaufszentrums mitten in der Stadt von Windhoek. Es gibt eine grosse Lobby mit angrenzendem Restaurant und Bar. Die Zimmer sind sehr gross und hell. Auch das Bad ist extrem gross und modern eingerichtet. Leider fehlt ein Bügelbrett im Zimmer. Die Betten sind sehr bequem und mit guten Duvets ausgestattet. Im Zimmer hat man Gratis Wi-Fi. Das Personal an der Reception und im Restaurant war sehr zuvorkommend, hilfsbereit und freundlich. Zudem gibt es ein grosses Frühstücksbuffet mit heissen sowie kalten Speisen. Wenn man mit dem Taxi ankommt oder geht gibt es manchmal Probleme für die Taxifahrer einen Parkplatz zu finden, da es nur eine kleine Anzahl Parkmöglichkeiten vor dem Einkaufszentrum gibt. Zudem muss man mit dem Gepäck einen Stock mit der Rolltreppe hinauf oder hinunter fahren. Ansonsten ist man aber wirklich mitten im Zentrum.
Date: Date of stay: September 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hôtel moderne en plein centre ville
Review Content: Bon choix pour un séjour d'une nuit après un vol international.Chambre tout confort équipée d'un ensemble douche/baignoire avec une décoration moderne.Il est en plein centre ville, situé dans une galerie commerciale.
Date: Date of stay: June 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: bien situe au centre
Review Content: Chambres belles et spacieuses.Servive petit dejeuner pas tres efficace. Pour moi grand bemol, pas de terrasse pour profiter du beau temps .... sauf ,alors faut passer par salle a manger et se retrouver dans un petit coin sur le terrasse exterieure ou le petit dejeuner est servi(bien que le personnel si rend jamais)et c 'est moi meme qui doit organiser le cafe, etc....)ou il y a queqlues chaises et possibilitee de fumer mais pas de service bar.Au Hilton en face(plus beau et plus cher)belle terrasse exterieure avec service bar et petite restauration.
Date: Date of stay: February 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Potential to be V Good but missing some touches
Review Content: Kalahari Sands is well located in the centre of town and the rooms are spacious and clean but there are niggles that let down a hotel which is supposedly 4-star. For a hotel in 2014 which purportedly welcomes business clients, charging for the use of hotel Wifi is no longer acceptable.Secondly as a previous review mentioned, there was indeed a rather unpleasant, sewage like smell emanating from the bathroom in my room and this was before I visited it!
Date: Date of stay: October 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Centrale e confortevole
Review Content: Un buon hotel posto sulla via principale della città che quindi si puó visitare a piedi.L'ingresso si trova all'interno di un centro commerciale e dalla strada non è visibile e quindi bisogna prestare attenzione. All'interno di questo centro ci son sia una banca che un supermercato che possono tornare utili.Le camere sono funzionali e spaziose con letti grandi e comodi. Bagno grande con doccia e vasca, phon e set di cortesia.La colazione é piuttosto abbondante e buona.C'è anche il ristorante che peró personalmente non ho provato.C'è il parcheggio gratuito posto al quarto piano del parcheggio del centro commerciale da cui si accede direttamente al hotel dove dovrà essere vidimato il biglietto d'accesso.La wi fi è a pagamento.Nel complesso una buona scelta per quella che normalmente è una notte di inizio o fine vacanza.
Date: Date of stay: August 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bien
Review Content: Hôtel fonctionnel et bien situé. Les chambres sont agréables.  La restauration   est variée quoique un peu grasse.  L'accès à l 'hôtel est très facile quand on arrive de l 'aéroport. L'entrée est quant à elle un peu particulière car il faut traverser préalablement un petit centre commercial pour accéder à la réception.
Date: Date of stay: June 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good option
Review Content: Have stayed twice in the last two months for business.  Both were single night stays and the hotel suited us perfectly as it is located close to where we were working.First time around we struggled to find the entrance to the hotel which is located above a rather dodgy looking shopping centre.  Signage in this regard as well as where to park is severely lacking.  Noticed a number of guests on our second visit having the same problem and we were fortunately able to assist.Once in the hotel, it's the standard Sun International affair.  The rooms are extremely comfortable and clean and can not be faulted.  The lighting is somewhat confusing and on my second stay I couldn't get the bedside lamps to come on at all.Breakfast was good, although the service was a bit slow.  If you catch it in rush hour expect to wait a while.  Found all staff to be friendly and helpful, especially the lady in the bar who was super friendly.I suspect I wouldn't want to stay here for longer stays, but for the 2-3 night business stay it was perfect and will certainly use it again.
Date: Date of stay: November 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: hotel in centro
Review Content: Hotel moderno posto all'interno di un centro commerciale, non e' comodissimo accedere all'ingresso se non si e' accompagnati. Le stanze sono confortevoli e la colazione varia. Unica nota negativa il personale della reception disorganizzato e poco cordiale.
Date: Date of stay: July 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bon hôtel
Review Content: Bon hôtel pour le dernier soir en Namibie.A un quart d'heure à pied du marché artisanal.Belle chambre, confortable, avec vue sur Windhoek.Très bon buffet et petit déjeuné.Hôtel international au premier étage d'un centre commercial.
Date: Date of stay: December 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good city hotel
Review Content: This hotel is in an excellent location smack in downtown Windhoeck, ideal for shopping or business. The rooms and bathrooms are well appointed, breakfast is good. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Unless you want to spend the money for the new Hilton, this is the place to stay.
Date: Date of stay: May 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Buona soluzione in centro a Windhoek
Review Content: Sono transitato di passaggio, prima di iniziare il tour in Namibia. Posizionato all'interno di un centro commerciale, è una buona soluzione per chi parte o rientra da un safari. Posizionato in centro città, dispone di un buon ristorante e di piscina (non agibile per lavori). Camere un po' piccole ma ben arredate e pulite. Internet a pagamento.
Date: Date of stay: May 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: nicht zu empfehlen
Review Content: Wir kammen um 5Uhr morgens in Namibia an, nach einer mehr als 17stündigenAnreise. Als wir um ca 6.30 Uhr im Kalahri Sands ankammen  sagten sie unsan der Reception das unser Zimmer erst ab 10 Uhr bezugsbereit seien. So gingen wir zuerst mal Frühstücken als wir um 10.30 Uhr zurückkammen war eine andere Schicht  an der Reception, die sagten uns das wir das Zimmer erst um 14.00 Uhr beziehen könnten . Dabei wollten wir nur mal endliche eine Dusche !!!!!!!  Ich war inzwischen gut 22 Stunden unterwegs. Als wir nachfragten ob es nicht möglich  seiein anderes Zimmer früher zu bekommen wurden uns sehr unfreundlich gesagt das gehe nicht, sie könne ja nichts dafür das der Kollege uns am morgen falsch informierthabe. Ich finde ein 4 Sterne Hotel sollte so  flexibel sein da die Gäste aus Europaja immer so Früh am morgen ankommen. Übrigens wir bekammen unser Zimmer um 13.30 Uhr doch noch
Date: Date of stay: September 2010This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great location, clean rooms, good food
Review Content: Yes, the lifts are slower than in North America or Europe, but they work. An attendent on the lobby floor will call an elevator for you as soon as you make the slightest move in the general direction of the elevators. The rooms are clean and have all the equipment one would normally expect from a business hotel, and everything works.The business centre is staffed, has the normal equipment, but the internet seems a little slow, although this may be because someone was moving large files while I was there.The buffet for dinner and breakfast was well presented, tasty and had a good variety of food. There are several good restaurants nearby, but the hotel food was more than adequate. The downtown location is great for sightseeing, business or government meetings, but it has the reputation of being in a hot zone. I was never accosted nor did I see anything improper happen.
Date: Date of stay: September 2009This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Badly maintained
Review Content: Torn carpets in the Dunes Restaurant were a healthy and safety hazard. In the 9 days that we were there one of the three lifts was always out of order, a second was out of order for 50% of the time, and the third out of order around 10% of the time. And this in a 12 storey hotel. Walking up to the 6th floor was no fun at 1500 metres altitude of Windhoek.Breakfast time was chaotic. Our visit coincided with an international cricket competition, and the hotel was very full. Unfortunately there had been no attempt by the management to increase staffing levels at breakfast. We regularly had to wait 10 - 20 minutes for tea/coffee. Food, crockery and cutlery often ran out. Quite appaling for an alleged 4 star hotel.On the plus side, the staff were unfailingly friendly and tried their best in difficult circumstances.The fire alarm was tested without any notice being given. Many residents had walked down several flights of stairs before they realised it was just a test. But now there was 60 or 70 people on the ground floor vying for the one lift that was working.All in all, I could not recommend this hotel.
Date: Date of stay: November 2007This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Home away from home
Review Content: I always have the most comfortable stay. The staff members are friendly and very helpful. The rooms are comfortable especially the work station that allows me to work comfortably. The breakfast is a full buffet with variety and it’s easy access to town center because of its location. I practically walk everywhere.
Date: Date of stay: November 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice rooms
Review Content: I enjoyed my room at The Avani. It was comfortable and spacious. The staff was also very pleasant and helpful. The worst part of my 3 night stay were the restaurant/food options. The rooftop dining was the worst. At 7PM the music volume went up at the adjacent Skybar making for a very loud dining experience. More like dining in a night club than a nice restaurant. Some of the tables are situated along the wall where there was sofa seating. This was so uncomfortable as the sofa was so deep you could not rest your back. Not comfortable at all. The cafe off the lobby is a mixed bag. It's hard to tell what it is. I do know I had the worst coffee of my stay there. I can't comment on the buffet restaurant. I went up there to find 2 people dining along with a lot of food steaming away at the buffet. I decided to pass on that. So, the rest of my drinking and dining was across the street at the Hilton. Much better options in an inviting atmosphere.
Date: Date of stay: February 2020This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: One of the best in WIndhoek
Review Content: A great place to start or end your trip. Only 40 mins or so easy drive from the airport, so great if you are jetlagged. If you are self driving stop at the front door and someone will come, take your bags, and direct you to the free, covered parking.Very European in standard, nice clean big rooms. Head for the rooftop bar for Sundowner and/or dinner.
Date: Date of stay: March 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent stay in Windhoek
Review Content: Very nice hotel to stay, with a excellent service by the whole stuff. Breakfast and the restaurant on the rooftop were just great with an impressive view over the city. The hotel is well located in the city centre and if you need a taxi, the stuff can get you one
Date: Date of stay: May 2022This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: AVANI STRATOS - The Best Service By The Best Waitress.
Review Content: We recently had my brother's 40th Birthday dinner party hosted at Avani and their stuff from management to the waiters were very helpful and accommodating from the start to the end.The restaurant was ideal and the stuff were all friendly, helpful, know what we wanted and assisted in almost every way, especially Michaela.Michaela helped us from the start and was our right hand in organizing every thing for the dinner party. She has the best hosting and service skills when it comes to hospitality and very quick on her feet.Thank you for an incredible night Michaela you are the best waitress at Avani Stratos and in the hospitality business.-Bradley
Date: Date of stay: January 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Birthday Bliss: A Memorable Solo Date at Avani (Stratos)
Review Content: Today was my birthday, and I decided to celebrate with a solo date at Avani (Stratos). However, my phone unexpectedly shut down, and I found myself without a charger. Fortunately, the waiter at the restaurant was incredibly thoughtful and offered to capture the special moments by taking pictures of me with his cellphone. It was a kind gesture that saved the day. I must also mention the incredible food I enjoyed. The steak was unbelievably tender and juicy, and the chef went above and beyond to make my birthday even more memorable. They personally wished me a happy birthday and even wrote it on the dessert plate. It was such a delightful touch. Overall, I had a truly lovely experience. I highly recommend asking for Jeremy; he is an amazing waiter who made my celebration extra special.
Date: Date of stay: April 2024This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Shanice
Review Content: Wow! In addition to the delicious food, the service at Rooftop was top-notch. Our server Shanice was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu, making recommendations and ensuring that we had a great dining experience I highly recommend the rooftop bar for a delicious and enjoyable dining experience.
Date: Date of stay: April 2024This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Best stay at Avani Hotel
Review Content: I arrived on the 20th November 2022 and I stayed for a night.  I  must indicate here that my stay at Avani hotel was perfect  I wasomly disappointed in when there was only restaurant that was open and it took long before we got our meal. I will always be happy to be staying at Avani hotel and I will always recommend my friends to come and stay at Avani hotel. The place was clean/tidy.

Name: Lenny
Review Content: Had a really good time. When clients arrive please familiarize them with the premises to avoid getting lost around the hotel. Some staff members show rudeness towards guests, develop a friendly approach towards guests.

Name: Avani Hotel review
Review Content: This hotel has become my second home away from home. I always enjoy my stay with you people. Your whole service is superb. I always recommend you for any person who asks for a good place to stay in Namibia especially in the capital city. Your workers are having good customer service, keep up the good work.
Date: Date of stay: August 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Review Content: Avani Windhoek has never dissapointed, every time I stay here I am welcomed warmly and my stay is always excellent. Regonition throughout all the departments makes me feel valued and appreciated. Receptionist Chuma is very helpful and always friendly. Keep it up. Wishing the entire hotel a joyous festive season

Name: Great Service With A Smile
Review Content: NamFELTP organized a scientific manuscript writing workshop at the Nauklauft conference room from 11-15 April '23. Charmaine, a staff member of Avani and a few other staff assisted us . Charmaine can make quick decisions and have great interpersonal skills. Attention to detail and excellent multitasking skills. She is helpful and kind, rendered us great service with a smile.

Name: Excellent service
Review Content: Excellent service offered by these 3 brand ambassadors of this elegant hotel, Shalen, Layla and Manfred, they ensured that my stay was comfortable and they do look after their guests making their guests feel at home. I really enjoyed my stay and hopefully will return in the near future.Job well done, see you soon!
Date: Date of stay: July 2023This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very nice
Review Content: The hotel is very clean. Staff members are friendly from the reception to the  Dune restaurant;Staff like Michelle, Loide and Mr Nakale the chef, there are friendly and so helpful. The room is well prepared and and nice clean. The conference was not really conducive.
Date: Date of stay: August 2024This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Breakfast in Dunes with friendly staff
Review Content: Had a lovely stay at Avani hotel. Upon arrival we were greeted by the very friendly and informative Lee who checked us in to our room. The breakfast at Dunes was a nice buffet with friendly helpful staff Michelle and Johnny who made sure we were very well looked after :) The rooftop bar was spectacular particular during sunset with more friendly staff! Jeremy was so friendly and very helpful. If you are here for the said “casino” just know that casino means pokie machines and you need a card and ID to play them.  The room service was also a bit of a let down as we wanted a bottle of wine delivered to our room and instead we had to leave to go get one from the restaurant upstairs. Overall, it was a lovely stay with very lovely staff.
Date: Date of stay: August 2024This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Namibia Charm
Review Content: Hotel is clean but a little dated. Best part was the restaurant staff during breakfast. Nancy always greeted us with a smile and Michelle was polite and addressed all of our dining needs. If I return to Namibia I would stay here again for sure.
Date: Date of stay: September 2024This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Comfortable stay, rooms are cleaned and tied, front desk are friendly staffs and willing to assist always
Review Content: Very comfortable, the staff are very friendly and always willing to give a hand when need assistance. Front desk was smooth, found Mr Manfried, gave a very good service and also how to go about parking my car and make sure it is safe. Definitely coming back again

Name: Great staff
Review Content: Rooms are good, location is nice, and the staff is really lovely. Whenever we needed help with something the staff at réception were always here to help, and Shiwa, the waitress who took care of us was really nice! The hotel seemed to have a lot of guests coming at once and it seemed very busy for the staff but they dealt with it professionally and always kept à smile on there face!Will definitely come back when I go to windhoek again!

Name: Great stay
Review Content: Great stay at the Avani hotel, the staff is always amazing. As a well seasoned traveller it is always great to see professional individuals giving amazing service. Thank you Rejoice, Manfred and Nico.

Name: Exllent
Review Content: I checked in at Avani hotel Windhoek and the receptionists was very friendly and welcoming.  I felt like I was at home and got a treatment like a king. The service was excellent and I will definitely come back. I got excellent service from Engelhard,Tia. Jeffrey and Chumamr

Review Content: I was impressed with the location as there is access to shops, the city centre.  nice receiving check-in and check-out. The only suggestion to improve the food menu with a few  Asian /Indian style menus by adding veg and non-veg curries  and Biryani

Name: Breakfast
Review Content: High class food and serving. Top tier food and best view on Stratos. My rugby team and I thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast and it was well served. PERSONALLY I highly recommend this Hotel as it is really one of the best in Windhoek.

Name: Best Experience

I’ll definitely come back and recommend this place to friends ans family. Thank you.

Review Content: Thanking Avani Hotel and Conferencing for the outstanding service.David is a very competent service provider who understand what business and service means.By having him around for setting up and some great follow up meant that, great for the team.ar large

Name: Stratos
Review Content: One word Shanice. The lady at the door was so welcoming, funny and always smiling. The menu is exceptional, good prices. The view is spectacular, with great sundowners.  It is a must stop place if you’re in town.

Name: Olivia N Nakale
Review Content: I enjoyed my stay. We checked in on the  18th of November if I am not mistaken. There was no hustle neither long ques at check in. I received the required information upon arrival to make my stay comfortable and fuss free. that is, information with regards to the location of my room, internet connectivity meal times gym facilities etc. My stay was nothing short of amazing.

Name: Wonderful Place. Highly Recommend!
Review Content: Avani Windhoek Stratos restaurant… This place is just great!Amazing food, great cocktails, friendly staff, wonderful view. You can try oryx, kudu and springbok steaks. They also have fresh oysters. Perfect for the evening in Windhoek.P.S. Buffy is just great. Very friendly and helpful.

Name: Great Services at  Dunes Restaurant
Review Content: I had a fantastic experience at Dunes Restaurant at Avani Hotel in Windhoek. Name: Ascensor muy complicado
Review Content: Llegamos de noche a Windhoek y emepzabamso ruta al dia siguiente a la 6 pro l oque no pudimos disfrutar mucho el hotel, la habitación era correcta, pero l oque fue un desastre fue llegar a ella, solo funcionaba uno de los 3 ascensores y el sistema que habían instalado para la programación de los pisos, era tan complicado que la gente subía y volvía a a aparecer a en la planta baja varias veces hasta que conseguían llegar a su piso, el personal no sabía como funcionaba el sistema, era nuevo  esperamos 38 minutos para poder subir de la cola que había, era un séptimo piso, al día siguiente nos levantamos 15 minutos antes para poder llegar a la hora a recepción...
Date: Date of stay: August 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice rooms, weird setting, average service
Review Content: This hotel was in a central location though a bit hard to get to given that it is in a shopping mall that was a ghost town over the holiday weekend we stayed there.  Room was clean, comfortable and nice.  The only funky thing is they have some fancy electricity management system that is supposed to automatically turn the lights on and off.  Well what happens is that you can't really do either.  They didn't turn on when we came in and did turn on when we were trying to sneak quietly to the bathroom in the middle of the night with the kids asleep.  Not the end of the world but fairly annoying.They also advertise laundry service but at least over the weekend had none.  They did offer to have a housekeeper wash a few essentials by hand in our sink but after a week of traveling with a family of 4 that was not going to cut it.  The restaurant is way overpriced with meal buffet prices that were far above everywhere else we traveled on this strip (and we stayed in other even nicer hotels).  Plus there is NOTHING else around here open to eat on Saturdays so they have you as a captive audience (which is probably how they get away with charging so much).  Overall fine, nice rooms, comfortable, friendly service but overpriced with a weird ambience.  I'd look to stay elsewhere next time unless I needed to be in the city center for business.  Even then I'd probably stay a block away at the Hilton.  Certainly wouldn't stay here on holiday again.
Date: Date of stay: December 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Review Content: Windhoek is such a small and friendly city and Avani is located smack in the middle of it. No matter where you are going you are close. The room I got was great (I had a 2 room suite) and I slept so well in the bed.The staff was very friendly and nice and service was more like you would get from a good, small hotel (friendly and personal)Namibia is "the best of Africa, without the worst of Africa" and Avani is the best of Namibia without the worst of Namibia. :)
Date: Date of stay: January 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent location but staff not well trained
Review Content: The Kalahari Sands is in a large shopping centre in the centre of Windhoek, making it very convenient for just about everything in the town. Checking in on a Sunday evening took an excrutiatingly long time as there was only one receptionist behind the counter and a fairly substantial queue was moving at a glacial pace. The room more than compensated, however, as it was huge and very clean. There were some noisy guests nearby who insisted on partying until around midnight with the bedroom door open. Breakfast was the usual Sun International type of affair and was workmanlike. Staff appeared disinterested though. Next time would seriously consider the nearby Hilton as an alternative, even though it is a lot more expensive.
Date: Date of stay: April 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Gerne wieder
Review Content: Das Zimmer war komplett renoviert, geschmackvoll ausgestattet und sehr geräumig. Der Zugang zum Hotel führt durch ein Einkaufszentrum. Dies ist etwas ungewöhnlich, hat den Vorteil, dass man Supermarkt und Bank schnell erreichen kann. Das Frühstück war hervorragend. Das Hotel liegt direkt an der Haupteinkaufsstraße von Windhoek (Independence Ave.). Abends kann man fußläufig einige Restaurants in der Innenstadt ansteuern. Da es aber zu dieser Tageszeit sehr ruhig auf den Straßen ist (mit Ausnahme einiger Gruppen von  Jugendlichen...) würde ich es beim nächsten Mal vorziehen, mit dem Pkw unterwegs zu sein. Tagsüber ist es aber kein Problem.
Date: Date of stay: August 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Gutes Stadthotel in zentraler Lage
Review Content: Die letzte Nacht in Namibia haben wir mitten im Zentrum von Windhoek im Hotel Kalahari Sands verbracht. Da es bei unserer Ankunft am Abend schon dunkel war, mussten wir erst mal ein wenig suchen. an der Straße ist die Parkplatzsuche ziemlich aussichtslos also sind wir direkt in das angegliederte Parkhaus gefahren. Von dort gibt es einen direkten Zugang in das Hotel. Ein paar Kofferträger kamen sofort angelaufen, als sie bemerkten, dass wir mit Gepäck den Hotelzugang ansteuerten. Das Hotel ist mit einer Einkaufsmall verbunden, deren Geschäfte aber an diesem Samstag Abend bereits geschlossen hatten. Der Empfangsbereich ist modern und ansprechend ausgestattet. Der Check-in verlief reibungslos und unsere Wünsche nach einem Zimmer mit getrennten Betten in einem oberen Stockwerk wurden prompt erfüllt. Das Zimmer war geräumig und modern und sah aus, wie jedes andere Businesszimmer in einem beliebigen Hotel dieser Kategorie auf der Welt. Eine geräuscharme effiziente Klimaanlage, Minibar, TV und Wasserkocher mit Tee und Kaffeeutensilien waren vorhanden. Das Abendessen haben wir im hoteleigenen Restaurant eingenommen, wo ein sehr gutes Buffet angeboten wurde. Für umgerechnet 17 Euro gab es dort eine sehr große Auswahl an Speisen, die man sich vom Koch frisch zubereiten lassen konnte. Z.B. gab es eine Theke mit asiatischen Speisen, eine Barbecue Theke, Salatbar und bereits zubereitete Gerichte in Warmhalte-Schalen sowie verschiedene Desserts. Wir waren echt begeistert von der Qualität und der großen Auswahl. Das Restaurant war auch gut belegt, zumal es auch aus Sicherheitserwägungen nicht ratsam ist, abends in Windhoek auf die Suche nach einem Restaurant zu gehen. Das Frühstücksbuffet am nächsten Morgen war auch tadellos ; alles dabei, was man von einem Hotel dieser Güte erwarten kann. Als Ausgangspunkt für Stadterkundungen ist das Hotel gut geeignet, da es sich direkt im Zentrum befindet. In Laufnähe sind viele Souvenirgeschäfte, Galerien, Bekleidungsgeschäfte sowie ein Handicraft-Center , welches unbedingt einen Besuch wert ist. Zum Flughafen fährt man etwa 45 Minuten.  Das Hotel gehört zur Sun International Gruppe, die ja in Afrika einige sehr gute Hotels betreibt.
Date: Date of stay: February 2010This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Decepcionante
Review Content: É notória a falta de formação dos funcionários. A estadia foi debitada três vezes, sendo que o funcionário insistia que o cartão não era aceite, quando a máquina simplesmente não tinha papel. A suíte presidencial tinha uma porta solta e assim permaneceu dois sete dias da nossa estadia, apesar das reclamações. O mesmo sucedeu com a marquise café. A piscina estava encerrada e não fomos informados antecipadamente.

Name: Great hotel. Centrally located.
Review Content: The Avani hotel is in the center of the city of Windhoek. This tourist and business hotel has it's entrance on the second floor of a shopping center. The area is busy but it also affords easy access to shops and convenience stores. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff is attentive and friendly. The breakfast buffet offers a variety of choices. For a backup, you can go to one of the coffee shops in the mall for a quick breakfast. Check-in and out was quick and efficient. The Wi-Fi signal was strong throughout the hotel.

Name: Great business hotel
Review Content: Excellent facilities and great location when doing business in Windhoek, very comfortable room and bed, good night's sleep assured, friendly staff, breakfast is very good but expensive, could increase daily wi-fi data allowance
Date: Date of stay: February 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice rooms!
Review Content: The rooms in this hotel are spacious and very comfortable. The bed is large and the matresses are firm and comfy. The air conditioning works very well. There is a big tv in the room and enough space to put all your stuff. In our room there were to chairs and a desk. The bathroom is spacious and there is a bath and a separate shower, a big sink and nice toiletries. There was a wide range of dishes to choose from at the breakfast buffet aswell as at the diner buffet. Staff is friendly and helpful. The only downside was the partly covered rooftop terrace and the very tiny swimming pool.
Date: Date of stay: November 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great location in middle downtown.
Review Content: Safe central location within a few blocks of everything in downtown Windhoek.  Would be good for both tourists and business guests.  Above indoor mall so convenient shopping, banking. Room was very comfortable.  Service was adequate, a little slow but friendly.  Small rooftop pool with disappointing views. Would recommend to start or end a trip to Namibia, but also look at brand new Hilton just a block away.
Date: Date of stay: November 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Stayed in 4 Guesthouses in city previously, should of come to this hotel first. Very Good.
Review Content: I have stayed in many hotels around the world and I must say that the Kalahari Sands, Windhoek, Namibia has been one of the best experiences for me.They have some great staff, friendly, helpful and professional and has done a fantastic job in meeting my requirements for my short 6 nights stay in total.There were no problems with my stay, apart from the leak in the shower in room 915, which one of the staff fixed, not having access to an iron/iron board and a few very minor maintenance issues in the bathroom (mainly items lose, etc) It was also unfortunate not to be given a twin room on the 2nd weeks stay, as requested, but this didn't matter massively. The food was fine, but scrambled eggs one morning were cold, no other issues in that department.Internet worked ok and so did aircon and TV, etc.Thank you very much for your time and for making our stay comfortable. I had an evening flight on the last day, so my transport was not due until about 18:30. I asked  staff for a late check out and they sorted that out for me. Again, Etienne Coetzee exceeded my expectations, a very helpful staff member.
Date: Date of stay: June 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Worked for me
Review Content: It is a business hotel, well placed close to town square. Hotel room was big enough and felt very comfortable. Clean linens, nice and spacious bathroom, comfortable bed are nice features I noted. Morning breakfast spread was reasonably good with sufficient choices. My workspace was nearby and that helped a lot. Never tried the Casino though. Room service seems bit slow but I will give benefit of doubts as football world cup was going on. For business travelers, this hotel will pretty good.
Date: Date of stay: July 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: gutes Innenstadthotel
Review Content: Ich wähle das Kalahari Sands immer am Beginn einer Namibiarundreise, weil es nach der Renovierung über sehr schöne Zimmer verfügt, genügend Geschäfte in unmittelbarer Nähe vorhanden sind, in denen man sich mit allem Notwendigen vor der Reise eindecken kann. Das Personal ist sehr bemüht, das abendliche Buffet für mich das beste in Windhoek zu einem erschwinglichen Preis.
Date: Date of stay: February 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Ordentliches Hotel für Kurzaufenthalt in Windhoek
Review Content: Sehr zentral und gut zu erreichen, da Eingang von Einkaufszentrum aus zu erreichen.Service und Zimmer gut, als Business-Hotel oder für Kurzaufenthalt eine gute Adresse. Pool auf dem Dach unspektakulär, aber sauber, wie das gesamte Interieur.Gibt sicher schönere Hotels, zweckdienlich ist es aber in jedem Fall!
Date: Date of stay: October 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: 朝食は良い
Review Content: 水２本無料、WIFIは有料、スリッパはなし、タオルはツインで大１、中１、小１のみ。普通の平均的シティホテル。レストランはわりとおいしく、朝食は普通のところより種類もあり良いと思う。マイナス点は部屋のバスルームの換気扇の音がうるさいことで、それ以外は特に何も気になることはなかった。
Date: Date of stay: September 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Super Stadthotel mitten im Zentrum
Review Content: Das Kalahari Sands Hotel hat uns angenehm überrascht. Die Zimmer sind 1a renoviert, sehr komfortabel, schönes Badezimmer mit Wanne und Dusche. Betten neu und mit tollem Schlafkomfort. Auch das Restaurant, die Lounge, Bar etc. sind sehr nett eingerichtet. Manfühlt sich dort wirklich wohl. Zudem ist man mitten im Zentraum, kann von dort aus shoppen gehen, Restaurants sind ebenfalls in unmittelbarer Nähe sowie die Christuskirche, Tintenpalastund Unabhängigkeitsdenkmal sind fussläufig in wenigen Minuten zu erreichen. Das Hotel bietetalles was zu einem Stadtbesuch nötig ist. Das Frühstück war umfangreich mit allem was dasHerz begehrt. Die Qualität des Essens war sehr gut .Also hier gibt es nichts zu meckern.Kann uneingeschränkt weiter empfohlen werden.
Date: Date of stay: December 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Ganz ok
Review Content: Die Zimmer sind wie weltweit in allen Luxushotels, sauber,mit allem nötigen und unnötigen ausgestattet, geräumig und unpersönlich.Die Lage ist top. Im Zentrum von Windhoek in einem Einkaufszentrum mit kostenlosem parken in der Tiefgarage. Sehr zu empfehlen ist das köstliche, reichhaltige Frühstücksbuffett. Insgesamt ganz nett wenn man es nicht zu persönlich mag.
Date: Date of stay: July 2009This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: dishonesty
Review Content: When we arrived at the Inn on September 21, my suitcase had been smashed and delivered as such to the room.  This suitcase was intact before leaving the airport.Our agent made a report that went unanswered.  On October 9, we returned to this Pension before leaving the country.  We met, after several hours of waiting, the ""manager"" who told us a story to sleep standing.  He told us that they had a video of the luggage and that my suitcase was on top of the carrier and that there was no way that it was damaged by the baggage handlers.How could he say that because he did not know my suitcase and had never seen it?  He also said he couldn't show me the video, which is forbidden by Inn rules.  He mistook us for stupid people and tried to deceive us by refusing to compensate me for the damage caused.This man has been dishonest with us and lied to us. This is shameful for a company that wants to inspire trust in customers.
Date: Date of stay: October 2024This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Review Content: The location is very central and all in walking distance.  Entering your reception area, you will always find g smile and a welcome that already makes you feel good and important.  The service  from housekeeping, room service, front desk, you name it, are excellent.Temperature in the room are always so nice when you are coming from a very hot, warm town, and just take a 'lekke" shower and relax in front of tv with cold soda. Name: Avani Hotel - Windhoek
Review Content: Hotel staff are friendly. Food is superb and good variety. Rooms are immaculate, bath room spotless. Excellent hotel which is centrally located in Windhoek. Hotel has wifi and a reasonable selection of TV channels.
Date: Date of stay: December 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Did the Job For One Night Visit
Review Content: While there is nothing outstanding about this property, it is centrally located in Windhoek and the rooms are comfortable and clean. The staff was friendly and our room was ready immediately. The breakfast was more than adequate. Good for a short stay.
Date: Date of stay: November 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: My stay at AVANI Windhoek
Review Content: I had the privilege of staying at this hotel in October and firstly, the hotel is centrally located. Right in the city centre (Independence street) and all amenities including restaurants, fast foods and shopping centers are a walking distance. With visible security guards patrolling the town, one can’t help but feel safe. Their rooms are huge and with some fine furnishings too. Reliable WiFi and auto lights with a one-touch switch.
Date: Date of stay: October 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice Downtown location
Review Content: This hotel is in the middle of downtown Windhoek and close to everything.  We stayed in August 2018 and they are in the middle of a renovation which wasn't much of a problem but there was only one working elevator.  Rooms are comfortable and quiet.  Located next to the downtown shopping mall.  In the mall there is a grocery/liquor store in the basement so you can shop for snacks/drinks there.  Excellent buffet dinner dining - pick what you want and they will cook it for you - good seafood/game/roasts.If you think of buying alcohol be aware that all stores in Namibia stop selling it at 1pm Saturday and none is sold on Sunday.  You can still get a drink in a restaurant or bar.
Date: Date of stay: August 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A perfectly solid business hotel in the centre of town
Review Content: We stayed here for three days at the invitation of Air Namibia and had a perfectly fine stay. The room was modern and everything worked well, the beds were comfortable and we slept well. On the other hand, there are currently substantial building works going on, so the lifts work really poorly (but the stairs are great) and there is a loud drilling noise most of the day (but it did stop after 6pm). Also amenities I would expect to find in this kind of hotel were missing : a pool and a gym. We had good meals at the two restaurants (buffet breakfasts and dinners and à la carte lunches), which offered a lot of choice and, at dinner, the different stations allowed to choose how to cook your meat, etc. Parking was simple and free.
Date: Date of stay: June 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Comfortable stay despite renovations
Review Content: The Avani is undergoing renovations and it's already starting to look more stylish. There's a new entrance on the main road, so no need to walk through the mall, up the escalators to find the entranceWith renovations come some inconvenience and with only one lift, ensure you have sufficient time to wait for it if you can't take the stairs as an alternative.Breakfast and dinner are buffet style at the main restaurant or choose something to eat at the Pantry, the smallish space to eat in the reception area.Rooms are spacious and comfortable with coffee making facilities and a small fridge. Free wifi is included and dependable.I stayed on the 7th floor with a lovely view of the city. Walking distance from the Avani is the namibian craft centre and a couple of coffee shopsAll in all a comfortable hotel in Windhoek
Date: Date of stay: May 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Centralissimo in restyling
Review Content: Hotel moderno e centralissimo, che piano piano si sta rinnovando. Staff gentilissimo. Camere grandi, comode e pulite. All'interno dell'hotel c'è anche un casino e nello stesso complesso c'è anche un centro commerciale. Buono il ristorante e ottima la colazione.Posizione comodissima per girarsi Windhoek a piedi. Buona la connessione wi-fi.
Date: Date of stay: January 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Location, Location, Location
Review Content: This is possibly the best hotel to stay at to explore the beautiful city of Windhoek.  With great tourist attractions within walking distance from hotel including the Christchurch and Memorial.  We visited during their renovations, which took nothing away from the charm, the beauty and the service.  Their staff is possibly their biggest asset.  We had drinks at the bar, not a lot of cocktails on the menu.  For better views i suggest booking on levels higher than 4th Floor.  Their entrance is not visible so you might end up driving around the building a few times before knowing where to enter the underground parking.  The nice thing is that you can walk the main road with cute restaurants, shopping opportunities right there.  The hotel is smack bang in the middle of a shopping centre, which is very busy and not very interesting, ATM right at the front door.  The swimming pool are deserted most of the time.  Breakfasts are an awesome spread with different things most days.  I would stay again in a heartbeat.
Date: Date of stay: September 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel review
Review Content: Excellent service, I have enjoyed my stay. Keep up the good work. The service I have received from reception, security, parking, restaurant and in the room was superb. However there is a need to repair the lifts.
Date: Date of stay: October 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: THEY THINK THERE GUESTS ARE IDIOTS
Review Content: The hotel is going through renovations, only one lift works, it could take you 20 minutes to get to your room from the lobby, so don't be in a hurry to go anywhere. When I arrived back at the hotel on Friday at around 16h00 there was a banging sound as if somebody was making a hole in the wall above me, eventually at 20h30 i called the front desk, Gabriel tried to help but was unsuccessful, asked to talk to the Duty Manager who eventually called me at 23h50. The duty manager assured me he would talk to the contractors who were still inside the hotel at 11h50, yes at 11h50 on a Friday night the contractors are still on site. The banging finally stopped on Saturday morning at 06H30. On Saturday i went tot the front desk to report this, all the staff had knowledge of the incident, promised it won't happen again, BUT Yes you guessed it on Saturday at about 11h00 is started all over again, called front desk and eventually asked for the duty manager to come and talk to me. Afternoon duty manager came to talk to me and basically told me that it is too bad, the contractors have a job to do so STUFF YOU GUEST!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. Eventually on Saturday evening the banging stopped at about 10h00, but not for long. At 05h30 on Sunday morning it started again, I tried to call the front desk no answer. The hotel staff think its "guests" are IDIOTS and that they can spin you a story and you had better accept their side of the story. I am alarmed that they hotel can allow contractors to work all night in the hotel, is this not a security risk as well? DO NOT STAY HERE FOR BUSINESS AS YOU WILL NOT GET A GOOD NIGHTS SLEEP AND THE MANAGEMENT OF THE HOTEL THINK THEY CAN TELL YOU ANY STORY AND YOU HAD BETTER UNDERSTAND THAT THEY HAVE A RENOVATION TO DO TAKE IT OR LEAVE IT
Date: Date of stay: October 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

The rooms were reasonable and clean. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Review Content: The hotel is in close proximity of everything that I needed. The decor is very nice and I cannot wait to see the hotel when all the renovations are done. The staff is very friendly and it is always a joy to stay at the hotel.

Review Content: Situé au cœur de la ville de Windhoek. Chambre avec grand lit,  très propre. Salle de bain avec grande douche d'angle. Petit déjeuner très copieux. Au dîner, possibilité de choisir de la nourriture et de se la faire cuire à la plancha (bonne nourriture, grand choix). Wifi gratuit dans les chambres. Personnel gracieux.

Name: At The Heart of Windhoek Keeping the Kalahari Tradition
Review Content: After more then 20 years the rooms keep the same good quality, spacious and comfortable.The food was good, breakfast buffet has large variety of products. Lunch and dinner buffets are also of good quality.Wi-Fi is very good allover the places.Staff is very nice and friendly.Location just in Windhoek center.
