Name: Decline since my last stay
Review Content: I stayed at the Avani in March this year and was back this week. Get a sense things are slipping.....desk staff are great but my room was a bit stuffy, did not feel fresh. Food was ok, just buffet in restaurant and not great. Anothr change is that wifi is only free on the first day, this has changed since mh last stay.
Date: Date of stay: October 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent stay in Namibia!!!!!!!!
Review Content: I've stayed at the Avani Windhoek hotel in Mid September, when I and my husband arrived, there was no potter on duty. A lady at reception with short hair checked us in. After we've checked in she insisted she helps us with the luggage since there was nobody to help even thou they looked quiet heavy on her, when we got to the room it was not yet done but she called one of the room attendants she found on the floor and took sheets from her and she prepared the room for us while she's telling us abit about Namibia since its our first time, for a while I was confused of what she is whether she is a room attendant, female porter, receptionist or I really don't know because she practically did  everything  at that time.Thank you so much Tutateni for making our stay worth while, we will surely recommend the hotel
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Durchschnitt
Review Content: Check-In lief etwas umständlich, weil zuerst meine Reservierung nicht gefunden wurde. Im Verlauf des Aufenthalts waren die Angestellten jedoch sehr freundlich und auch der Hotelmanager hilfsbereit. Zimmer sauber und Essen ok
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Quiet Clean and Comfortable
Review Content: From the outside this property does not look like much.The check in inefficiency and car parking voucher process are something from two decades back, but once you are through the hustle and bustle of reception and into a room it is very clean, comfortable and spacious.Staff are lovely, happy and polite.In fact, its once of the quietest hotels I have stayed at in terms of guest noise in the corridors, unlike other Namibian hotels I have reviewed.Breakfast was a less than happy experience, you sign your bill, gain access to the restaurant, but I could not eat as there no available tables.In todays world, I image a hotelier has to provide 3 basic things. Clean Linen, Running hot water and a decent Internet connection.Avani Windhoek has the most disgraceful Internet connection I have ever had in a hotel.As functional as this hotel was for me, (besides breakfast) I would never be able to return for this one reason alone.There is no point paying for a hotel, that has made business mobility such a frustration.Besides face to face meetings in town, you would need to go else where to send a follow on email.Its a shame. I would recommend this hotel, unless you need to be connected, and have no rush in the mornings.
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice centrally located hotel
Review Content: Good size room. Bathroom with shower and bath top, nice amenities and good hairdryer. Good hard mattress. Breakfast buffet super with cook to prepare eggs and pancakes. Located in shopping mall with supermarked and nice café. Staff helpful. Wifi good. Pool on roof very small and hardly any sun.
Date: Date of stay: June 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: nice place but some problem
Review Content: its 4stars hotel and the infrastructure is definitely good,and people here are friend.but the rate of the accommodation changes every day.it can rate 900rmb on monday,but 500 rmb on weekend.food here are not bad.overall its Good.这边还不错，就是房价一天一个样，最贵周一900多，周末只要500多，在一个购物广场的大楼里面，吃的一般般，房间还可以，很多中国人来这间，在市中心，纳米比亚治安还行，晚上有人巡逻。
Date: Date of stay: June 2016This review is the subjective opinion of an individual traveler and not of Tripadvisor LLC nor of its partners. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Situation ideale
Review Content: Dans un centre commercial, à deux pas de tout ce qu'on cherche dans le centre ville, cet hôtel est  très confortable.Le buffet offre un choix intéressant, nous y avons goûté huîtres et langouste et divers seafoods.Le buffet du matin est moins bien organisé  mais on trouve ce qu il nous faut .
Date: Date of stay: April 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Besser als gedacht.
Review Content: Ich bekam ein tolles Zimmer im 11. Stock. King Bett, großes, gepflegtes Bad. Schöne, kleine Karte an der Casino Bar, gutes Essen zum kleinen Preis. Reichhaltiges Frühstück, für jeden was dabei. Freundliches Personal.
Date: Date of stay: March 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A week long visit to Namibia
Review Content: It was second time at this hotel.Location of the hotel is too good about 2-3 Km from city center but has many tourist attractions at walking distance. The hotel building itself has a shopping mall and checker's supermarket. Only problem is that it closes at 5.30 pm.You will also get too many currency conversion counter withing the building.The rooms are excellent. and staff is very cooperative. It also has casino and a very good bar...a swimming pool on roof top is too small to swim but the view city's from their after sunset is amazing.The hotel offers complementary access gym and sauna though you need to walk the adjacent building  for it.Bit disappointed with the food option as the break-fast options did not change at  all during 6 days of stay.Staff was generous enough to allow me two hours  late check-out.
Date: Date of stay: October 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice hotel with superb food
Review Content: My wife and I stayed here on 2 occasions in October. The hotel is well appointed and the rooms have all the amenities one might expect in a high class hotel. We were lucky to be staying on a Friday night when the restaurant provides a superb seafood buffet.The casino is an added bonus as a short visit on our last night provided funds that nearly covered the holiday!The only downside is that the entrance to the hotel is on the first floor of a shopping mall and if you have heavy luggage this can be problematic. However, the staff are extremely helpful.
Date: Date of stay: October 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Review Content: Ullrich Angersbach: Dort genießt man nicht nur westlichen Standard sondern hat einen kurzen Fußweg zu den Hauptsehenswürdigkeiten von Windhoek. Hat man einen Mietwagen, kann man ihm im Parkhaus des Hotels bewacht parken (4.Stock).

Name: ウィントフック町中のカジノ付きホテル
Review Content: ホテルに到着後、チェックイン前にホテルのレストランで食事をしていたらホテルのスタッフが血相を変えてレストランに入り、「宿泊予定の部屋がプールの水が浸水して水浸しになったので他所のホテルを紹介するので、そちらへ行って欲しいとの事」レストランのディナーは無料でどうぞとの事だったけど納得がいかなかった。食事を好きな食材をシェフが目の前で調理してくれたので美味しかったけど、荷物を持って、また別のホテルへ移動するのは辛かったです。

Review Content: Great breakfast. Rooms are a very good size, bright and spotless. Staff very helpful; good security to the rooms. Very good conference facilities. Close to everything you can need including ATM and foreign exchange bureau. Has no street front which is a bit of a disadvantage.

Review Content: Located in the centre of Windhoek, large hotel very busy in a shopping centre. Room was clean and tidy. breakfast was average with nothing special or exceptional. Not sure why the hotel can not offer free Wi Fi to guests?

Name: Ottima base di partenza
Review Content: Ho soggiornato presso l'hotel ad inizio e fine viaggio. Ottima collocazione, praticamente scendete in strada e vi trovate nel centro di Windhoek, camere grandi e abbastanza pulite, confortevoli, con TV e condizionatore, bagno con acqua calda, phon e tutto ciò che può servire. Colazione provvista di ogni cosa, la migliore che abbia fatto in Namibia. Wifi a pagamento in stanza.
Date: Date of stay: May 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: windhoek
Review Content: Muito bem situado,mesmo no centro da cidade.Agradável e muito confortável com quartos espaçosos e bons quartos de banhoBons pequenos almoços,variados e bem confecionados.Empregados simpáticos e atenciosos..
Date: Date of stay: July 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice hotel that is centrally situated.
Review Content: My wife and I arrived at the hotel with a shuttle service that had been arranged by the hotel. We were collected at their international airport that is more than 40km outside Windhoek.Upon our arrival at reception we were greeted in a friendly and polite manner, and offered a cool refreshing welcome beverage. The hotel porter took over the luggage from the shuttle driver, and we were also assisted with the luggage to our room. The room was found to be neat and clean with comfortable beds and also provided a nice view of the city. We enjoyed breakfast and dinner at the Dunes restaurant where the food quality was found to be of a high standard.We noticed that the hotel which is situated inside the Gustav Voight Shopping Centre, had undergone a major multi-million dollar refurbishment since our first visit in 2009.We also visited the Oasis Bar and Lounge where we enjoyed some cocktail drinks and experienced the service as good and efficient.We spent some time at the Kalahari Sands Rooftop Swimming Pool but found it difficult in obtaining someone to provide us with drinks there. My wife also spent some time in the spa where she was very satisfied with the treatment received.Like all other Sun International Casino’s, the hotel casino was found to be well and efficiently run.We experienced this as a nice hotel with friendly staff, although the service was a bit slow at times. We would definitely visit it again in the future and recommend it to friends.
Date: Date of stay: November 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel di città
Review Content: Siamo nella capitale, quindi un hotel come tanti, molto bello, lussuoso e accogliente. Certo non è un lodge in mezzo alla savana, ma in città è una soluzione a dir poco fantastica. Siete in centro, quindi potete uscire tranquillamente a fare shopping, anche se siete già all'interno di un centro commerciale con bar, ristoranti ecc.ecc. Ci ritornerei
Date: Date of stay: November 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A good city hotel
Review Content: A great location if you go to Windhoek . The room service fillet steak was excellent and at US$ 10 including tray charge what a bargain. It was basic but clean & comfortable.
Date: Date of stay: June 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: I liked it!
Review Content: Good location in the city. Nice modern & comfortable room. I like the atmosphere. I will definitely stay there again. Was a bit nervous coming to Windhoek for the 1st time without prior accomodation arrangements but the front desk staff made it easy for me.Thanks guys!
Date: Date of stay: June 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Experiences from my 4th stay
Review Content: This was my fourth stay at Kalahari Sands in two years. The location is of course still the best in town, everything is close. The hotel is located in a shopping center with a supermarket in the basement (where you can get snacks and drinks).A Hilton is being built close by and it will surely be a tough competitor for the Kalahari Sands Hotel. Surely Hilton will be more expensive (I have always found good prices for KS) but also the quality will surely be better.New things at the hotel:FINALLY they have finalised the udgrading of the elevators and now they work like anywhere. So this problem is in the past.Slow Internet is no more a problem, this has been updated also.Noise from refurbishment work continues to be a problem (from 7 or 8 a.m. to afternoon). So the sounds of drilling may be a problem if you want to work or rest in your room during the day. No noise during the night from the work.Pool area: one day the pool area was closed and I asked about it. They said it was dirty and had to have maintanance work. I said I knew it is dirty because I saw it but only wanted to go to the sundeck to sit for a while. They never got back to me about this.Breakfast is always great here, although the waiters are very slow in bringing coffee and tea.Dinner buffet is good. Room service menu remains the same, with limited choice.Bathroom toiletries had been updated since last year. Now they offered everything you can wish also in the standard rooms.Until the Hilton opens, KS is definitely the choice if you prefer great location. Country Club Hotel  is superior to KS but the location is - well - the location of a country club.
Date: Date of stay: August 2010This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great location
Review Content: During the past year I have stayed several times at Kalahari Sands hotel and keep returning. This is mostly due to the great location. The hotel is very centrally located for all sightseeing and business in Windhoek. Shops and museums are close. The hotel is located in a shopping center and there is a supermarket (e.g. for drinks and snacks) in the basement. Taxi-rank is on the opposite side of the road.All in all the hotel is okay and it is good value for your money. The hotel is in some need of refurbishment (some carpets are worn-out etc). Rooms are okay. Standard rooms are rather small but executive rooms are nice.Some refurbishment is going on in the rooms. If you want quietness during the day, ask for a room that has no work going on near-by (this is from 8 am till 5 pm). I had to change rooms because I did some work in my room and could not listen to the hammering.Excellent breakfast buffet. Room service available, although choice is rather limited. Dinner is served only as buffet and it's okay.There is a roof-top pool (cold water).The worst part of the hotel is its elevators. They say they are upgrading them but this was already said in August 2008 (my first visit) and no progress is happening. So be prepared to wait.
Date: Date of stay: August 2009This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Convenient Location
Review Content: Nice Breakfast. Clean and Comfortable Room. Lifts terrible takes ages to go up and down.

Will definitely stay at the Hilton instead next time.

Throughout the meal, he demonstrated impeccable timing, ensuring our drinks were topped up and that each course arrived promptly. Jemery’s professionalism and hospitality reflect highly on your establishment. He is undoubtedly an asset to your team, and I look forward to returning soon, knowing that such excellent service awaits.

Name: arrogant and rude staff spoil an otherwise nice hotel
Review Content: We stayed for one night on the 30th Sept 2013. The hotel is built with a shopping center around it and is actually quite a nice building. Rooms are ok and facilities are fine. Sadly our experience of staying was spoilt by the following. No room safe, having to wait hours to check in due to being fully booked the night before, no mini bar and the staff are all and I mean 99% except one polite lady on the bar are rude and miserable. No one smiles or says hello. No conversations...nothing! Also at 10.15pm while I was asleep a member of staff let themselves into our room. Luckily my fiancee was awake and told the lady we were fine and to get out. No explanation for being there or anything. We complained on check out and were to en the same looks of disgust and arrogance ascheck in. I very much doubt aanything will be done despite me writing down all out grievances...plus we were asked did we take anything from the mini bar after all this so they clearly don't listen either. Shocking service ruins an ok hotel. Avoid at all costs and pay alittle extra for the Hilton.
Date: Date of stay: September 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Ingresso nascosto
Review Content: L'ingresso dell'hotel è al'interno del centro commerciale e se non si sa questo rende molto difficile trovarlo. Il parcheggio non permette l'accesso ai van causa l'altezza del soffitto. Le stanze sono belle e curate e più che discreta è la colazione. Per il wifi (il migliore trovato negli hotel e resort in Namibia) vi verrà dato un voucher gratuitamente. Meglio richiederne uno per apparecchio e non per stanza. Per una notte va più che bene.
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Staff could do with more smiles
Review Content: Good location. Beginning to look a bit jaded now but room cleaned well. Staff could do with more smiles & eagerness to help guests, rather than behaving officious. Hey, it is a hospitality business. Maybe they can learn from 'Madaline' at front desk or Ms Shane in the restaurant. Also, can management please vary the breakfast and dinner menus? Wifi was slow. For a nice sundowner drink, pop across to Hilton's skybar.
Date: Date of stay: March 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Verblassende "Sterne"
Review Content: Juni 2012 ,da wir schon mehrmals in diesem Hotel mit seiner tollen Lage im Centrum übernachtet haben waren wir doch etwas enttäuscht. Nach der Renovierung stehen in den Zimmern nur noch ein Stuhl zur Verfügung, einer muss auf die recht guten Betten ausweichen. Da im Zimmer keinerlei Informationen über das Hotel und deren Einrichtung  zur Verfügung standen, haben wir auch  die Bedienung der neuen Lichtanlage erst später verstanden. Der Fernseher war defekt und wurde erst am nächsten  Abend repariert, brauchten wir nicht mehr. Insgesamt ließ die Sauberkeit der Toiletten und der Teppichböden sehr zu wünschen übrig. Die Büffets konnten mit dem Standart der früheren Jahre nicht mehr mithalten und jeden Abend gab es größere Gesellschaften so dass ein frühes Dinner von Vorteil war. Noch einmal würden wir hier nicht übernachten, da es in unmittelbarer Nähe Alternativen gibt.
Date: Date of stay: June 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Shocking
Review Content: I am currently staying at this hotel (thankfully I am checking out today).  I find it hard to believe it that they can charge this much money for such a substandard hotel.I have had some good service but unfortunately it would have to be much better to make up for this mess.  They did upgrade me to suite but it's a far cry from any other hotel charging $250 a night.I asked for an iron to be sent to my room.  I was told that, for security purposes they did not send irons to the room but I was invited to fill out the laundry list.This place is a dump, the 'stool' for computer use is broken and collapsing, the bed is worn and there is a cheap, used blanket under a very tired cover.I chose this hotel because of the location and internet in room.  Once I checked in I was told the internet 'might or might not work'.  I have stayed at the Windhoek Country Club before and would highly recommend this.Stay away!!
Date: Date of stay: September 2009This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good, central business hotel
Review Content: Visited twice at each end of my trip to Namibia. Got an upgrade on the second visit. The hotel is a good business style hotel with a casino on the first floor - no noise problem from that. Rooms are comfortable and well appointed. Only used the restaurant for breakfast, which was excellent with an amazing selection of good quality options, even fresh oranges and a squeezer. The roof top bar was also a very nice place to be, with a lively atmosphere on Friday and Saturday nights. Great variety of drinks on offer, with barmen who know their stuff. Prices are low too, compared to Europe. View from the balcony is fantastic.Would stay again.
Date: Date of stay: October 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Frustrating Arrival
Review Content: Very nice hotel with excellent location and very comfortable facilities. Unfortunately the check in process was slow and difficult as the unloading process was difficult from the nearby garage building. There is an opportunity to enhance the service and match great facilities.
Date: Date of stay: August 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good Hotel
Review Content: Stayed only one night as on a tour, staff good, food was nice,and very reasonably priced. Bedroom was large had everything that you needed,comfortable beds, Bottled water in your fridge, plenty to eat at breakfast.
Date: Date of stay: November 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Praise wher praise is due.
Review Content: As my other reviews state we have developed the habit of calling here for lunch and last drop of Windhoek Beer at the end of our tours and waiting for our plane home.This time we had a a change of flight times so needed a night stop in order not to risk a drive in from the country. We naturally chose the Avani and the booking was done via our agent.A month out we were warned by friends that there was renovation taking place. Ho hum.So we worried if this was going to be disruptive. It was not.Our transport dropped us at the 'new' front entrance and a porter swiftly grabbed our luggage and took us to the front desk where check in was smoothly handled in a cheerful manner.We were then shown up to our room and all was as expected. Indeed it exceeded our expectations as it was fitted out as a business suite with Bluetooth, TV, Wiffy and a linked printer, plus telephone etc.,The room was very large and the bed comfortable. We had about 24 hours to kill, most of it nightime asleep of course, but the room never felt too small. Arranging a late check out to suit our taxi booking was no problem to the friendly ladies at the front desk. Lovely service.OK one lift was not functioning but we were never kept  waiting.Dinner was in the Dunes restaurant and apart from some confusion over a wine order it was very good. We had been joined by two friends who had just arrived in Namibia that afternoon and there was no problem over them dining with us.The meal was good value and nourishing in a quasi buffet style. Service was exemplary by friendly staff.Breakfast was much the same standard with an excellent choice of cereals, cold cuts and cooked versions. We got coffee brought to the table.We needed to buy a small item and not only did the staff know of a good outlet but the porter from yesterday insisted on accompanying me to the shop and waiting for me to be served. A very nice man who told me he had worked for this hotel 20 years and was on the brink of retiring home. He will be a great loss and we wish him well.We checked out of the room at 11 am and with still an hour or so to kill were made welcome in the lounge and bar with our modest luggage during which time one of the management team dropped by and explained the further plans for the Hotel's upgrade. Perhaps upgrade is the wrong word as it is very good already?So ended our first ever evening stopover in Windhoek itself but based on our experience it may not be the last. Heck they even had Lovebirds perch on my windowsill which, as a keen birder, was the icing on the cake..
Date: Date of stay: January 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hôtel agréable, bien situé.
Review Content: Chambre spacieuse,propre.Restaurant avec buffet varié, en particulier grillades de poissons et crustacés, un bémol sur l'orchestre et chanteuse trop bruyants.Le bar n'a malheureusement pas de cocktails à proposer, et le vin au verre est à éviter car éventé !!
Date: Date of stay: May 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Avani Hotel
Review Content: Very well located, on the Main Street of Windhoek. Room was good with a nice view of mountains, museum and church.Breakfast was good but very disappointed with the dinner, not recommended even if you are starving.Serving buffet, if you are late, better not taking your time there, also grilling inside the restaurant, smelling really bad and smoke around the restaurant.
Date: Date of stay: February 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: 立地も良く快適
Review Content: パッケージツアーで利用。メインストリートに面し、地下にはスーパーマーケットもあって、非常に便利な立地。室内にはバスタブもあり、お湯も問題なく出ました。朝食メニューも豊富で快適でした。
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Geht so
Review Content: Das Hotel ist mitten in der "Downtown" von Windhoek in einem Einkaufszentrum. Sehr praktisch, wenn man noch ein bisschen Souvenirs shoppen will (bitte beachten, die Geschäfte schliessen um 17:30). Die Zimmer sind gut und sauber, check-in problemlos, aber alles in allem etwas lieblos. Der Rooftop-Pool ist ebenso lieblos. Das Zimmersafe war kaputt, die Serviceleute haben 1h gebraucht um die Batterien zu wechseln. Es gibt keine Hotelinformationen im Zimmer, das Zimmertelefon ist nicht beschriftet. Wenn man mal herausgefunden hat, wie man die Rezeption anruft, erfährt man von dort, dass man auf ein Sandwich 30 Minuten warten muss. Das kostenlose WLAN geht ganz gut.
Date: Date of stay: October 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Mostly well, few annoyances, couple of disappointments
Review Content: Rooms are spacy, well equiped and well cleaned and maintained. Laundry is quick and well done, as is 24h room service. Sleep quality was excellent, no disturbances and quiet troughout. Buffet meals in the restaurant were more than adequate, wide choice of food and in good supply. Slow and defective lifts were a major annoyance, as is the internet WiFi the hotel offers at prices that are in no way justified by the poor quality of the connection, the cumbersome log on system and the intermittent availability.  Using Skype to log on to the same WiFi operator worked excellent, consistently and at high speeds, suggesting that the hardware is ok but the allocation of bandwith to paying users is too stingy. At the room rates charged, WiFi should be unlimited and complimentary.The roof pool is a major let down. It has the appeal of a dead bunny. It is on the top floor of the hotel but completely walled in and has no views at all. Its size and 1.25 m depth are such that the warning that no life guard is on duty can only be for compliance reasons.
Date: Date of stay: March 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Ottimo soggiorno
Review Content: Abbiamo soggiornato al Kalahari Sands per due notti a causa di un'emergenza (infatti non erano previste) e, prezzi a parte, un po' cari,  ci siamo trovati bene: la posizione centrale dell'hotel, che si trova all'interno di un mall dove si può trovare di tutto, la stanza molto ampia e pulita, la colazione buonissima e varia....le uniche due note a sfavore: la poca cordialità di un paio di receptionist e la connessione wifi a pagamento e carissima (1 giorno di connessione = 14 euro circa).
Date: Date of stay: August 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Paying for wifi today is pure madness
Review Content: I have stayed in a number of places in Windhoek, traveling regularly on business.First and foremost, I was astounded to find out that you need to pay for the wifi service!  it would also be helpful to be told this when you check in so there is no need to go back to reception for a voucher.Breakfast was poor and the service unacceptable, bar lunch was good but again service is distinctly lacking.  My waiter walked away as I was still ordering.  I was quite astounded.Room was fine and faced the city although my colleague complained about the noise of construction work noises from his room.  No room turndown in the evening.Parking was confusing so ask for a map to get into the parking area with your reservation.Many better places to stay in Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: February 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Stunning views and excellent rooftop bar
Review Content: I visited this hotel recently with friends who lives in Windhoek and a good time was had by all. It is recommended to visit the rooftop bar at sunset for the wonderful sunsets and vistas.This hotel is very popular with locals and foreigners alike and one hears many languages on the deck, German being the most spoken followed by English, italian and French. A must visit if you are in Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: April 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bon hôtel sans wi-fi gratuit
Review Content: Belle chambre, bon petit déj, buffet du diner très appétissant. Piano bar sympa: les bières locales sont à un prix raisonnable. Pas d'avis sur le casino. Côté soucis: les ascenseurs sont nombreux mais les étages encore plus, quelques minutes de perdu parfois. Dans la 602, lumière et ventilation s'allume toutes seules.Le wi-fi edt hors de prix par contre. L'offre TV est correcte, mais il manque des chaines non anglophones genre TV5/F24/RAI/DW/RTL.
Date: Date of stay: September 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: I couldn't have asked for more
Review Content: I happened to pop into this hotel, as I had not made a reservation anywhere in Windhoek.  When enquiring about the rates, the lady at reception asked if I was a pensionner.  When I replied that I was she informed me that special rates were then available - I answered that that was the first time age had worked in my favour!  And very reasonable rates they were.  She personally chose the room for me, on the 14th floor with a fabulous view of the city and the surrounding hills, service was excellent, and reception telephoned me every evening to ask if there was anything I wanted/needed.  The rooms were large and comfortable and the bathroom was also large - with a bath and a separate shower - and all was very clean.  As the hotel is right in the centre of town, it was the best - and in the end only - choice I could have made.  What really made it stand out for me were the ladies on reception and the Head of the cleaning staff at least on the 14th floor, who informed me that she wanted all her guests to feel special which is why she has been working at this hotel for 20 years.  And as far as I was concerned she succeeded.  Many thanks to you all ladies.
Date: Date of stay: November 2011This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Choose KS Hotel for CBD location only
Review Content: I had a three night stay at the KS hotel in Feb 2009. The lifts are still "under repair" so I was pleased to have a 4th floor room and could use the stairs. I was staying with a group who had a room block of ~10 rooms and the joke at dinner was: "What's wrong in your room?!" as many experienced a variety of issues, large and small. My room had a very leaky air conditioner, so the ice bucket and towel had to be on the desk for our entire stay. I would liken the room decor and condition to a US Holiday Inn circa early 90's - nothing flashy, plenty of room, generally clean, but worn.My service experience was much better -- the front desk was accommodating if you don't get a trainee helping you and the business center staff was top notch in personality and helpful knowledge. The wireless internet in the room was extremely slow / not working as the front desk had warned me when I checked in. It made most sense to hook up the laptop at the business center or use their internet terminals which functioned fine.Our group had dinner one night in the restaurant buffet -- the food was very good, but the table service was lacking.I would not choose KS again unless I absolutely needed to be in the CBD and walking distance to a meeting / office.
Date: Date of stay: February 2009This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Muy recomendable para una estancia corta.

Name: Great service

Name: sehr gut

Name: Average Hotel

We had to organise alternative transport.The front desk reception did not seem to be bothered about this no show.The room was ok with all the basics. Breakfast was also just average. They have a rooftop restaurant with amazing city views.A lot of improvement is needed for the hotel to reach 4 stars

Name: AWESOME
Review Content: I am very satisfied with the overall stay would love to visit the hotel again. Avani have well communicated staff and very friendly and kind. Keep up the great work that you guys an ladies are doing and good food.

Name: Avani : la meilleure adresse de Windhoek
Review Content: L' hôtel est très bien placé pour accéder facilement aux boutiques du centre-ville. Le personnel est très professionnel et accueillant. Les chambres sont spacieuses et propres. Le bar terrasse offre une très belle vue sur la ville.

Name: Nice
Review Content: Nice pleasant no complaint, we stayed as our flights were cancelled and we had a very nice rest with no problem or what whatever , we really enjoyed the unexpected weekend. And its so nicely located with shops around it
Date: Date of stay: February 2019This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Primeira vez em Windhoek - Namibia
Review Content: Hotel reformado apos nova direcao, melhorou muito, mas continua falho na qualidade dos servicos, desde camareira, manutencao dos aposentos, porem no conjunto merece destaque pelo bom gosto na decoracao, atendimento de algumas pessoas mais antigas que mantem a hospitalidade ja inexistente na equipe nova que aos poucos esta sendo complementada com os novos donos. Tem um restaurante bonito, porem se chegar com mais de uma hora do inicio do atendimento a reposicao do buffet é lamentavel. Tambem a qualidade do que é servido, existem muitas coisas industializadas e prontas o que faz entender a fraca cozinha. A te mesmo os pratos ou grelhados na chapa feitos na frente do cliente é fraco na qualidade e especialmente no preparo por falta de experiencia...por isso nao é muito frequentado, a maioria sao de hospedes que ainda nao conhecem, ou seja, nao retornam mais, entram pelo ambiente e apresentacao do buffet mas é so enganacao, o setor de saladas é praticamente inexistente, bem fraco, na variedade e qualidade. É uma pena para um hotel que esta tentando se revitalizar ...( o novo dono é um grupo Chines )
Date: Date of stay: November 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Très bel hôtel
Review Content: Situé en plein centre ville c'est 1 point de départ idéal pour les visites à pied, Les chambres modernes sont très spacieuses,équipées d'1refrigerateuret avec 1 agréable salle de bain Un casino se trouve au sous sol
Date: Date of stay: October 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel de negocios
Review Content: Céntrico y limpio, con habitaciones pulcras donde todo funcionaba bien. Una pena la rehabilitación de los ascensores que colapsaba el único que estaba operativo.Amplio baño y buffet de desayuno que cumple de sobra. Sin entrar en comparaciones imposibles con otros de la zona, nos gustó bastante.
Date: Date of stay: October 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Under Construction with LOTS of work to be done
Review Content: The hotel and shopping complex are undergoing major renovation and construction. We only stayed two of the three nights we booked because of the noise. While on the surface it looks like a very modern and stylish hotel, the underlying service and accommodations are very much sub-standard. for example, the elevator they told us to use looked brand new, but it must not have been programmed correctly because it would not stop at floor 3. Several times we had to hike from the 4th floor because it kept by-passing the stop. Also, just outside our room was a door marked "staff only." This door was kept closed all day long, but after 10PM, it was open and closed loudly several times. We complained after the first night, but the practice continued the second night which prompted us to find other accommodations. The front desk staff was curt, and the rest of the staff seemed either obtuse or apathetic. Certainly it was not what was advertised. The breakfast was a standard buffet, and dinner wasn't much more impressive. The location was pretty perfect for walking around the city center, and it felt much safer than other African cities. Overall, it is a serious stretch to call this a luxury accommodation. It might be fine for a business trip, but not a vacation or weekend away. Certainly not worth the price tag.
Date: Date of stay: August 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Baustelle
Review Content: Hotel ist eine riesige Baustelle. Lärm und Dreck überall. Aufzüge funktionieren nicht immer. Personal an Rezeption versuchte zu helfen. Koffer mussten in den elften Stock getragen werden. Parkdeck war nur über viele Treppen und Umwege zu erreichen.
Date: Date of stay: June 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Très bonne localisation
Review Content: En revenant d’un safari ou de km de pistes vous serez contents de trouver une chambre tout confort en ville. Chambre très spacieuse avec wifi performant. Sdb spacieuse également avec bain et douche. Il y a des travaux de rénovation et donc vous pouvez attendre 10 min le seul ascenseur en fonctionnement.Le buffet est correct.Cet hôtel est super bien situé et vous pourrez aller à pieds jusque l’église luthérienne, les jardins du parlement, le craft market et aurez toutes les boutiques, banques, cafés à portée de main. Le personnel est sympathique.
Date: Date of stay: May 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good hotel in centre of Windhoek
Review Content: Hotel is very conveniently situated in the heart of Windhoek. Rooms are good, but WiFi was extremely unreliable, which is not something you would expect from a premium hotel like this. The staff is very friendly and professional. They are currently renovating the hotel, and one of the lifts was making so much noise at all times of the night. Surely they could have fixed that. I would stay at the hotel again, but this time far away from the lifts.
Date: Date of stay: February 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Service decline
Review Content: During 2017 I have stayed more than 70 nights. I have experienced that prices have gone up, but service have gone down at Avani hotel. This can not entirely be blamed on the current upgrade of the hotel
Date: Date of stay: November 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: In centro
Review Content: Hotel moderno situato in posizione centrale.Le camere sono ampie e confortevoli egli ambienti puliti.Il Personale è  disponibile.La colazione servita è internazionale, abbondante e ottima.Sicuramente consigliato.

Name: Bel hôtel en plein centre - Confortable
Review Content: Très bel hôtel avec casino et grand restaurant dans centre-commercial - 2 grands lit, clim, grande télé, grande SDB (seul bémol 1 seul ascenseur fonctionnait on a utilisé les escaliers sinon c'est l'horreur...) - Beau buffet du soir
Date: Date of stay: October 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: un hotel excelente
Review Content: Un hotel excelente. Lástima que sólo pudiésemos disfrutarlo durmiendo unas pocas horas, pues la habitación eran muy amplia, cómoda y lujosa. La entrada está dentro de una especie de galerías comerciales, pero después el hotel te sorprende.
Date: Date of stay: August 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Buona scelta
Review Content: Albergo sito in centro città al primo piano di un centro commerciale. Proprio vicino all'entrata del hotel c'è anche una banca dove si possono cambiare i soldi prima di iniziare il proprio tour in giro per la Namibia. La camera è molto bella, ampia e pulita. La colazione è ottima e ricchissima
Date: Date of stay: August 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very very dissapointed at level of ownership of service
Review Content: I was there for 3 night end June with friends. We had 3 rooms, 2 of which checked out a day earlier. On checking oit we left a box of things to be sent up to my room at the reception which was never delivered. Called thrice at night when I got back to the hotel and they kept saying they are checking to the point they tired me out....HAd an early morning flight so had to leave without the box. It was a very well orchestrated theft of the box and no one took ownership. I even sent an email to the hotel on their email addressed to the CEO of the Hotel, but no response there either. I would not suggest this hotel to anyone. Can you imagine that the staff had warned me to be careful of theft on the streets which I felt were very safe and the people very friendly, but theft happened in the hotel itself..... Wow !Also I booked a transfer to the Airport 2 days in advance, confirmed the same the night before and when I came down to leave for the airport the receptionist had no idea what I was talking about. How unprofessional can one get, that too at a so called star property...
Date: Date of stay: June 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: "Staying at the Avani Hotel"
Review Content: The hotel is very centrally located. I received a very warm welcome from the front desk staff. The rooms were spacious and clean. Although it was quite busy as there were a number of groups checking in and out, the hotel was pleasantly very quiet. Wifi was complimentary and reasonably fast. The first night we were there, there was a chocolate on the bed but not for the remainder of our stay (we stayed there for four nights). The waiters were very friendly. Also enjoyed the spa services. Visited the casino one evening, the person at the front desk in the casino needs an extra pair of hands on Friday and Saturday night as the place was very busy. My only gripe was that the hotel does not offer a shuttle service from the airport as is the custom with Avani Gaborone.
Date: Date of stay: May 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Inefficient and unprofessional
Review Content: Unfortunately the hotel felt unorganised and overwhelmed. I understand that it is a busy time of year for them, but we couldn't eat dinner in the restaurant because they were full, so the only option was to get room service. It took me almost an hour to place an order for room service. Then the person who was responsible for room service could hardly speak English. Really poor service considering it costs so much per night.
Date: Date of stay: May 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel in a Mall
Review Content: The location is very central and there's plenty of restaurants and shops within walking distance but it's very odd having to go into a mall to enter the hotel. It gives it a very corporate feel. There is also construction going on next door and I asked whilst checking in if I should prepare myself for noise, they said there wouldn't be any. Low and behold the construction site came alive in the morning just below our window. We stayed there twice and when we returned the second time they didn't have our reservation.  Luckily we had a printed copy so they made an effort to find us a room despite being full.  They did give us a room and honored the price but the checkin took quite a bit of time.  However, since the rooms are very modern and comfortable, the breakfast is very good and the staff was helpful, I give it an above average rating.
Date: Date of stay: March 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Bien ubicado
Review Content: Ubicado en la calle principal,habitaciones de buen porte y limpias, bien atendido, desayuno con una amplia variedad; wi fi gratis que se agradece; también cafetera  y agua mineral de atención.Cerca de centros comerciales, supermecados, lugares de interés y casas de cambioTodo caminando.
Date: Date of stay: February 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Gret Start of 2017!!!!!!!!!!
Review Content: Travelled to Namibia for a business meeting and I styed three nights at Avani hotels.Restaurant-Food Is ok but slow service, I ordered coffee, the gentlemen stood shouting st the waiters9bad impression)Rooms-PerfectCheck in/out- was super, the hilia checked us in, it was great another lasy served us juice  so it was really friendly except for the Wi Fi that is quiet slow for a business person.Elevators need attention....
Date: Date of stay: January 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: così così
Review Content: Questo hotel non mi ha entusiasmata molto, la struttura è un po' vecchia con l'ingresso che affaccia su un piccolo centro commerciale. Le camere non sono bellissime ma funzionali. La posizione è centralissima e il personale è davvero cordiale, secondo me sono i due punti di forza dell'hotel.
Date: Date of stay: October 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Etape dans la capital.
Review Content: Cet hôtel est très correcte. Pas très glamour, car en plein centre commercial. Mais près de tout à pied. Pas mal pour effectuer les achats souvenir avant de rentrer.Les chambres sont grandes, propres et jolies. Mieux vaut être assez haut dans les étages, car au 2ème étage, nous avions la vue sur les clims d'un moche bâtiment bleu. Le restaurant est très bon.Sur le toit, une petite piscine avec un petit coin et jolie vue sur la capital.
Date: Date of stay: October 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great experience!
Review Content: The overall service was excellent but the food was expensive. However I enjoyed the excellent service provided by the front desk, room service, housekeeping and the entertainment. Unfortunately for me I was working throughout so I did not have the opportunity explore more facilities.
Date: Date of stay: October 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good hotel in convenient location
Review Content: Perfect for short stay in Windhoek and is a short walk from all sights. Good rooms and bathrooms.  Staff are very helpful. I had a great nights sleep. Breakfast buffet could be improved and the fresh fruit selection did not look amazing. Best part of breakfast was the made to order eggs (anyway you want it). I would stay here again.
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A good hotel centrally situated in WIndhoek, within walking distance of all the main areas in the city
Review Content: The Avani Hotel is well run and  offers all amenities to both the business traveller or the tourist in Windhoek.Centrally located in a small shopping complex, with other shops and restaurants all within close walking distance.The hotel restaurant is nice with buffet service for both breakfast and dinner.There is a small pub area that also serves simple but good meals from an al a carte menu.
Date: Date of stay: September 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: mi sono trovato benissimo
Review Content: sono stato in questa struttura la prima notte e l'ultima del mio tour della Namibia.Albergo moderno, le stanze molto spaziose, curate, molto ordinate e pulitissime.Disponibile gratis il wifi nelle stanze e aree comuni con ottima velocita' di connessione.La colazione ottimamente fornita, presente tutto cio' che uno puo' desiderare.Il personale sempre gentile e cortese, e' presente il parcheggio (che poi e' al 4° piano del silos adiacente), per i clienti dell'Avani e' ovviamente gratuito.
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: 特に問題はない
Review Content: ホテルです。お湯もバスタブになみなみとたまりました。中国資本になり、名前が変わっています。街中なので、散策にも便利ですが、町自体にそれほどの魅力があるわけではありません。土曜日の午前、ぶらぶらしたのですが、ショッピングセンター以外はお休み状態でした。
Date: Date of stay: June 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Gutes Stadthotel
Review Content: Zentral gelegen, Zimmer und Bad sauber, Ausblick auf Fabrik nicht gerade super. Trotz 4 Fahrstühlen wartet man mal 5 Minuten. Personal ein wenig langsam, 2 Stunden um einen Koffer zu erhalten, den anderen hatten sie an der Rezeption vergessen. Nettes kleines Kasino, Bar beschrängte Getränkeliste und ziemlich langsam, Wifi gratis. Frühstück ganz ok. Hatten dort eine Uebernachtung als Start für die Besichtigung Namibias. War eben befriedigend, nicht mehr.
Date: Date of stay: April 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Right in the middle of town
Review Content: Great hotel in the middle of town. Very useful as a stopover on the way to Namibia's many activities. The staff were very friendly. I had my own vehicle and found the hotel OK but the parking is around the back. You need to drive around the block to find it. The reservation desk will validate your parking ticket. The meals were good and the bar service friendly. I would stay there again.
Date: Date of stay: May 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel bem localizado
Review Content: Hotel localizado no centro da cidade, o que permite visitar os quarteirões envolventes a pé. Quartos espaçosos, boas condições de higiene e conforto. Pequeno almoço satisfatório. O único ponto negativo são os clientes do casino que partilham espaços comuns com os hóspedes (hall de entrada/recepção, bar e varanda exterior).
Date: Date of stay: February 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent city hotel. Q
Review Content: We were placed here when bad weather disrupted our travel plans. A lovely and luxurious hotel. Great food, excellent room, quiet on the 9th floor just right for an unexpected stopover. Thank you Air Namibia.
Date: Date of stay: January 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: My home in Namibia
Review Content: It's not the newest and swankiest hotel in Windhoek but I always land up in Avani Kalahari (that's the new name of the hotel) because of the friendly staff. They exude a warmth which makes you feel like you're coming back to family. The buffet is one of the betters ones in the city too.
Date: Date of stay: November 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Pour une nuit....
Review Content: Hotel très bien situé en centre ville avec un parking prévu. La cuisine est correct, les petits déj copieux. Les chambres sont propres et grandes. C'est un bon plan pour une nuit quand on arrive ou repart de Windhoek.
Date: Date of stay: September 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Sentiments mitigés
Review Content: Les chambres sont très confortables avec un airco qui fonctionne bien. L'hôtel est bien situé au centre de Windhoeck mais manque toutefois de charme car il est localisé au premier étage d'un centre commercial. Excellente cuisine et large choix au restaurant.  Nous avons cependant malheureusement été aspergés de vin rouge par un des serveurs.  Cela peut arrriver mais on ne nous a offert aucune compensation ou excuse.  Agréable bar avec certains jours un orchestre. Piscine sur le toit mais vide de toute eau !
Date: Date of stay: August 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Hotel not accessible for disabled traveller
Review Content: The Kalahari hotel is an average hotel. While we had managed to get a disabled friendly room, access to the hotel is not really easy. No access from the parking garage, very little access from the road.  Access from the welcome centre but this is a schlep as someone has to go inside to open the door. All in all very awkward and unpleasant experience. Lifts were extremely slow = not stopping at the designated floors etc. Breakfast was good with a variety of options hot and cold buffet. Service average. Room was comfortable and accessible.
Date: Date of stay: April 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great hotel, needs better staff
Review Content: Located smack in the centre of Windhoek makes this hotel attractive indeed. And yes it is placed inside a shoppingmall and it has a casino+ why anyone finds that bad I dont really understand. You feel secure and you are not pushed into anything. Decor of the hotel is brilliant & kept clean.My room was on the 10th floor, quite good size, large comfy bed, huge flatscreen sat tv, aircon which worked perfect, safe, fridge incl 2 bottles of mineralwater per day, coffee & tea maker, bathroom is huge too, tub and shower, toiletries. Cleaning everyday and smling wonderful ladies. WIFI is NOT free, you are able to buy a variety of solutions suiting your needs, and pricing is fair and connection very good, however it should be free in a lux hotel. Pure comfort and delight.The only thing this hotel lacks is more proffesionalism from staff. First of all, if a hotel prides itself by Luxury the staff should not lie around and sleep, and at least give a nodd when greeting its guests instead of the typical african expression #empty look staring into the blue#, seems arrogant. I had the halfboard option and upon checking in I was told that all hotelbeds bookings were on room only basis....maybe so but I had booked and payed for HB. Instead of humiliating its guest by the counter, they could have checked the papers...and sure I had the halfboard option. On 3 occations I needed to defend this booking even the papers were there and upon check out I had to pay something dinnerextra anyhow- my advise to other guests, dont book the HB option because the restaurant is the biggest let down of this hotel. I am quite sure you can find better just outside the door.Its a buffet restaurant, which i usually love. There is plenty of staff, unfortunately they seem more interested in themselves having loud conversations while people waiting for their drinks etc. Finally when beeing served most female staff simply act arrogant and rude. They  dont greet you when coming into the restaurant...the carvery staff didnt care to come carve the chicken or roast...why are they there?I for sure did not feel welcome at all, and if I did not have my unaccepted HB plan I would not waste my time or money in this place. I found the food lukewarm and bland in taste.Things might look posh and modern, but a hotel is only as good as the service of its guests..Hotelstandard is indeed worth its 4 star rating, I even think it could be more- but for the guest experience I can only give 3 star and thats a shame really. Its not a cheap place to stay, so service should point in same direction..
Date: Date of stay: January 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Great central location
Review Content: This is a very good hotel with a central location. My daughter and I stayed here on an education exchange and we felt safe and cared for. Rooms are large and the bathrooms have shower and bath. Buffet breakfast is very good as are the dinners. Pool on the roof is tiny and very cold at this time of year, but it is nice to have somewhere to sit outside.
Date: Date of stay: October 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: surpeb
Review Content: This is a classic hotel. Well located .the place has shopping complex on the ground gloor which makes it very easy to do shopping. A bit expensive though but worth it.i loved it.I wouldn't mind staying there again
Date: Date of stay: July 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Central location - rooms have good standard
Review Content: We stayed at the hotel for two nights while we were planning/organizing our Namibia trip. The hotel is located very central with walking distance to major attractions, shopping malls and restaurants. Prices can be high in the season so book early. Rooms are modern, comfortable and clean. Good value for money. Only drawback: wifi is not included in the room rate and needs to be purchased. This is not acceptable for a hotel of this class and price. Every backpacker's lodge offers already free wifi anywhere in the world.
Date: Date of stay: May 2014This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Moderne et centré
Review Content: Grand hôtel de 10 étages moderne en plein centre ville. Une piscine sur le toit. Nous avons eu une grande chambre avec deux libres doubles. Salle de bain avec à la fois une baignoire et une douche séparée. Personnel avenant. Nombreux commerces et au moins deux supermarchés juste à côté. Bémol : la femme de chambre qui, à 7h 45, frappe à plusieurs reprises à la porte de notre chambre parce qu'elle voulait récupérer les draps et les serviettes!!!!! C'était le dernier matin et en prévision des longues heures de voyage qui nous attendaient, nous voulions dormir un peu plus longtemps
Date: Date of stay: October 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Zentrale Unterkunft in Windhuk
Review Content: Für den ersten Tag einer Namibia Reise eine gute Unterkunft, da zentral in Windhuk gelegen. Bewachte Parkplätze im Hotel sind vorhanden. Der Service und das Frühstück waren auch o.k. Die Zimmer waren sauber und schön eingerichtet.
Date: Date of stay: May 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: one night stay
Review Content: Rooms are large, very comfortable, all amenities. Hotel has restaurant, spa and bars. Shops around the corner, excellent location. I had to stay there because airline canceled my flight, I stayed there only for some hours but it did help to relax from that stressful situation. Didn't had time to check the casino.
Date: Date of stay: December 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice for work and rest
Review Content: Very good service, friendly personal, water for tea and cofee every day, and shampoo and conditioner and soap and all you need to get every day in 5 srtar hotel, SPA, superior breakfast and fast internet.... Very very good place for shoping too. Near the hotel very good restaurant on the coner - Gordon Blue - we like very much... 18 days in comfort... only one minus - you can not open the window and cleaner make it once a day. Room is big enough and shower is OK. We will back!
Date: Date of stay: May 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Good location, but rooms need updating
Review Content: This place is in really great central location, they arranged for us for airport transfer and it worked out very well (the airport is ridiculously far from town, at least that how it felt). The staff was very friendly and helpful, but the rooms looked like they needed some work - everything seemed kind of old, but not in the good rustic sense. I believe they were doing reconstruction on some of the floors already, so this may get a lot better soon. We had breakfast at the restaurant and it was one of the best we had during our trip.
Date: Date of stay: November 2010This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Zentrale Lage, aber nichts Besonderes
Review Content: Mitten im Zentrum Windhuks liegt das Kalahari Sands. Es ist ein Hochhaus, sieht von aussn nicht besonders schön aus. Wer ein Zimmer in den oberen Stockwerken ergattert, hat eine wunderbare Aussicht über die Stadt. Die Zimmer selbst sind OK, aber nichts Besonderes für europäische Verhältnisse. Frühstücksbuffet sehr reichhaltig. Servide bemüht. Kleiner Pool auf dem Dach, ebenso ein Mini-Fitness-Studio. Wer auf der Durchreise ist und nur ein, zwei Nächte in Windhuk verbringt, ist hier gut aufgehoben. Wer etwas mehr Individuelles sucht, ist andernorts besser aufgehoben.Ach so ein Kasino ist auch gleich im Hotel. Sieht von aussen grösser aus, als es dann tatsächlich ist.
Date: Date of stay: August 2010This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Decent
Review Content: No hardship to stay here. Don't go in expecting 5-star service as you might get it in North America, but it's comfortable and decent, and we got a good rate for staying longer. The rooms are clean, the bathrooms are modern and clean, there are no weird smells, non-smoking really means non-smoking (not next to smoking rooms so you still have to deal with the smell), the breakfast buffet is excellent (number of items, choice, selection, freshness).Hotel elevators are still slow (as reported by people as far back as Feb. 2009) but it's no big deal.Internet is available in the rooms although it isn't super fast. Those people that have trouble getting on-line may have older computers.No gym but there is a spa. Quality of the services is average but the prices are good compared to Europe and North America. e.g. 60 min. massage for 25 euros.Room service is decent too. Quality of the meals is great, speed of service is excellent and the price is good too, especially for room service! e.g. the beef burger is only 3.50 euros!
Date: Date of stay: July 2009This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Old Darling needing a facelift (or two)
Review Content: I have stayed at Kalahari Sands twice. Both times, the lifts have not been working properly resulting in long waiting times - which can be as long as 15 minutes.The property is undergoing some sort of refurbishment, which caused some noise during the day. Otherwise, the hotel is very quiet and peaceful.The rooms I have stayed in were quite spacious and decent. Nothing fancy, but a solid slightly worn ***-gear. Bathroom was clean, but again not from the latest collections.The front office staff was very kind and efficient. They even knew that the wireless network is not strong in the room allocated for me and asked if I wanted another.As some earlier reviews discounted the dinner buffet, I decided to try it. It was not actually so bad, but neither was it something special. I think it will not be difficult to find better alternatives. The lobby bar serves some light meals, which are better value for money. The staff at the bar is slightly uninterested, but they are an exemption from the rest. The bar houses also some local entrepreneurs, which may make it inconvenient for other ladies or those with children.There also is a small roof-top pool and a couple of sun chairs. It usually is a nice and quiet place, if you somehow manage to get up there… the same dysfunctional lifts referred to earlier should take you here. In the interest of time, I took the stairs.The location of the hotel is very good. There are many nice restaurants just around the corner. The area, and especially Independence Avenue, usually is safe during daylight, however the streets behind the hotel may not be.
Date: Date of stay: March 2008This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
